Developers no longer support this app. Do not buy the premium version, as you will NOT be able to sync across devices. There are no more updates or customer support. This could have been the absolute best habit tracking app. So much wasted potential.

Great in a lot of ways, but a huge drawback is that you can't edit the start date or previous inactivated/activated dates for a habit. So, if you've been doing a habit for a few weeks before you add it to the program, you can't record those two weeks of success in the program. Or, if you intentionally stopped a habit for a time period, but didn't inactivate it during your chosen time off, your percentage is dragged down.

its a great app in general, just want a couple of tweaks that would make using it more streamlined. The biggest thing is I have goals that increase incrementally every day, I would love to have a way to have a yes or no that shows that incremental adjustment. Also, when inputting numerically set goals, I want to be able to just start typing the number and have it replace the default 0.0 without placing the cursor and backspacing to enter a result. Still, the interface is otherwise great!

Please fix the widget! I want to check items off here. It's good for what I needed. Simple. Good stats. Like the for color coding. Don't really need the chats on topics, I don't look at or use that. I wanted more than 5 items on my list and the widget for easy tracking on my home screen. The widget only works sporadically to check off an item, that's annoying considering I paid the one time fee. Apparently it's known issue, should've read more reviews and maybe not purchased.

love the tracking, love the accountability. I use the widget, but I dont like that you can't split habits into "profile" type structures. for example, an "AM" Routine list of check offs, and a "PM" Routine. maybe those and a list of habits you just want to complete daily at any time. that would be a game changer for me. I've considered other apps because of that one missing feature. I dont like how the widget groups every single habit Into one list. I want to split habits up between multiple.

It's good as a free app to track 5 habits, but just okay as a subscription app for the perks. And only at their offered 50% discounted rate of 4.99, too. That is, unless you actually want reminders. The reminders don't work, regardless of setting, including battery saver being on or off, and/or whitelisting the app. Waste of $5 bucks, but I might reinstall to use it for free.

The purposes is good, registration was fast without e-mail verification but I do not know if there is a way to getting the account back once, if the users forgot about it. Next, I did not really like the interface because it was not really neat while the fact there is other similar apps from Play Store to compete. And the features are not easy for new users, it has a lot of things to learn. The inspirational images has bugs, it did not shown. I hope there is improvement in the future!

App keeps crashing, notifications don't work. This app used to work just fine but it just simply broke a few months ago. I still just it but because notifications don't work is affecting my habits and the data I need.

the app interface could benefit from a modern design makeover. it looks outdated and stuck in the past. the widgets don't work. the forum/general discussion section was interesting because the people there really tried to be helpful.

Love it, but notifications won't work. I've emailed support and no answer. I've confirmed notifications are enabled for this app and still nothing even though I have reminders set daily. Used to work. Edit - now I'm getting a frequent crashes warning. S23 Ultra

Great app could you add an option to hide some habits from wedget page only. Like on wedget some habits can be hidden and if i open app it should be visible. [ I want to track them but don't want to see on the daily basis ] please add this.

Dead app! The basic functionality is great and helped me get into habits. After some functionality stopped working, I tried reaching out with no response. I also saw other reviews that mention similar issues. I have ended my subscription to move onto another app, but if you're enjoying the free version (which has a limited number of habits you can use), it is fantastic.

Great app so long as you only use the free version which only tracks 5 x habits. Used the free version for a couple of weeks then paid Â£9.49 for the platinum version so I could sync to other devices. Really disappointed that the sync option won't work, and software support is non existent. For an expensive app I would expect the developers to be as helpful as possible when a customer has an issue but they have completely ignored my request for help!
Widgets no longer work.
It hasn't been updated since Aug 2023. That explains why my phone is sending me reports of it crashing a lot.
Love this app but I miss not being able to use the widget.

Widgets broken since last update. This was the best habit tracker ever, but since the last updates my widgets are no longer interactive. I've tried troubleshooting, disabling battery optimization, and even reinstalling the app but the widgets still don't work interactively
bad ui transition

Great UI, reminder notifications are useful although the humor is not my style. Docking the stars because the export csv option has disappeared and the CSVs I got in the past were kind of a weird format. Emails to the dev at the email in the app about this feature have not been returned, it's been a couple weeks. Just saw that the app email in Google Play is now a different company so it may have been sold

App keeps crashing, notifications don't work. This app used to work just fine but it just simply broke a few months ago. I still just it but because notifications don't work is affecting my habits and the data I need.

The purposes is good, registration was fast without e-mail verification but I do not know if there is a way to getting the account back once, if the users forgot about it. Next, I did not really like the interface because it was not really neat while the fact there is other similar apps from Play Store to compete. And the features are not easy for new users, it has a lot of things to learn. The inspirational images has bugs, it did not shown. I hope there is improvement in the future!
A very good app it is helping me achieve my goal
Notifications have stopped working in the last few months. I'm on Android 14, Pixel 6. Developer doesn't seem to respond to emails or comments. Other than that, it does the job!
Sometimes it close by itself after I clicked on something. I hope the interface can be better

the app interface could benefit from a modern design makeover. it looks outdated and stuck in the past. the widgets don't work. the forum/general discussion section was interesting because the people there really tried to be helpful.
Offers more than most habit trackers do, with an easy interface and fun reminders! However, it has stopped giving me reminders for a couple of weeks now, so beware of that...

Great app could you add an option to hide some habits from wedget page only. Like on wedget some habits can be hidden and if i open app it should be visible. [ I want to track them but don't want to see on the daily basis ] please add this.

Love it, but notifications won't work. I've emailed support and no answer. I've confirmed notifications are enabled for this app and still nothing even though I have reminders set daily. Used to work. Edit - now I'm getting a frequent crashes warning. S23 Ultra
Great app to develop new habits! Update: Pls fix this! Could not mark habits through widget

Dead app! The basic functionality is great and helped me get into habits. After some functionality stopped working, I tried reaching out with no response. I also saw other reviews that mention similar issues. I have ended my subscription to move onto another app, but if you're enjoying the free version (which has a limited number of habits you can use), it is fantastic.
It's Good
Could be better if widgets allowed marking tasks/goals done without needing to reopen the app unpredictably.
Good up for habit tracking

Basic version works as described; just not what I need. The habits I want to improve require reminders at different times of day. And I'm personally not finding it an effective incentive, especially 'starting over' if missing one time. That's kind of a carrot AND stick approach. I'll stick to a simple checklist of what, & calendar/alarm clock to remind me when. Making this app's functions kind of ...basic and redundant? And since all apps use space... well, uninstalled. But the app works fine.

Absolutely love this app. 4 out of 5 for two reasons. One, navigation, I think swiping between habits rather than scrolling would be a better interphase and also more intuitive. Scrolling habits only goes one direction, swiping could go both, as long as you're off the calendar. Two, the free version only can track five habits. I'll probably buy the app for full access, because this truly is a good app. However just a few more, say 10 instead of 5 in the free version would've been appreciated.

Regardless of my free version this app's intention is to help it's users increase positive habits and reduce negative habits. For someone like me who needs feedback, the percentage of success gives me an incentive and motivates me to keep the chain going. After using this app for almost two months I have been able to analyze and critique a few of the apps features. It would be interesting to know scientific statistics of the success of the app and if it is successful in what it is set out to do. In regards to the level of engagement I would say that the percentage strategy keeps me coming back to this app. For functionality, the free version runs smoothly, is clear, and easy to use. For aesthetics, it is simple and convenient however I do think that for some users it might be difficult to see due to size of buttons and font size. The information is a bit outdated and needs to be cited and should come from more credible sources. I do enjoy seeing that there is a discussion board for communication between users. From my subjective analysis this app's rating is a 4.1.

I love this app for easily tracking my habits to work towards personal goals. There's only two things that could make this app better: being able to disable decimals on specific habits (to count full numbers would be great as you do sets of a workout and make updating the count easier) and not losing the progress of a goal if you change the specifications to meet it (like going from doing 10 to 20 pushups a day and not losing the streak from before the change was made).

Great for tracking your bad habits, making new good ones, and building a better lifestyle for yourself. Bought the full version for more habit tracking, which is great if you are dedicated, but $7.99 is a pretty hefty price for just 100 habits, some inspirational quotes, and a mediocre social system. It has helped me better myself over the past week of using it, so I'd highly recommend trying it, at least in the limited free version before buying the full version.

This app is literally the only thing that reminds me to take my meds. I love getting the notifications and tracking my progress so easily. However I just upgraded to the pro version specifically for the sync capability and...it does not work. -1 star. For $10, I would hope that the one feature I wanted would function like it's supposed to. I'm not happy about that at all. The home screen widget comes in handy so it's not a total loss but that alone is not worth the price. Please fix syncing!

The app is simple enough if all you need is a way to keep track of daily successes. The free version doesn't come with any of the motivational stuff, which is a bummer. I also wish there was a way to update a goal moving forward. For example, if I set a goal to drink 60 ounces of water a day for 2 months, but I later want to change it to 80 ounces a day, I either update the goal (which changes any previous days less than 80 to failures), or start a new goal which forfeits the streak.

Used it on & off for years. Motivational but not annoying like some. Nice design, various views (week, month, specific habit progress). Wide variety of goal options such as doing something x amount of times a week or every x day of the week or month. ALL the stats. You can set a date to achieve the goal (app recommends like 60 I think). Discussion boards. Other features as well, I just don't use them much. All in all, great app.

Nice configuration settings. Able to set most goals. One setting that I couldn't get to work for me was trying to get a goal for every other day. It seemed to that the goal needed to be completed every second day and comoleting it on off days didn't work. The UI is slightly un-intuitive as well. I don't think swiping up on a goal calendar should swap to another goal. It makes it hard to scroll down to the community form at the bottom if the app.

The one major short-coming of this app. (and most other "habit trackers") is that it does not have any option to calculate a total number (amount of hours, etc.) for a week or month--only a number of days or per day...That is a gaping deficit in these app's (with the exception of one or two with less desirable formats), as it is a far better way to track things like sleep which may fluctuate from.day to day. The other dismaying factor is that Habitbull doesn't seem to have any customer service, as I e-mailed numerous times about issues trying to upgrade (because it is a really helpful/useful application), and never got any response in about a year's time. :-\ Aside from the tabulation inadequacy discussed above--which I really hope they'll address/include that capability, it is a really helpful and useful app., and can be especially helpful for people with issues such as depression or "OCD" who may have difficulty keeping a handle on self-care and/or productivity (though, it could, also have the opposite effect, if people with "OCD" get too immersed in tracking things in their day-to-day :-S). In general, it is a good tool to have, though, and can help you make a lot of progress on things like household projects, etc., but I really do wish that they'd adjust it so that you can calculate a total for a duration of time longer than a day, and that they would also be conscientious about customer service/support and responding to/fielding correspondence and issues people encounter. ~*Kristin Star*
Simple user interface. Easy to use and super helpful if you want to start and keep a new habit. Thanks for the team behind it. keep up the good work.
It's fine for the free version
Nice
been great so far

ð˜¼ð™¨ ð™– ð™ˆð™ªð™¨ð™¡ð™žð™¢, ð™„'ð™«ð™š ð™›ð™¤ð™ªð™£ð™™ ð™©ð™ð™žð™¨ ð™–ð™–ð™¥ ð™«ð™šð™§ð™® ð™ð™šð™¡ð™¥ð™›ð™ªð™¡ ð™›ð™¤ð™§ ð™¢ð™šð™¢ð™¤ð™§ð™žð™¨ð™žð™£ð™œ ð™©ð™ð™š ð™Œð™ªð™§ð™–ð™£ ð™†ð™–ð™§ð™šð™šð™¢ . ð˜¼ð™¨ ð™žð™© ð™ð™šð™¡ð™¥ð™¨ ð™¢ð™š ð™©ð™¤ ð™˜ð™¤ð™£ð™©ð™žð™£ð™ªð™š ð™¢ð™® ð™¨ð™©ð™§ð™šð™–ð™ .
Good
App is good thank you...
Quite nice so far! Simple to use.
I am still new to the app. I do like it so far. Free version seems to have what I need to get going on habit tracking
I love this app, no adds. It's easy to use. You can add comments to your goals and it has reminders.

Outstanding habit tracker app that is highly configurable to track daily, weekly, or any frequency of habits needed. Simple and clean user interface. Only thing I would change is adding the ability to change the order of habits. Right now, the habits appear on the screen in the order you entered them, and there does not appear to be a way to change the order

This app is perfect for tracking my habits. It allows an effective level of depth without being overwhelming. I have been using this for several months and I love it. The only thing I would like to see would be "Milestones" to increase/decrease a habit without retroactively turning past week successes into failures. For example, increasing a workout habit from 2x/wk to 3x/wk.

Easy to set up and daily tracking is very simple. Visual display is great. If a habit is set for every other day, or with some other gap in between, the app shows a chain with open circles rather than solidly-colored circles. Likewise, if the goal is a specific number of minutes or repetitions, it color-codes the entry differently depending on whether you met or did fewer reps than the goal. Only using the free app for now but plan to upgrade.

I really like how easy it is to use, that it displays your progress in a neat and easy-to-track way, and gives you options for how to measure your success (yes/no per day, #of days per week, days you want to succeed and days you can 'cheat', etc). It's pretty satisfying to tap the little circle for a thing I did and see it turn green and link up with other days! Would definitely recommend.

Great habit tracking app. The only things I think could be improved are: goal dates not automatically pushing back to match the day you edited a habit. And being able to edit how you want to track a habit if you change your mind. Maybe I missed something, but it seems like you have to recreate a habit in order to change how to keep track of it (ex. Yes/No or by keeping count with numbers). I highly recommend this tool though, it's a great place to start keeping track of habits!

I downloaded a bunch of habit-tracking apps to test them out before New Year's. Habitbull seemed the most intuitive and straightforward. I really like the design (shows the streak on the calendar) and the fact that it nudges you if you don't check in during the day. There's even a community function where you can share the struggle with others doing the same thing. Great app.

I use this app to track various symptoms of my IBS. I also tried HabitHub and Loop, but only this app allowed me to track on a daily basis how many times a certain symptom occurred, and also set "goals" based on either "no more than" and "no fewer than" a given number of occurrences. I preferred the interface and graphs (I'd like to see a chart of raw numbers instead of just pass/fail) in some of the other apps, but from a purely functional standpoint this is the one to beat.

I've only had this a week and so far I love it!! Easy to use, nice visually, and I really appreciate that you can set what days of the week the goal can be accomplished and that you can choose how the goal will be reached (y/n, certain number, etc). You only get 5 goals with the free version and no back-up on the cloud but for now that works for me. There is a way to reorder your goals (when looking at them on the menu bar under My Order, press and hold goal, then drag), or you can see by score

I didn't think this app was much at first, but I soon started to get into the swing of things I've been trying to get myself into for the longest time after installing. There's just something about that feeling of satisfaction when you fill in a circle for completing something. It tracks your streaks and your average progress. It also encourages you with cute quotes about being yourself and being the best you! Forming (or breaking) a habit can be done easily with Habit Bull!

This app has been great for me, especially to track daily goals I set for myself. it shows me the days I have succeeded, and the days Ive fallen short. I can see a history of my success and setup reminders to make sure I don't miss a daily goal. I've been using the app for a little over a month now and highly recommend it to anyone who has daily goals they want to rack and be successful with!
Nice app, also supports Russian language, unfortunately no Russian style calendar
Perfect
Helps a lot to track my goals
Very encouraging! This app keeps me motivated, when I feel like giving up.
great
Very good app
Helpful for me remembering things i need to do, build & stick to a routine.
Simple layout, no unneeded notifications
That's awesome. I've chosen 2 or 3 habits to keep (eg training and bible reading) for six months at least. And it's working fine! Haven't miss a day.
No BS. This app is very customizable and just does that it says on the tin - tracks habits. No invasive ads.

Way overcomplicated for a simple To Do List app. You need to create a task, search through the extremely limited icons, set the XP and coins you get from it, set the XP and coins you lose if you miss it, set all the skills you improve, set the percentages of how much for all of the above, set the reoccurance (which is about 3 steps in and of itself), turn on notifications, tell it WHEN to notify, and finally, save it. For every single task. That's not even getting into the premium features yet.

The constant "turn on notifications" popup made me uninstall this immediately after testing it out. It seems fine if you want notifications on, but there is no way to turn it off without it making the app frustrating to use. Ive found with these types of apps the notifications come at the worst times and are distracting, so i do not want them on at all. Seems counterintuitive when the app is meant to help accomplish tasks, to force a distraction during them.

Could be good if basic features like icons weren't locked behind a paid subscription. Update: your calling THEMES an advanced feature because you want to not because it is one.... Sorry but changing the background color to black, which it should be in the first place isn't an advanced feature, it's about one line of code. I'm a software engineer myself and know the difference between the two. Same goes for icons which are essentially to app functionality. Check out Notion for a great example.
replyContent:
Thanks for the review.
Most app features are open for all users in free version. Exceptions are some advanced features like calendar, smart groups and visual enhancements like icons and themes.

content: I love this app! So much that I opted to pay for the permanent subscription. There's just one thing that I don't find great. No Google calendar integration, and no dedicated calendar widget. I could survive of either of these two features existed, but not having either makes it a pain to use. When I schedule tasks, I now have to duplicate them in my Google calendar. What a hassle! I emailed the developer, and got no response whatsoever, so I'm hoping they at least read the reviews!

Enough with the pop-up ads! I don't mind if an app has ads, but if I'm going to be interrupted by a 15 second video every 5 seconds while I'm checking off my list I'm deleting your app. And no, I'm not going to subscribe just because you keep popping up the subscription page. If I have to pay to make the app decently usable, you may as well require I pay for it to begin with.
replyContent: We are sorry for this, but to continue work on this app we need revenue from ads. If you don't want to see the ads you can purchase the subscription. We'll also review and decrease ads quantity. Thanks for your understanding!

content: Crippled version without even a way to purchase outright. EDIT: I'll be clearer. Many apps features are disabled. But there is no way to just buy the app. The only option is some ongoing payment subscription which makes no sense as this app does not provide any ongoing or backend service, it's just an app! and a simple one at that. It's like going to buy a water bottle and going to check out they take your credit card info and charge you the same price every year that you use the bottle. Bottom line, it's just a scummy business practice.
replyContent:
Dear User,
Could you please contact us via liferpgtasks@gmail.com? We'd love to hear more about this issue in order to assist you.

content: The app is great, I love it. However, I'm giving it one star because there is a bug that is breaking my workflow! After the last update, Everytime that I go to the task list section in order to search for a specific task, and click the magnifying glass button, the application closes automatically. I cannot search for a task after this :(

All right so to be clear, this app is amazing and I'm really happy to see that someone has made their own version of it! Even though it's such a great program, it became unusable at day one. It had bugs and limitations that hindered what I was attempting to accomplish. Problems such as: inaccurate characteristics, no quick access from rewards to inventory, non removable default achievements, inaccurate values on skills after undoing a task and hidden xp multiplier from skills to characteristics.
replyContent:
Sorry to hear you are unsatisfied with the app. I hope you can enjoy our app again in the future. Meanwhile we'll work on problems you enlisted to increase app quality.
Thank you for the review.

content: This app will create a "Review my tasks" reminder when you launch it for the first time and by default will set the reminder to "5 hours before". This can mean it will wake you up in the middle of the night with this reminder playing a loud notification sound. It ignores the Do not disturb mode of the phone. It fails to show any visual notification so you will not know why your phone is making sounds in the middle of the night.
replyContent:
Thanks for bringing that up.
I'll review this task and especially notifications sound in Do not disturb mode.

content: With one of the recent updates intrusive Ads have been introduced. While I totally get that ad-free will not finance the effort of development, this kind of Ads (ad video autoplaying full screen every 4(!!) task ticks) is totally inacceptable. I was about to give a good rating and buying plus soon, but this killed it for me. Sad.
Frauds
didn't really work that well

Way overcomplicated for a simple To Do List app. You need to create a task, search through the extremely limited icons, set the XP and coins you get from it, set the XP and coins you lose if you miss it, set all the skills you improve, set the percentages of how much for all of the above, set the reoccurance (which is about 3 steps in and of itself), turn on notifications, tell it WHEN to notify, and finally, save it. For every single task. That's not even getting into the premium features yet.
Ads
Way too many intrusive ads Unusable for me No way to one time purchase a version without ads
replyContent: We are sorry for this, but to continue work on this free app, we need revenue from Ads. If you don't want to see the Ads, you can purchase Premium version in Menu > Upgrade to Premium. There's also an option to make one time purchase if you prefer it.

content: Locking the dark mode theme behind a paywall is not a user-friendly decision. A theme, especially something as basic as dark mode, is not a functionality. I'd use the app more with dark mode to test and determine if the premium features are worth investing in. Please consider making it accessible to all users.
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback. We have 2 default themes available for everyone - one light and second dark. It's first 2 themes on Menu > Themes screen. If any of those 2 are not available for you, please reach us out via email - support@do-it-now.app. Since that's probably a bug.

content: It gives you a set of random tasks and you can't remove them. I tried to remove them so I could set my own and it just removed them from one day and subtracted a bunch of gold from my character. Customization is kind of important for an app like this, but I guess the creator disagrees.
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback. I suppose you've used Fail task button (with X mark) instead of Delete button (with trash icon or as text). There are multiple ways how tasks can be deleted. Task can be longclicked and in toolbar menu Delete option can be clicked. When task details is opened - toolbar menu also has Delete button. Same on edit screen.

content: I could build a better experience with exel.
The quality of the app is very low and slow and it has ads. There are many problems.
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback, we would really appreciate it if you share your thoughts on places where the app can be improved. As of ads - most of the app features are available without purchases, and we use revenue from the ads to have it this way.

content: The constant "turn on notifications" popup made me uninstall this immediately after testing it out. It seems fine if you want notifications on, but there is no way to turn it off without it making the app frustrating to use. Ive found with these types of apps the notifications come at the worst times and are distracting, so i do not want them on at all. Seems counterintuitive when the app is meant to help accomplish tasks, to force a distraction during them.

This is a great app that I use daily. The "Autofail" and "Autoskip" options are also a good feature so that I don't have to spend a lot of time going through each task. My only problem is that some deleted tasks are still Autofailing, despite updating the app numerous times. Update: Changed rating to 2 stars and Uninstalled app. I emailed support and received no response. The app lost its utility with continued deductions for deleted tasks.
replyContent: Thank you for downloading our app. We'd love to help you with this issue. Please write to us at support@do-it-now.app so that we can help you better.

content: Ads are full screen, loud and intrusive. Simple things like icons to identify tasks are restricted without purchase. What should be a few bucks instead costs $45.99 to permanently get the full use of without ads. However, i find this app's potential exceptional, which is why im not giving it only 1 star. Restricting the needed icons and placing an inventory limit on number of items you can hold makes this app extremely frustrating. Virtually useless without full version, yet not worth the price.
replyContent: Sorry for inconvenience, but I need to monetize the app to support it and improve. I'm trying to add as less premium features as possible. For example, there are few dozens of free isons that you can use for tasks and other items.

content: Spending $10 once or $5/year for a subscription would make sense to me; but paying $15/year to use a to-do list (when discounted) is really excessive. This is a great tool - actually, I love it; but I find it ridiculous to pay so much just to TEMPORARILY unlock basic features like a calendar. Edit: Since writing the above review, I've found cheaper/free alternatives. The one I'm using is called Treat Yourself. It's free and doesn't look great, but it serves my needs just right and I love it.
replyContent:
Thank you for the review.
Subscription not only allows you to use advanced features like calendar or smart groups, but also allows to improve and polish app. Users interest and support with subscriptions allowed to create a lot of features in the app, including calendar. By the way, right now we have discounts on all types of subscriptions.

content: Initially I enjoyed the app very much, even despite the difficulty with setup. I enjoyed it enough I purchased the premium - I was very soon annoyed with my purchase. I have subtasks not showing in the parent tasks unless I have absurd conditions met, I have subtasks failing 6 times when it auto fails and when trying to restore them to remove them it fails over again stacking up loss of XP and such. I don't enjoy spending time bugs to save my earned XP and such. Too difficult, too many issues.

Seems like RPG is a buzz word that just anyone can use to slap on a program. It looks like a decent tracker and planner for sure. And if that's all you need ignore this review, but RPG is a Game first, something that's fun to Play and can insert yourself into. There's no story , no adventure, which makes achieving a goal an empty win. It's nothing new compared to the other planners with weighted rewards.
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback.
Do It Now is not a game and we never said that it is. In fact even category says that it's a tool (Apps, Productivity). Do It Now helps to add gamification elements to you real life and to achieve more goals as consequence. It adds more motivation to do things which you won't do otherwise.

content: I started getting notifications but all came at the same time instead of their specified times, so just removed them and no longer use. Biggest feature I would like see fixed is there seem to be issues with using the "Today" option for the task list Widget. Sometimes will only show one task and sometimes when I can complete all my tasks, the next day the list doesn't refresh, still says "All tasks are done!"
replyContent: Usually this problem is related to app system settings where notifications are forbidden or to battery saver which could also block notifications from apps. Please double check this settings.

content: Doesn't crash anymore. However, I went to upgrade to pro and found (surprise!) a subscription model. Negative. One time purchase is almost $50. BIG negative. Does not provide nearly enough value to justify that price tag or a subscription. As far as I can tell, everything is stored locally. So what am I paying for? Hard pass.
replyContent: Hi, sorry to hear youâ€™ve been experiencing some crash issues. Please contact us at support@do-it-now.app and share as much information as you can. And we will investigate your case. Thank you for posting!

content: I was very excited for this app to help schedule my day or build to do like lists and set some goals. The app is not super user friendly. If there was any constructive criticism I could add is it would be very helpful if there was a database to get settings achievements, tasks, and rewards out of instead of having to build everything yourself. Also a guideline on how to build things properly with exp and coins. (How much for what tasks).
replyContent: Got it, thanks for the feedback and suggestions.

content: A lot of work was put into this. I love the idea of it. I just got this, and I was looking through the app, seeing what I can do. I love the features and what you can do. You can use the app, without buying stuff but what your selling it for is crazy. $46 for one time purchase is a bit much for a task reminder. Or $10-$20 for half or full year. I love the app. I would pay for it if payment is $2.49 one time purchase. Or $12.99 for one time purchase, instead of a 6 months.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. App has a lot of free features, it's not mandatory to purchase anything at all to use almost all main feaures.

content: From South Carolina, went to California for work a few months Go and my app was messing up the time I have set for autofails/autoskips. Stuff that I should have all day to complete is auto failing early. Now I'm in Texas for work and it's doing the same thing. I'm currently a subscription member. Just made a monthly payment today. But this might have to be my last month until you can fix the timing issue.
replyContent: Thank you for the heads up. We'll work more on issues related to time zone change.

content: I keep getting charged after canceling subscription and deleted app. I want to cancel if there is a way possible but I can't find it on the app.

Great potential but many things need to change. Skills don't have an Importance, like tasks do. It's obvious that different people prioritize different skills over others, so skills should be viewable, sortable, by this importance, and a radar chart of them wouldn't be bad either. Many items, overview required, so radar charts and minimaps are the way to provide it. Make it happen and I'll gladly â­â­â­â­â­ you. Just help me get things in order here, I need to see more than poorly organized lists.

userName: White black sensation Pills toads and venoms (Advanced hard soft bulll)
content: Auto install null x cvb null
Love the app, but i can't seem to get it to load properly right now like at all!? Edit: app works for a little bit before i have to close it and restart it. Kinda annoying but the app is worth it
replyContent: Could you please update to the last version of the app? We've improved app stability and fixed various issues with the app. Hope it will help to solve your problem

content: Every time I start the app I am asked to allow notifications. Every time I click "Don't allow" because I don't want notifications. The app works fine beyond that but please remove the annoying pop up.

Following the devs on social media is a preloaded task and if you delete it, you lose "points". The app looks good enough, but that's an immediate uninstall for me. Don't penalize or punish people that are trying to improve themselves for not following your social media. That's kinda scummy.
A little too complicated and not exactly what I was looking for
The UI is very mediocre.
Not very user friendly and auto pushes you some alienating goals

This app throws an error that I don't have google play services enabled or that it's out of date, which is none of it is true. This is on my tablet. On phone it works fine but I very much rather use it on my tablet. Sucks. I would have payed the $35 if it worked. Hopefully dev can comment or fix it.

Take my review with a grain of salt as I did not have it downloaded for very long. When you first boot it up, the app has several tasks already set up as examples. Trying to delete these tasks my first time accidentally told the app that I just didn't complete any of them, which gave my character a negative score from the get go. Then going into the settings I found the way to delete everything which included the helpful stats for different tasks. It quickly became a chore so I uninstalled.

I really like the depth of this tracker, including skills, titles, really more of an Elder Scrolls feel, and personally, seeing myself being lacking in certain skills would motivate me to add more tasks that would improve those. I was all set to subscribe and spend too many hours customizing the experience curve, all of the tasks and their various skills, and really dig into the advanced features, but then I hit the deal breaker. There is no web interface for this app. Everything has to be set up on your phone. I love having notifications and a checklist on my phone to keep up with repeating tasks, habits, and to-dos on the go, but I'm looking for an app to add dozens of things to initially, and continue adding and modifying as time goes on, but to have to do that on my Note 20+ is just something I'm not on board with. I need to be able to pull it up on my computer as I'm working to check things off, or see my next scheduled task. By picking up my phone being the only way to check what I need to do, it sets me up for failure, because my phone is a distraction I'm trying to use less while working. And since I'm working from home now, there's no accountability, so that temptation to check my facebook notifications is strong. If there was a way to open this on a browser (and not through some janky android emulator, or using my chromebook, because I don't use that for work) then I'd already be neck deep in it, but sadly I'm stuck using an app that replaces the reward of tracking real life stat progression with digital outfits for your avatar, something I couldn't care less about. Please get a browser interface going!!
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. I'm planning to work on the web version of the app in future, but it will be rather distant futur since I'm the only one developer behind the whole project.

content: I really enjoyed the concept, used it for about a year and paid. What ultimately stopped me from using it is it is not user friendly and glitched constantly. It wouldn't keep my settings even though I changed the default. Or populate tasks on my widget. Format for setting up recurring events is hard to navigate and it kept duplicating and deleting tasks when using desktop version. Basically an awesome concept performed poorly. I think if more resources were put in to this app it would be epic!
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback. I'm constantly working on the app and doing my best to make it as useful as possible.

content: It's a good start...I currently have a 1 month subscription. Needs more habit type features. Needs to track , display and keep a record of current and longest streaks. Repeat option needs much more options like; 1. A way to track a task that's done a certain number of times a day like 3 times a day. 2. Repeat week, should also have the option to have the task done a certain amount of days not just on specific days. 3. Achievements should have an option for completing consecutive days.
replyContent: Thanks for the review and great suggestions.

content: I went from touching the app once a day to once a week, over the span of about 2 months. Would be better if notifications were functional/ could be enabled. I like the concept of being a hero, though. I just always fail all my daily set tasks (repeatedly back to level 0 hahaha...) -- I stick to my sticky notes app (with reminders) that I've been using for years. [Edit 11/10/19]: I see notifications on appear on my phone now! Thank you.
replyContent:
Thanks for the review.
Could you please check if app has notifications enabled in system settings and in battery settings.
On some devices they are disabled by default and app just can't show notifications.

content: This app is incredibly unintuitive. Attempting to create an event with specific start and end dates is overcomplicated. I still can't get the "specific dates" option to function properly in the calendar. The app freezes if you delete the preset characteristics. This should not have left beta with so many duplication errors. Please fix this. I regret paying for this app. Edit: Additionally, deleting an occurrence of a reoccurring task only ones previous entries in it's place.
replyContent: Oh no! We sincerely apologize for the troubles you've had with the app. We'd be happy to take a look into this for you, please contact us at support@do-it-now.app. Thank you.

content: I think it deletes some of my scheduled tasks. I also don't like how it automatically adds tasks for you. I want a "to do" app so I can add my own stuff not what others think I should do. The rpg aspect is great and I love it. As an amateur gamer that is cool, easy to use, and being able to add skills and characteristics is awesome. I liked this app A LOT, but unfortunately I can't stress over correcting it. Maybe I'll get back to it someday.

I used to use Habitica, and I must say this is a great step up. I'd like to see more social features, such as sharing tasks - only one person has to perform said task for it to be checked off, but only giving that person the experience and gold. Otherwise, the price for subscription is too steep, thus resulting in a sub-perfect score. I could easily justify $0.99/month or eternal subscription for $15. If that price could be met, as well as fine tuning, this would be easily worth 5 stars.
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback.
I suppose I'll work more on social features in future. Great idea on shared tasks by the way. I was thinking on group tasks which should be done by everyone in a group, but I like your approach more.

content: The app is great for the most part, i just wish that the 'notification option' for tasks would actually alert me. No alarm or even a pop-up message. I got this to help me remember to take care of certain things due to memory issues, but it's not gonna be of any help if i can't even remember i have the app. Please fix the alarm notification system.
replyContent: I understand how annoying that must be. I'm working on a solution. I hope you'll re-consider the rating once I fix the issue.

content: Almost perfect... I only wish it had more to do with the "game" aspect. It's basically a to-do list or planner. Sure, it gives you some "gold" and experience points based on your completed tasks, but they amount to nothing, as there is nothing to do with either once collected. No built-in items to purchase, no character creation or customisation... disappointing. That being said, the tasks are easy to create and customise. I feel more organised than usual. So, thanks, I guess.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. Have you tried using Rewards section? It will allow you to use gold to purchase rewards and get some goodies in real life.

content: The UI is a bit bulky, and it automatically makes multiples of custom tasks sometimes?? But it would otherwise be a good app if it weren't for the ads and INCESSANT paywalls man. Idk how much it costs, and i didn't wanna know. I just wanted to try it for a bit first before making any decisions. Paywall for completing too many tasks, paywall for calendar, paywall for custom stuff (understandable), etc. I had to uninstall. If you're going to charge and spam me with greed, at least make it good

Setting things up can be a bit confusing but overall it's good. The notifications aren't working on my phone, and when setting the task to something that can be completed all day, I'd like to be able to set times for me to get notifications about it without having to do the weird "give me a notification 12 hours before" The whole point of me getting a to-do list app was to have not only a list, but reminders, so until the notifications work I'll have to resort to a different app.
replyContent: I understand how annoying that must be. I'm working on a solution. I hope you'll re-consider the rating once I fix the issue.

content: It's not bad. But it seems greedy. Like, why do I have to pay to unlock individual color themes if I'm paying a monthly subscription? Also, LifeRPG was so much better than this. More icons to choose from and they were free. If you're going to make an app that copies all the ideas from LifeRPG, at least make it better. Why can't I make an accomplishment like: learned blank piece of music, without having to tie it to accomplishing a certain number of tasks or reaching a certain level?

This app is really great, but I have some pros and cons. It's obvious that this concept has been received well,but I would say it's executions are poor. I did not get any kind of tutorial for this,and thus I had to feel it out. I love that you can manipulate the values of each task and how influences each characteristic and skill. I don't like that you can't go back and fill in tasks for yesterday. I'm forgetful in the first place so it wouldbnice. & the look of the app itself isnt very pretty.

This app seems really well designed and I would love to be able to use it, but unfortunately it has a critical flaw that forced me to uninstall it. Whenever this app is running and I try to open the alarms from the top menu on my phone, the entire clock app will crash and restart. If I force quit Do It Now, the clock app resumes behaving normally. This happened on both my Pixel 5a and Pixel 6a.

I'm sure some of what I experienced could be addressed, but the little things kept piling up: -Certain things are on autofail but history shows no failures -Items that failed/passed the day before aren't showing up in history for hours -Marked something as done but it alerted me to address it an hour later (multiple times) -Got notices to perform tasks that weren't scheduled for that day Plus others! Loved this app but finally gave it up.
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback.
And sorry for inconvenience, I'm constantly working to make app better and fixing small and bigger issues.

content: I love the idea of this app. However it could use some work and it's not 100% what I'm looking for. It needs a tutorial where you set up characteristics, skills, and just set up your profile insted of redoing everything. Also, I want to be able to set a time frame not a specific day. Say i have a goal to organize one section of the house once a week, I can't do that, I have to pick a day. I'd like to have daily, weekly, & monthly goals that have to be done by the end of the period of time.

This seems like a great app, but if you fall off the wagon or take a long vacation, with dozens of daily tasks, then there's no realistic way to recover, because you have to dismiss potentially thousands of pass/fails until you can get a list of just current and relevant tasks remaining for today. Multi-select helps, but still no good after a summer break, or older user with a 12 tasks triggering daily for a year = 4380 to dismiss by tapping each one. Could solve with a "Select All" feature.
replyContent: I can assume that you've used older version previously. In current one I've updated auto actions mechanics which drastically reduced number of popups. Unfortunately if such popups was scheduled in previous version there's no way to quickly close them.

content: This app will not shut up, no matter if I mute it personally through my settings, disable notifications completely, nothing. The only thing that will really shut this app up is physically turning my volume down on my phone, which I don't have the luxury of doing as I need it on for work. Really cool app, and it really did help, but this app has taken over my phone's ability to silence it. I'm over it.

OK app, a bit lacking in UI. There is a lot of freedom over customizing the speed of progress and skills etc but I feel it is not helpful for building habits. It should be standardized or we should be allowed to turn off most customization options so we can just focus on making entries and completing those entries.

Take my review with a grain of salt as I did not have it downloaded for very long. When you first boot it up, the app has several tasks already set up as examples. Trying to delete these tasks my first time accidentally told the app that I just didn't complete any of them, which gave my character a negative score from the get go. Then going into the settings I found the way to delete everything which included the helpful stats for different tasks. It quickly became a chore so I uninstalled.
I really liek this but the sub tasks get deleted every day even if the task is repeating.

Very good idea although the execution is a little bit off. Amazing for someone who likes to have control over every little detail, however it is definitely not made for the simpler folk who don't want to take the time micromanaging their app.

It's good, but not paid subscription good. I'd *maybe* pay ten dollars for the lifetime. I'd say it's only worth about five, though. You create your own tasks and the xp, rewards, etc. It's neat ig. It's only a matter of time before someone uses AI to make something similar to this - but better, and cheaper lol.
hard to set it up
Too much config required out of the box. And not what I needed. I want something that helps with task breakdown and has timers

I think it deletes some of my scheduled tasks. I also don't like how it automatically adds tasks for you. I want a "to do" app so I can add my own stuff not what others think I should do. The rpg aspect is great and I love it. As an amateur gamer that is cool, easy to use, and being able to add skills and characteristics is awesome. I liked this app A LOT, but unfortunately I can't stress over correcting it. Maybe I'll get back to it someday.

This app seems really well designed and I would love to be able to use it, but unfortunately it has a critical flaw that forced me to uninstall it. Whenever this app is running and I try to open the alarms from the top menu on my phone, the entire clock app will crash and restart. If I force quit Do It Now, the clock app resumes behaving normally. This happened on both my Pixel 5a and Pixel 6a.
The app is great, but Â£24 to remove ads is crazy and apparently that's 50% off. The ads are not super intrusive or frequent, but there should still be a cheaper way to just remove ads.
For some reason, I can't sign in with my Google account.
Soooo perfect!!!! If only it were freeðŸ˜«
Cool app but don't appreciate it popping up over other apps nagging me to review the days tasks, it's pretty obnoxious and intrusive and is what made me uninstall it.
Fun concept but overly complicated and overwhelming interface
Introduce an option that will let us have more than one individual character,at least 3.
I like the basic concept, but there is still a lot of room for improvement
Great app, but constantly spams me with requests for alarm permissions, which I do not want to allow as it interferes with my own alarms.

It's helpful but it needs: more free stuff, a way to buy premium with in game coins, or a way to buy only the premium stuff you want like I want more icons and theme's and color's but not most of the other stuff and you need to be allowed to add what skills a task from someone else gives you.

So I had the worst morning, I couldn't find the keys to the flying ship, I spilled a mega potion all over my lap top and my father died and the insurance wont pay for a phoenix down ! Yeah life is so much easier when I pretend it's only a role and I'm just playing it. In fact I can delete my save file and start a new any old time that right ! Next time I'll play on default difficulty . Not quite as hard as yhe people who spawned in a 3rd world country but more respectable than say Ivanka Trump

The UI is a bit bulky, and it automatically makes multiples of custom tasks sometimes?? But it would otherwise be a good app if it weren't for the ads and INCESSANT paywalls man. Idk how much it costs, and i didn't wanna know. I just wanted to try it for a bit first before making any decisions. Paywall for completing too many tasks, paywall for calendar, paywall for custom stuff (understandable), etc. I had to uninstall. If you're going to charge and spam me with greed, at least make it good

Really looking the promise of the app. I set up sub tasks, they worked great for the first day but aren't selectable as individuals tasks on the second day. That's rather a quick fail, hoping to subscribe but need to know such simple issues will be sorted.

Does what it says on the tin, and doesn't shove premium in your face. (Premium is worth it, in my opinion.) All I wish it had was a way to group skills separately from characteristics; after a certain number of them, they become quite difficult to view in the graph, and searching through the list would be greatly eased by foldable groups.

app has improved a lot since initial launch and it's still my go-to for my daily tasks! still hoping for more social features in the future. also, there is still the lingering issue with a surprising amount of battery use, i think it's still related to the amount of tasks i have (i have a very busy schedule), and it causes my phone to overheat. keep up the good work!
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback.
I'm planning to add at least few social features in future. Though existing ones are barely used.
And yes, I have a ticket for battery drain investigation. Haven't yet got to it.

content: I just started but really like it so far. Competes directly with Habitica but less of the nonsense costumes. It's hard at first to sort characteristics, skills and tasks (you are essentially your own game dev) but on paper I recently sorted out what I want to improve (Skills) and what is stopping me (Characteristics). Tasks will follow soon after. I'm really hopeful about this setup, I love the design, and I never do this but I might actually pay for a subscription (!!!) if all goes well.
replyContent:
Thanks for the great and encouraging feedback.
I do hope that app will help you to achieve your goals :)

content: A very good rip-off of LifeRPGâ€”taking all of the useful features of task management, reward motivation, and RPG-style stat levels, and making the UI simpler and more user-friendly. Seems to be monetizing the idea though, putting in ads and lots of in-app purchases and requiring a RECURRING payment subscription rather than one-time purchase to unlock features
replyContent:
Thank you for the review.
Subscription helps to keep app development process running, but you can use almost every feature of app without subscriptions. Exceptions are less icons, less color themes, less notifications per task and few more. But main features are free :)

content: I love the app specifically for the skills component. It allows me to actually quantify the intrinsic reward of completing each task, so it doesn't feel like I'm just checking off a to-do list. I really wish it was more visually appealing like some of its competitor apps. The interface is a little dated visually and feels a bit rigid; however the options for color themes and task icons somewhat makes up for it.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. We'll work more on the app design and improve it :)

content: PRO: I *love* the fact that it provides a framework for first deciding WHO you want to be (characteristics), then HOW to get there (skills & habits). CONS: - To use the app in that way is not intuitive, and there is a long learning curve to get there. - Ads are obtrusive. The inclusion of audio limits where I can use the app, which makes it less useful. - User guide is not always clear enough. - Reward system needs more robust explanation. - A few more free icons would be nice.

Personally, taking the time to translate my every task into RPG format is tedious. Pretty time consuming in terms of customization. It's more like an RPG Maker, but to-do style. It's not what I'm looking for but given the developers perspective it's excellent for what it's worth. Flexible, extremely customizable and full of possibilities. Suggestion: allowing to download other users formats they've already taken the time to create.
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback. You're right, it's a bit hard to set everything up gor the first time. But when it's done day-to-day maintenance is not that big deal. Unfortunately setup difficulty is the price that app paid for high flexibility.
Thanks for the suggestion, it's tough task from development perspective and I'm not sure if I ever get to it.

content: Fantastic app, practically flawless in practicality and design, once you get the hang of it. It has helped me establish and maintain habits and goals. It's like I'm hacking my brain with a reward system too. I get to track how my accomplished tasks influence my skills and characteristics. Only con being that the tasks duplicate after I check it off. Sometimes 2 or 3 times. I end up having to 'skip' the duplicate ones. Please fix it's seems to only be getting worse.

Fantastic app, I am so relieved to have finally found an app that actually helps to remind me what I need to do as often and as many times as I need while also keeping track of how well I am progressing, I especially like how it has a widget so I don't necessarily have to open the app to complete a task (liable to get distracted otherwise). Yet, I think it would be even cooler if you guys added on a goal organizer or something, even if only on the side. Then it would be absolutely perfect ðŸ’¯ðŸ’¥
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback and for the suggestion.
Could you please share more details on how you would like to see goal organizer? You can email us to support@do-it-now.app.

content: Excellent customization, calendar could use a little love. Loved the app for giving me that extra motivation to build good habits! I'd love to see a little more in terms of organization options. Currently the app puts your tasks in order of time due, then alphabetically, with no option to sort them differently. I'd like to be able to separate my daily tasks from other tasks, so they don't clog up my list and my calendar view. The ability to hide dailies from the calendar view would be great!
Pretty great for self improvement.

It's pretty good for game-ifying my tasks and keeping me on track. The only thing that would bring it to the next level is if it was formatted more like a DND character sheet, but maybe I'm just a nerd

I admire the idea, but I'm not very active. ðŸ˜†
Like the app but why doesnt it transfer my information between devices???? same account, and nothing at all. subscription is active but the setup is in its base form and not the form i put it in.

The app is great and I sure would love to have more perks such as having to pick a photo from the rewards section so I could gain more motivation such as a doll of a certain series I love, kinda like buying something that is thrilling.

Really an awesome app for doing tasks. Helps keep track of tasks and also keep procrastination at bay. One small issue is that I don't get any reminder even I set one. Still a great app. Hope they fix the issue

Does what it says on the tin, and doesn't shove premium in your face. (Premium is worth it, in my opinion.) All I wish it had was a way to group skills separately from characteristics; after a certain number of them, they become quite difficult to view in the graph, and searching through the list would be greatly eased by foldable groups.
This app is great! My only complaint is how complicated it is to initiate each task.. how do I know if it increase 50% discipline or 100%?

I love this app, pretty simple and to the point. Although choosing rewards for myself is hard. Make sure when you purchase premium you make sure you select the right plan, I ended up getting charged $17 but they have started a refund.
replyContent: Hi, we would like to help you to figure this out. As we don't have your email address, can you please write to us at support@do-it-now.app so that we can help you better. We look forward to your email.

content: I really enjoy and look forward to using this app. I create a new icon every 2 character levels & that's a big motivator for me. I do have 2 things I wish were incorporated, 1, I wish there was a way to manually reorder the individual tasks in the hero tab (if there is one, I haven't figured it out) & 2, I'd like to be able to manually dock individual Characteristics & Skills that are falsely inflated due to bad impact percentages (on my part) from when I was figuring it out. Worth every penny

Great app. Personally, I could take or leave the RPG elements. They're neat, but I was primarily looking for something with fully editable tasks in a list form, plus notifications, and wasn't geared toward families. And this does the trick!

I just discovered you can change the time and date when you complete a task! If I didn't have time yesterday to log in I can still collect my tasks without having a weird double day on my trackers. Very customizable and easy to add tasks and skills. There are ways to adjust the XP you earn it and it could be overwhelming, but you don't have to change any settings if you don't want to.

I have only spent a day with this app, but I know that I will spend a great deal of time with it in the future. Pros: Highly versatile and fast. This app can be designed to fit any goal and can be tuned to fit any RPG balancing you want. Nearly everything is customizable. It's also fast. From first tap of the app to checking off accomplished tasks it takes just a couple seconds. Cons: Perfecting the customization to the RPG experience you want can take a long time, but it's worth it.
replyContent: Thanks for the great and so much detailed feedback!

content: I love the app and it's customizablity with some notes; repeats are confusing and not easy to work about (for instance repeat times during one day versus general repeats), moving tasks to different days (calendar drag?) , can set specific times on multiple reminders, making routines, changes easy to lose when pressing back, and unable to manually order tasks by preference in list form. Adding stars for great responsiveness and care of creator =D
replyContent: Really appreciate your feedback and suggestion. I'll work on them to make app more useful and easier to use. Edit: Starting from the next update you'll be able to hide any task from calendar :)

content: This app makes YOUR life an RPG. This is more useful than LifeRPG, in that it is task-oriented, completing tasks increases skills and gold, skills increase character stats, and gold can be used to buy things you've been wanting. It's almost a perfect cue-routine-reward system. Tasks can have subtasks, but I'd like to see Quests with subtasks that give a certain item for completing the quest--in addition to the current setup of gold. Then again, simplicity is really appreciated and I wouldnâ€™t want the app to get more and more complicated due to unnecessary feature requests! This is pretty much the app Iâ€™d always dreamed of. Subscribed.
replyContent:
Thanks for the cool review.
I suppose in future I'll add possibility to receive inventory items for task completion.

content: I am starting with only some small daily tasks and keeping their xp and gold gain low to build the foundation. I like the ability to design our own rewards and hero growth. It allows me to go the slow burn route while I am sure others enjoy the quick leveling that is possible. I have not encountered any issues with it. The only thing I wish it had was the ability to have something repeat weekly or monthly without being on specific days or dates, but that is pretty minor.
replyContent: Thank you for the feedback and suggestion. Unfortunately, due to technical limitation it won't be possible to add possibility to repeat tasks without specific days in weekly or monthly modes. Possibly we'll rework our approaches and such solution will be possible in the future.

content: This is amazing and worthy of subscription, though I would very much rather pay one solid fee for the unlockables. (and I don't mean cheap - I would pay at LEAST $10 to own this and receive updates; It's THAT good!) This app has everything I need, and now my girlfriend is going to join in, too! It has so much limitless potential that you have complete control of. All it takes is a little bit of self-discipline, but there would be no actual pleasure in cheating at this sort of game anyway.
replyContent: Thanks for your very cool review!

content: Great app to gamify to do list and tasks. Very customizable in regards to icons, colors, and skills. I have not dived into the newest updates to see if there are new features. The downside could be an upside for some. When first organizing tasks it can be easy to get overwhelmed with options. No side game to slay dragons like one game to-do list manager I saw. It does a good job of being an annoying reminder to get tasks done (assuming you set deadlines).
replyContent: Thank you so much for your review!

content: I really love having my habits in this system. It's so easy to keep track of them now, and see how well I am doing, or not doing. It's clear when I need to adjust something to perform better. I am definitely habitualizing things much easier. The gamification part adds no fun for me, and I think the merge of productivity and gamification leaves a lot to be desired, but it's a start and hopefully they keep learning and improving. I do like the sound effects.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback. We'll do our best in improving app further more :)

content: This is a great, powerful and wonderful app. The ability to make a task subtask of multiple parents is wonderful and unique. It allows for specifying a task as predecessor for multiple tasks. The skills and characteristics stats allows us to instantly find out which areas we are yet to focus more on and immensely helps in planning. First of all ability to have infinite levels of subtasks itself is a great feature.
I have Adult ADD and this app has been incredible at helping me set tasks and start new productive habits.

This app is simple and straight to the point. Quick and easy to use and tinker with and a lot of fun to have overall. If had any suggestions it would be to have the ability to have multiple accounts but other than that I completely recommend this app. There's a lot of features although, yes a lot of them are premium they balance out quite well and it's not that irritating as other apps to use the non-premium version.
Cool
Incredible app. Helps keep track of my day. Thanks dev!

I really enjoy and look forward to using this app. I create a new icon every 2 character levels & that's a big motivator for me. I do have 2 things I wish were incorporated, 1, I wish there was a way to manually reorder the individual tasks in the hero tab (if there is one, I haven't figured it out) & 2, I'd like to be able to manually dock individual Characteristics & Skills that are falsely inflated due to bad impact percentages (on my part) from when I was figuring it out. Worth every penny

I like the app. I'm just someone who wants to be as productive as possible, and this app can make it more enjoyable to do so. I also admire the creativity of the app and have already purchased a subscription, which is very well priced. Unfortunately, there are bad reviews, but ultimately, this is meant to make your life like a game, and most games need to make revenue so keep that in mind before a negative review.
The only app I know of that makes chores fun!
This is definitely the best app I've ever used. I totally enjoy it and this is the reason of my improvement.
I do enjoy the app, but like other guys I too believe that it need some animation and a happier atmosphere, but it's very practical

Only option for habits with values is per day, there is no per week option. This is useless when I want to create habits to do things a set number of times per week (but NOT daily) AND note how long/many/etc I did. This is a glaring flaw in the app's design. I don't know how the other features are; this was the first thing I tried to do and immediately realized the app was useless for me. I uninstalled and chose an app with more scheduling options. Edit to clarify "with ability to add values."
replyContent: Hello, thank you for your feedback! It's currently possible to create habits with extra weekly goals. Take into account that the app tracking system is based on daily entries, that's why weekly goals are additional. Please, contact us at habitnow.apps@gmail.com if you've any other questions about it!

content: Had it for a few seconds. Deleted after I saw what came with the standard version versus the premium version. Too many essential schedule planning features locked behind 6 bucks. If I'm low enough to be HERE downloading an app trying to get my life together, what makes you think I even have 6 bucks... The answer is I don't! I've been sick! And bedridden. I'm broke and trying to start from scratch.
replyContent: Hello, we always try to provide the most functionalities to create a completely functional free experience. We invite you to explore it, as it comes with numerous valuable features! We're actively working to add more free features in every app update. Feel free to email us at habitnow.apps@gmail.com if you have any questions or suggestions!

content: The interface was bland and boring even after paying for premium. It didn't really make me want to complete the tasks at hand. Just one little notification sometimes an alarm easily dismissable and then forgotten. Edit: also, I cannot figure out how to unsubscribe from what I thought was a one-time purchase for the premium. I keep getting charged.
replyContent: You canâ€™t buy the app more than once. Itâ€™s impossible. If you own a product, the Play Store does not allow you to buy it again. Maybe you are confusing a different app with HabitNow. If you need help from our support just contact us to habitnow.apps@gmail.com and weâ€™ll help you

content: There is no way to input what times your habits and tasks are supposed to be completed at each day just a reminder/notification option and that isn't very helpful if you can't input the start and end time for each activity so this is a completely useless app. This is basically nothing more than a glorified checklist and I wish I realized that before paying for premium
replyContent: Hi: You can set times to your activities without creating a reminder. You can contact us at habitnow.apps@gmail.com, we'll help you to understand how the app works! We're waiting for your message ðŸ™‚

content: Well, here I am at the end of my first day using it, and not one thing got finished. I didn't receive a single reminder all day, which was the whole point of taking the time to set them all up! I even triple-checked to ensure my notifications were turned on. Bummer. I'll find another app.
replyContent: Hello Christi, thank you for your feedback. Your device is blocking the reminders. Please, contact us at habitnow.apps@gmail.com. We'll help you to configure them!

content: While using the timer, the app sends my smart watch continuous notifications. It vibrates continuously the whole time the timer is running. I would like to track the habit of walking in the morning and keep track of how long I walk. So for my purposes, this bug makes the app unusable.
replyContent: Hello Melissa, there is an incompatibility originating from the smartwatch. Please email us at habitnow.apps@gmail.com, and we'll help you with the issue!

content: Very bad.. I was charged twice for the premium services and no one has bothered answering my email on this double charge. it's a shame that you can make semuch an app and when we subscribe for premium services you charge twice the amount on the in app purchase. so shameful.
replyContent: Hello Steven, we've just responded to the email you sent today. Please note that we're not involved in the payment process for the premium version. We hope the information provided is helpful! ðŸ™‚

content: They keep changing small features that make the habits harder to use. Specifically The notes which I used to use to add things like prayers and details and now don't even show up when the habits are created. It's just annoying and there's no reason for the change. Each update it's just the small little things that add up and make this app kind of annoying to use.
replyContent: Hello Adam. Thank you for your feedback. Notes are daily and descriptions are fixed. Please, contact us at habitnow.apps@gmail.com if you've any questions about it. We're sad to receive a one star score, we're always working to improve our app based on the user's suggestions.

content: One of the recurring tasks I set for myself disappeared on its own. I didn't delete it. Now I can't track the days on which I did this task. This is very unpleasant.
replyContent: Hello, the app cannot delete any tasks or habits without the user confirmation. Please contact us at habitnow.apps@gmail.com, we'll be glad to help you to find it!

content: The alarm for reminder never worked for me. Fully disappointed after buying the premium version.
replyContent: Hello Deepak! Your Vivo is blocking the alarms. Please, contact us at habitnow.apps@gmail.com. We'll help you to configure them!
