content: Don't use ai art.
Useful app but uses ai art for promotions so they don't view artist work as something that shouldn't be stolen
replyContent: Hi Erick, thanks for your feedback! I personally crafted all of our artworks for several years. Now, AI tools help us to enhance efficiency without compromising quality, ensuring swift, high-quality results while balancing creativity and efficiency. Please, feel free to reach out at habitnow.apps@gmail.com for further discussion!

content: I initially found this app very useful, so I upgraded to the premium version for the automatic backup feature. When I got a new phone and transferred all of my data to the new device, I discovered none of my backups had actually occurred and over two years of habit tracking data had been lost.
replyContent: Hello Angelo, thanks for your feedback. As we mentioned in the exchanged emails, cloud backup issues may arise due to device battery optimizations. Unfortunately, it depends on the device, and we always try to provide a guide to avoid that. As we don't receive bug reports for this, we suggest users periodically check backups for proper storage.

content: It beautifully displays, tracks, and reports all of my important habits that I want to develop. Unfortunately, it doesn't have an option to set recurring tasks - things that I need to do regularly, but that aren't necessarily vital to my personal development. I paid for the full version, but actually stopped using it because I don't like that it won't differentiate between a habit and a recurring task. Looking for something to better suit my needs ...
replyContent: Hi Summarah: We programmed habits exactly as repeating tasks. We highly suggest using them instead. If you have any doubts or suggestions contact us to Habitnow.apps@gmail.com and we'll be happy to help!

content: Edit: still don't have a way to change my "default" alarm tone without a third party app, and I'd still like to set different tones and reminders per task. Second edit: all the notifications and alarms seem to happen either regularly three minutes late, or, if I haven't turned on my phone screen in a while, as late as 4 pm for a 9 am reminder. The battery and notification settings are all set so this should not happen. Going to have to try something else.
replyContent: Zerubel: The app uses the default alarm of your device. You can change it from Android's settings. About the notifications issue, you must exclude HabitNow from your battery optimizer and then restart your device. If you need instructions for your SAMSUNG, please contact us to habtinow.apps@gmail.com and we'll be glad to help...

content: I've been using this app for a month now. For the most part it works well, love the checklist function and reminders. But I am trying to establish routines so I need to tweak my schedule sometimes. I wish there was an option to move or reschedule recurring tasks around, and the ability to duplicate them so I'm not starting from scratch each time I need to add something new. Could be more user friendly and organized, it's been very frustrating to use at times.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We always read the user feedback and improve the app based on it. If the app is helping you we'd love to get a better score. That's the best way to support all the hard work that the developers put on the app. Feel free to contact us at habitnow.apps@gmail.com anytime. Best regards, HabitNow Team

content: In this app you can make a task template that can be reused over and over. However you need to pick a set frequency for it to appear. You can't pick a single day for it to appear. So the easy fix to this is to create a single non recurring task, but you have to start from scratch and that sucks if it's big task with alot of subtasks that have to be typed in again. It would be perfect if you could make a template for nonrecurring tasks that can be give a different time/alarm every time its used.
replyContent: Hello Curtis: Thank you for your feedback! It's possible to reschedule completed tasks from the task archive by changing the date of any of them to the desired date. It will clear all the subtasks. Please, contact us at habitnow.apps@gmail.com if you've any questions about it. We'll be glad to help!

content: I'm very sorry I bought the full version so quickly. The only benefit I found so far, is the ability to add more than 7 habits. I couldn't find a report that would provide information about my success and pinpoint areas that I seem to regularly miss. I was drawn to the simple UI but will probably write this off as a waste of money and return to Daily Tasks.
replyContent: Hi Nom: There is a detailed list with all the premium benefits in the premiun details section. You can check you habits statistics in the section "My Habits", touching on any of your habit cards. If you want to talk with our support, contact us to habitnow.apps@gmail.com. We are always open to improve. Regards.

content: I opened the app and am uninstalling it as soon as I opened it. This may work for certain things so it's worth giving it a try. However, this is not what I was looking for at all. Im searching for an app to use as a universal all-in-one track and logger that has many functions and can be customized easily. I was hoping for 1. Track water and food, medication tracker and reminder (so I could also track the supplements I take and write a note), will keep looking for a good fit.
replyContent: Hi: You can track all of them, and more, with our app. If you need help to configure your activities contact us at habitnow.apps@gmail.com, we'll be glad to help you.

content: I like the app except I'm having trouble with my reminders. My alarms and notifications only come through when the app is in use. As soon as I exit the app, I don't get any alarms or notifications for the times I set them. Until I open the app again, then all these alarms and notifications I've missed pop up. Really quite inconvenient.
replyContent: Hi Cassidy: Samsung Galaxy phones include a battery optimizer that disables alarms and reminders without the user knowledge. Contact us to habitnow.apps@gmail.com and we'll be glad to help you to exclude HabitNow from it. Best regards, HabitNow Team

content: I'm paid for the premium version and now I'm experiencing buyer's remorse. The only reason why I tried this app is because Loop Habit Tracker hasn't been in active development for around 2 years. Even so, this app pales in comparison! It's ugly, it's clunky, and it doesn't graphically present data in the most elegant and useful form. Don't get me wrong, it's okay for people who like messy interfaces and sloppy data presentation â€” people easy to please. â€¦I may just have to make my own app.

Buttons on the widget don't work if you're not premium. Some widgets require premium even though they are not named as such. The distinction between tasks and habits seems pointless. It should just be a checkbox on the habit to disable tracking. If the usabily was streamlined by fixing the above I'd reconsider using the app, but as it is, it's just frustrating.

content: Pushy denial. I placed FIVE tasks in, then was told repeatedly that I had to purchase premium to make any habit reoccurring. content: Love the app with one exception. It's not possible to add individual habits/tasks to a list. For example, I want to create a morning routine list. In that list, I then add the habits that are part of the routine. Instead, I have to select an entire category. While I could create a morning routine category and assign the habits to it, this is less than ideal. I just want to use the list to easily group and identify what habits are part of my morning routine.

content: There is no customization of color allowed. Also no separate priorities for separate tasks. There is no web interface. So if you login from a different device, with the same username, everything is blank. You have to manually back up, restore and thats how you transfer them. Not a straightforward way. My phone died, and with that, vanished all my data. Overall, it is a useful app but not a reliable one. I am a premium user. No auto backup made.
replyContent: Hello! There is an automatic backup functionality, the app shows a message suggesting to enable it when the user turns premium. About the color customization, it's possible to change it from the themes section. About the web app, we're currently working on it. We appreciate your feedback. Best regards, HabitNow Team

content: sorting by the categories needs sort. I've created custom categories using numbering and it doesn't rank them in order. Also it would be great if a desktop app could be available as I often like to have multiple screens open and plan by day using a bigger screen when there is more going on. Overall though the interface I think is clean, easy to use compared to others and useful features.

content: Pretty Good So far But... I have been testing the notifications and how they work and I have noticed that my phone doesn't vibrate when the notifications pop up. Idk if it's a bug for the vibration because the alarm works. It can be seen as an issue because if I'm not looking at my phone for a while and I miss a notification, I'm not truly notified if my phone doesn't vibrate. Yes I could use an alarm but that's not my preference as I don't like startling loud noises. Otherwise it's a great app.
replyContent: Hi Dejavon: Thank you for contacting us. That's probably caused by One Plus battery optimization options. Please, contact us to habitnow.apps@gmail.com and we'll help you to configure the notifications. ðŸ™‚

content: Great so far. I only wish I could set up one task for more than 1 day. It's kind of annoying when you have to do the same tasks daily to have to add them daily. If I could go into the date section and choose multiple days or months that would be amazing. Also making it so I can choose a time range would also be really helpful. Some of my tasks need to be 2 or 3 hrs long and right now I can only choose a time for a reminder. It'll help keep me more organized time wise if you added these. Thanks!
replyContent: Hi Dawn: Habits were programed as repeating tasks. We highly suggest using them to record tasks that repeats over time. Rhank you for your review!

content: Looks really nicely made but not what I was looking for. I needed something i could use to make a list of everything I wanted to remember to do every day (brush teeth, wash face, eat breakfast, exercise, etc.) so that i could check them off as i did them. This does exactly that but you cant add more than six things unless you are a premium member which is totally not worth it for a simple checklist. I'll be looking for something more basic.

Is there an option to simply copy a habit and apply the desired dates for the next month? I'm only given the option to either unarchive a habit that I've archived and I keep having to re-enter information, instead of being able to copy previous habits and then customize. The app also doesn't give an option to drag and drop habits in desired order or customize habit entries. Eg. If my goal was to read 10 pages a day and I read 9 it isn't counted toward my overall progress. Please fix. Thanks!
replyContent:
About the first two suggestions: There is an option for that. Maybe you have an old version on the app ðŸ˜•
About the goal issue. If you set 10 as a goal, and you enter 9 as the daily value it means that you have't achieved your daily goal.
Please, contact us to habitnow.apps@gmail.com and we'll be glad to help you ðŸ™‚

content: Just got it then bought it. Super sleek. Might be replacing my other task tracker. 2 things I've noticed off the bat: Please provide a way to "delay" a task. For instance, it alerts, but I don't have time to do it that moment, allow me to delay or snooze it for 30 minutes or an hour, like the app Do It Later does. Then, after that snooze time, re alert me. Also, for the "repeat every x days", please add an option to change days to weeks or months. Eg: I would like to say repeat every 3 months.

Needs a better sorting option. Honestly the best habit tracking app. But after adding 50+ habits to plan my week, and organizing them into groups/certain days, only to find out that you can't drag and sort - killed it for me. You can number them in the names for alphabetical sorting, but then #10 shows up after #1 instead of after #9, which defeats the purpose of alphabetical. Please add an option to custom sort habits. Thank you. And if I click on a category, have it show a list of the habits.

EDIT: I have reinstalled the app and am trying it again to see if I made some kind of mistake causing the problem I've had. The developers are wonderful about helping solve problems so it's worth trying again! **Unfortunately the app is not working properly for me. For instance my habit of "Daily Journaling" notified me today that it was complete and showed the goal date as March 1, 2021. It's April 27 and the goal was never completed.
replyContent: Sadly we've never heard of this problem since the app was released. If you set a goal date for a habit, it will be automatically archived on that date. We would really appreciate more information of your habit settings/configurations in order to provide you an effective solution. Best regards, HabitNow Team

content: Hey guys. Just purchased your app and would absolutely love if you guys modified it to track all data input. For example, if I am tracking my reading and I am aiming for 2 chapters but only got 1 chapter done, it doesn't factor in the 1 chapter into the stats. This is essential in keeping accurate data, rather than being given a 0% when some of it was in fact accomplished. Also please allow for customization where you can drag and drop your habits in the order you'd like to see them. Thank you!
replyContent: Thank you for your support. We'll work on it. Best regards, HabitNow Team

content: The free version of the app is a simple habit tracker. I think its annoying how simple it is. You only get to have about 6 habits at a time. To add more, users need to pay. I wish the reminder notifications were more motivating + useful instead of asking me to tally it off. Maybe it's better in the premium version, but I'm likely going to uninstall + find something better for my needs.

Used this app for 3 days. I didn't like that when I failed a habit, in order to mark it a failure I had to cycle through the check mark that was for achieving the goal which would prompt a pop up saying something like "great job you're on a new record streak of 1 day! Keep it up". I would like to have set the habit to automatically be a red circle with line through it or check mark base on frequency of achieving said goal, and if I achieve or fail ONLY then I'd need to change it.

Good app but some features are missing. Specifically the ability to have a counter option for habits (do this thing x amount of times per day) also the ability to order your list of daily habits with a user friendly 3 horizontal bar slider. These features would help users establish and work through daily routines. They seem like easy fixes. I'll update review when this changes
replyContent: Adam: The app has daily numerical values. When creating a new habit select the option 'With a quantity'. If you need help from our support contact us to habitnow.apps@gmail.com and we'll be glad to help you. New features will be added soon. Best regards, HabitNow Team

content: I think this app is actually pretty good. The interface is clean, and there are a lot of features. However, the one thing that annoys me is that I cannot set the time when the "next" day begins. I work at night, so at midnight halfway through my shift, the app rolls over to the next day and I have to go back to the previous day. More of an annoyance than a problem, but it seems like such an obvious feature that it makes it frustrating that the app does not have it.

Would be nice if you could set up a task as reoccurring. Would also be nice if you could set up more than 5 habits without having to upgrade to premium. Would also like to have a tab for graphs without having to go into each habit singley to open the graph for just that one habit. Will probably keep looking for a better option.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. Habits work as repeating tasks, there are 7 habits for free and weâ€™ll add more graphics in upcoming updates. Best regards, HabitNow Team

content: It has almost everything that I need but the thing that frustrates me the most is the calendar view. That's really the most important thing to see how many days you've tracked in a row. Switch to calendar view it looks just like a regular calendar and nothing is highlighted for anything. You have to click on each individual day to see what it looks like.
replyContent: The calendar IS a regular calendar. That is its function. A calendar. You can touch on a day and see it's schedule. The apps has many options and also has a calendar. You can navigate between days touching on the arrows on top. Regards

content: It's a good app but missing a big feature, giving it's competitors an edge: overall statistics. The individual habits show all stats you want but nothing shows how well you've been doing overall which makes it easy to not notice falling behind on a single habit. Pretty much the only reason why I'm hesitant to buy. Because other apps do track overall performance

This app would be perfect if the notifications came through consistently. I've whitelisted it everywhere and enabled all notifications, disabled every possible "battery saving" thing, I've done everything I possibly can on my end, including manually opening the app myself every few hours and keeping it open all day, but the reminders STILL often don't work. For the few days that it worked the way it's supposed to, it was great, and I like how I can add my own categories and change the colours.

content: Great app! Two suggestions though: for weekly tasks, it should tell you how many more you have to do that week to complete your goal. 2nd, the UI for tasks with Daily Goals is pretty bad. Instead of it opening a window for you to enter a number, it should use the check box circle to tell you how many more you have. If you have a daily goal of 3, clicking on the circle once should fill up the ring by 1/3. Clicking it again brings it to 2/3 full. And then the last time, it should do the checkmark.

Just downloaded this app and giving my first impressions. Was easy to get started. Created a list of 6 habits right away with ease. Very intuitive controls and nice interface. I like that I can have multiple reminders and they can be notifications or alarms. Update: I've uninstalled this app because if I dismiss an alarm while the phone is locked, the vibrate keeps going until I restart my phone. I haven't found a fix for this yet. Haven't reached out to company yet.

I've tried a few different steak trackers and this is the best one I've found so far. There is still room for improvement though. My biggest complaint is that when you've completed an x days/week habit for the week, it stops showing up on the daily list. I'd like an option to still see those there so that I can more easily log if I do that activity more than those x number of days. Maybe a setting on the habit itself so you can choose which ones show every day?

I like the app, but I wish it had two features: 1. A web interface - it would be a lot easier to use a computer to set up all my habits and it would also be nice to use it on my work computer for work tasks not strictly on my phone. 2. Google Calendar interface - again, it's OK to have a calendar in the app, but it's stuck in my little phone. Allowing it to be shown in my Google Calendar would help me see how it all fits together. Thanks guys!

Love it - would give it 5+ stars BUT after many, many, many hours of entering tasks, making custom icons, organizing checklists and priorities all my data suddenly disappeared. Everything is gone. I couldn't even enter new tasks. I had to uninstall the app in order to reinstall it. It seems to be working again now but all my data is gone. All my customization, settings, everything. I did not have it backed up on cloud. I recommend turning on backup.

content: Have been using this for a few weeks now I like it fairly well, but the lack of more detailed scheduling options (ie: 4 times every 60 days, not bound by actual months) is a little disappointing, as I have a habit to track that needs that kind of specificity. I've had to set it to four times per month instead, and then made creative use of the skip feature.

App is really great, and premium is a one-time purchase instead of a subscription. However, one thing that's missing is a way to make the home screen to-do list more transparent. I'd really love to be able to see my background through the to-do list, and would gladly change my review to a 5-star if they added this functionality.

Ive tried a lot off habit apps and like it better than others (paid). I like: -the options for icons, which also show in notifications -robust notification options -works offline. I've changed how I use the app, I use it for my tasks mostly. But it's great for that simple enough, I don't get overwhelmed. But the biggest problem with it is the icon in the notification tray is too generic. If I'm distracted, I don't instinctively know which app it is.

I just downloaded the app and enjoy it so far. I do have a suggestion for developers regarding breaking bad habits: it would be nice if there was an option for a counter, to track the number of times per day you perform the action/habit you want to stop and set a goal for it. Success is if you count the action equal or less times per day to your goal. It could be set up like the check list feature, touching the day for that habit opens a box with the counter. The goal can be reduced over time.

It also allows you to set as many single tasks as you would like to set reminders to do different things. So starting out with just 7 recurring let's you test it out to see if it helps and if it does its only a one time purchase of $5 to get everything. I would highly recommend this app.

Purchased it. I am also reading "Atomic Habits" as well. I am wanting to cultivate better habits to improve multiple areas and this app lets me do that. I just have 4 habits (as of now). Since I am able to see them it really keeps me accountable when I can click on them as a sign of success. The app is easy to navigate, UI is nice. No major issues as of now.
I love this app, definitely the best habit tracker and planner

content: There's no recent edits or undo functionality to the tasks. There's also no save button. So you can lose all your changes if you made a change elsewhere, and somehow it didn't get updated to their servers, then view the task on another computer, and nothing has changed. Worse, your new changes on the first computer never went anywhere and you're stuck remembering what you had typed or missed.

I've updated this review a half dozen times with various bugs; here we go again. Reported to customer support that when using the "skip to current task" feature on daily tasks, reminders don't get updated correctly sometimes, and will get set for some day in the future or past, sometimes MONTHS in the past. Received a useless condescending reply explaining that I have to complete daily tasks for the new instance of the task to appear. Engineers can't fix a bug they don't know about.

I've been using Wunderlist, finally downloaded this to switch. I went to use my info from there, it says it's linked to a Microsoft account, so I go to sign in using that. I sign in just fine but it takes me to my Microsoft account page, no way to actually use the app. Closing it just means I have to sign in again, and back to the account page. I absolutely can't find a way to get to the app/it's features from this page. Beyond frustrating.

As an experienced Office 365 subscriber, Android has enough standalone To Do/List apps. What it lacks is a cohesive all-in-one Personal Information Manager. For Windows, that has, for years been Microsoft Outlook. Instead of developing a standalone To Do app, Microsoft development time would be better served adding Tasks and Contacts to it's Outlook app. Extending functionality to the Microsoft Outlook Android app to mirror Microsoft Outlook for Windows would make so much more sense.

A Horrible upgrade! Its predecessor, Wunderlist, was a very useful tool. I could easily add new tasks and speak them by pressing one button. Now you have to go through a variety of clicks to do the same. Wunderlist easily and seamlessly integrated into my different operating platforms. Unfortunately, to do list requires that you use Windows 10 which I do not have and refuse to upgrade from Windows 8.1 Pro. There are other lists out there that you may want to consider.
replyContent:
Dear Jaye,
Could you please contact us via todofeedback@microsoft.com? We'd love to hear more about this issue in order to assist you. Thanks!

content: Edit: originally 3/5 because it is a nice app with one major flaw. Microsoft commented on my original review saying to contact customer service via email I did and they told me to look at one setting but my phone doesn't have that setting. They responded back basically "o well. That's all we got" and said it's my phone's fault. Like really? Piss poor support. Especially considering the app works fine for an extended period but then will stop. Can't be the setting they recommended.
replyContent:
Hey Kevin,
Sorry for the inconvenience!
Please be assure that we are aware of the reminder issue you are facing. At first it appears that it can be because of OS limitations, however support engineers will analyze it further.
You will soon receive a reply from support team on next working day. Thanks for your patience!

content: Terrible. When you sign in using the app on a laptop it resets all other apps...like your user info on office 365, which screws up every thing you do outside of the app. I don't want it all connected to one email. I like my apps separate. There is also no week view, and so far I've gotten no reminders despite them being set. Very disappointed that wonderful Wunderlist is being replaced by this unuseable nightmare of an app. I'm not going to be using this.

OMG!! They BROKE what was a very good app! Completed "tasks" can no longer be sorted which makes this app USELESS. We mostly use this app for shopping lists with hundreds of items on the list, mostly in the completed section. When we again need the item, we just uncheck it. When these items were listed alphabetically they were easy to find. Now they are in random order and impossible to find. WOW

Someone thought it was a good idea to add a "feature" that asks me "what i plan to do today?" EVERY. DAY. You can turn it off if you can find the option buried somewhere. I dont need a reminder app to suddenly start reminding me to set up reminders. Seriously who though this was a good idea to add? UPDATE: You can turn off the daily reminder BUT IT WILL TURN ITSELF BACK ON. Also, WHY do I need a Microsoft account? What if I dont want to sync reminders to anything outside my phone? So bad!

I used to love this app, but for the past month or two, the "Add Note" feature has an annoying glitch, which makes it impossible to use. There is some type of automatic carriage return going on that just keeps scrolling down, no matter what you do. If you finger swipe to go to the top, you can barely click the screen where you want to edit before it glitches down to wherever the cursor has progressed. I've uninstalled, restarted, logged back in with the same result. I'm using notepad now, sadly.
replyContent: Hi John, we are so sorry for the inconvenience caused. There is a compatibility bug with our notes editor on select Samsung devices and we are working on fixing it. In the meantime, it would be really lovely if you could switch to the Google keyboard so you can continue to use To Do without any glitches. Warm regards, To Do team

content: The app consistently crashes after ~1-2 minutes of being open, no matter what I am doing (and my work is lost). I have ensured the app and my device (iPad Pro) are up-to-date. I have tried reinstalling it; I have tried several recent app updates as well as a device update; and I have reported it to the app developers multiple times, including my error log files. No luck yet.
Microsoft can't even develop a simple app that allows simple and intuitive sharing
You need microsoft account

I chose this app because it allowed me to have push notifications for my reminders however I kept having to reset the notification settings on each task as they would randomly stop notifying me of the tasks
Not posibble to see all lists. Not possible to see if task belong to list. Inferior to samsung reminder application.
Pin notification is not working any more

It doesn't allow me to edit a task. This app is for a perfect world, where tasks details and deadlines are set on stones, things always go as planned, and nothing ever fails. It was ok when I first used it early last year.
Keeps on asking "reminder settings turned off". Microsoft, I don't care. F u. I hate devs treating our attention as currency.
MY TASKS ARE GONE. It happened twice (in one year). Stupid apps. I rely on those lists and suddenly the disappear
unable to login using ms. live account

I don't know how this app has such a high rating. If we're speaking about services of MS more broadly, e.g. sync between the app and the desktop (DT) version of To-do, this is just a disaster. Tasks that I create on my mobile are not showing up in DT version, then when I click several times the 'Sync' button, it completely DELETES the task that I created on the mobile app instead of ADDING it to the DT version. The quality of MS products is falling down each year.

It's pretty good at what it does but it's not perfect . My biggest issue is that It doesn't really have a backup feature You can export your data to be imported into Excel or Outlook tasks but you can't just hit one button and save the entire thing as an editable easy to read format So I basically need to select each individual thing one by one and save it through the printing option which is extremely frustrating and time-consuming

I don't know if anyone else is experiencing this, but the app glitches CONSTANTLY with Chrome OS. Whenever I flip to "My Day," the suggested tasks flicker on the screen and make using the app impossible. I used it on my Android phone and previously on my Macbook with no problem. I loved the "My Day" function and am loathe to switch to a different app, but I don't think I have a choice.

Just not far enough along to be really useful. It did pull tasks from different accounts (personal, work, school) but there is no way to come up with a consolidated list to work from for the day. Subtasks (steps) don't have the ability to show up separately on a day so you can't use it to plan out complicated tasks. Tasks don't have a due time assignable so useless as a homework tracker. No geo-fencing. Ever since they gutted Outlook I been relying more and more on paper day-timer.

It's confusing. to-do apps are supposed to make things easier but i find that this doesn't do that. it says it will remind but doesn't.. at least for me. it doesn't sync with cortana; she seems to have her own list. I think it syncs with Microsoft launcher? the ui/ux is confusing with the whole my day thing, and then there's planned, custom lists... there's no bi-weekly schedule. There should be ONE list tied to your account and all apps should sync with it.

Love the concept, enjoy To Do on PC, love that it syncs immediately. What I do NOT love is that scheduled tasks do not sync with my Outlook calendar. This is very inconvenient as I have to have two programs open and if I want to schedule anything, I have to check my to do list. Also, noticed today that I can no longer check off tasks as completed in the app. When I do the task disappears for a second then pops right back onto my list as incomplete. Is currently useless.

The new "auto-complete suggestions enabled" feature is loathsome. I have to turn off this nuisance in the list options for EACH list EVERY time I reopen the list. You should be able to turn it off in the app settings, and it should stay off when you turn it off. Worst, the list option to "turn off auto suggestions" is where a fat finger can do the most damage: right below "delete list"! I accidentally deleted a list with dozens of repeating items.

So I'll say this is a start. The pluses, the syncing between outlook tasks, todo web, and the UI is clean and generally nice to look at.  CONS:  Why is there no "Planned" list on the todo app. It's super annoying. There is no easy way to see my tasks for today and the upcoming week. "Planned" is implemented on web. The todo app really should have basic parity.  It's super painful in both the app and the web app to add dates. I add dates to every todo. It is very cumbersome compared to todoist.  I'm sure other people use it but I don't love the My Day feature. I don't like manually adding it. It should just show all the tasks due today. Maybe we could add that as a setting?  There is another bug. The date seems to be off. It works on mobile but it's off on the web app so it's not consistent. MS really needs to get their act together on this product.

Interface similar to Wunderlist, functionally not the same unfortunately. As an example, Wunderlist allows manual sorting after sorting by one of the sort options (alphabetical, etc), which can fine tune things beautifully. Microsoft To Do does not allow manual sorting unless you deactivate the selected sort (like deactivating alphabetical sort as an example). This then reverts everything back to the same unsorted mess prior to the selected sort option. Very frustrating.

I switched over to Microsoft to do after being notified that Wunderlist would not be available. With the most recent update to the app, the 'planned' list now only shows a filtered view. And I have to group it by date to even see it for each day. Previously I could see everything at once -by due date even overdue items. I can appreciate that everyone might not want to see everything. There should be an 'all' option if you are going to limit this. Looks like I get to find a new app.
Sometimes synching doesn't work in three Android app

A very basic feature of clear completed tasks is missing. When all I want is a daily checklist, it's irritating to go into each task and skip to current task. If a task repeats why would I want it to stay forever under completed. It's a nightmare for OCD.

Por favor, coloquem mais opÃ§Ãµes de widget!! A integraÃ§Ã£o Ã© incrÃ­vel, mas a brutalidade de um Ãºnico widget gigantesco na tela Ã© desagradÃ¡vel. SugestÃ£o: possibilitem diminuir o tamanho do widget.
Its ok, though doesnt send reminders
Please make it work with passwordless login.

this app often missed to show notification. at first i thought probably android kill the app in background to save battery, so i often open the app many times within day. even then, still in many occasion the notification fails to show. please fix it.

so worked amazing the first week, app interface is good, design is good, everything is good. then bam, next week can't see any of my tasks on the widget, won't refresh have to keep going on deleting the widget then adding then deleting to get the tasks to refresh despite adding new tasks everyday so yeah no point in having a to do list that literally doesn't refresh yk
When it is skipped to the current tasks, it will skip to the next week, even though the due dates have been customised to days within the week that haven't arrived yet.
Forces you to log in with password with browser
Lack of features

Apparently inefficient, especially on a phone. I don't want a visual experience, I want an efficient way to manage my To Do lists (sharing with my family). The lines, from their screen shots, are too tall. This app may, or may not, be fine otherwise, however it requires a Microsoft account. Big nope.

A few glaring issues that make me not want to use it. 1) You can't reschedule a recurring task without it changing the recurring schedule. Meaning, if a task recurs every Monday but you can't get it done and schedule for Tuesday, it messes with schedule, sometimes recurring on both days now or switching days entirely. 2) If a task isn't completed, it disappears from My Day. You have to go digging for it. there's no overdue section

I started using this app after Microsoft bought out Wunderlist (my old to-do app, which I still miss), and for a while everything was fine... but more recently, I'm no longer able to add more than one account. The option to add another account still appears, but doesn't seem to work. This is a huge inconvenience to me, as I used to rely heavily on being able to access multiple accounts. I'm afraid to try logging out of my main account, for fear that the app won't let me log back in. D:

Using a personal account, this app appears to be flawless. Great for keeping track of various lists. For business accounts, this app is full of bugs. Things like lists not updating, items vanishing, and app crashes. This makes the app virtually useless for businesses, and this needs fixed.

After a while using this app, I noticed my phone "stops" the UI operations. It boils down to the Microsoft To Do app. Almost every time I use the app, the smartphone "hangs" and/or stops the UI operating software. All other apps works without any slowdown. "Update": Yep, this app still alone keeps "crashing" phone. All other apps only phone works normally.

There seems to be a large number of inconsistencies in the expected behaviours and results of this ToDo app, mostly in comparison to Wunderlist. For example, setting a reoccurring task with a reminder doesn't seem to recreate the reminder accordingly the same way it did in Wunderlist. The UI/UX seems nicer overall, though. But pedantic "power users" like myself may not like it as much as Wunderlist.

I am a heavy wunderlist user. I have been waiting for ages for them to port ALL functionalities of the later in todo. Importing is still destroying the dates when you have a periodicity and the app still cannot add the sub tasks from wunderlist as sub task... instead it turns them into notes. You will also loose the calendar integration via the subscription functionality. I'll wipe again all records in todo and wait for it to be a better replacement to wunderlist before i fully switch. If you never used wunderlist, the app is good though. My Day is a good idea overall, but having to do it every day is a bit tiring. It should integrate automatically tasks due today and let you add what ever you want manually. I assume they want people to have a fresh start in todo...

I have been using this app on my samsung for last 2 years, i have found good in it. It's a good app for reminders and to do list. Now i have changed to oppo A9, the only issue i am facing, the reminders notifications which are not completed, disappear from my screen in the night same day. It's annoying for me because I have to find those incomplete reminders in the app one by one and set them again. It would be fine, if unfinished tasks should not disappear. Stars would be 5ðŸ˜Š. Thanks

I guess I got tuned into Wunderlist a little late. Knowing that Microsoft Todo is going to replace it is a let down. Todo is lacking when it comes to the wonderful UI of Wunderlist. I'm wondering why after 3 years this replacement still isn't where Wunderlist is today. There is no option to organize lists into folders. Also, there is no option to add a completed tasks section to the main screen. Even when show completed takes is turned on, they disappear in the important (task) section when completed.

The app is easy to use, but lacks the ability to list a task into multiple groups/categorize, to move an existing task into a group/category, and to group by categories in daily to-do lists. The category issue is a big deficit. It's hard to plan without it. (The flexibility with categories is what makes Outlook so outstanding -- such a shame not to find it it's "sister app.")

Came over from Wunderlist. Quite disappointing how many things don't work consistently or don't work at all. Shared lists are wildly inconsistent at syncing properly. I think using the website version of the app might throw things off. Overall, shared lists don't work consistently. You can set up recurring or custom tasks to repeat on certain days, but recurring reminders is again wildly inconsistent. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't. Also no folders for lists. Needs improvement

I use for many reminders, some weekly, some monthly, even some yearly. I love the ability to organize tasks into folders and set recurring reminders. Lately, reminders have been hit or miss, often not going off. I hope this is fixed soon. I also just had a big scare where many of my recurring tasks disappeared, but they returned after I updated. I would still recommend this app... but don't rely on it too heavily.

Been searching for a good list app for over a year now and this one has come the closest to capturing the qualities I'm looking for. It's very well organized and focused. Edit: Keeps popping up notifications for features I've already declined, and keeps resetting my settings. This is obnoxious. I'm going to switch to a different list app.
replyContent: Hi Timothy, we have made few fixes around these issues in our latest versions. Can you try the latest version? Regards To Do Team.

content: Fine until recent update. It was a perfectly serviceable app for to do lists until it recently started popping up alerts every day saying, "What will you do today?" This interrupts work, music, podcasts, and actually takes away from productivity because I pick up my phone to see if it's an actual alert. I don't seem to be able to get rid of this without turning off all notifications, which would invalidate using a To do list app at all. Totally unnecessary.

Excellent potential, but very slow to get up to speed on essentials (at least to me) for task managers. Main impediment: you cannot set up a recurring task to start again from the date completed (as opposed to always cycling off of the first due date). For example, I may want a reminder to clean my cat's litter box every month -- but if I don't complete it until week 5 (sorry, cat!), the next reminder pops up in 3 weeks, instead of in a month, when it's actually needed again.

Great app, but obnoxiously turns notifications back on. I turn off daily tasks reminder notification and days later it turns itself back on. This has happened at least 3 times. Microsoft, please fix this pesky bug. Also, the wunderlist app let me assign a task during creation. To do app does not allow this and requires extra steps to create the task, open it back up, and then assign it.

The best of what I've tried and that's a lot. No list or task app really handles recurring tasks well. This one is no different. Most things are great. I like having an app version in windows. Good for sharing. Sub groups would be nice. Moving and organizing can be difficult. Overall 3, that's still the best of the lot and this is the one I still just.

Covers the basics of a todo app and hasn't crashed. Has a nice feature of the flagged email however for in box zero folks like me, not that big of deal. One glaring omission is the ability to send an email to your task list. Also, it is crazy to me that they have notes but it doesnt utilize onenote! They have a perfect integration advantage that they aren't leveraging.

After 8 hours, the sync with Wunderlist mysteriously completed. It's still not the app I'm looking for. Does not support RFC2822 compliant email addresses with plus signs. "Unable to sync", imported about half of my Wunderlist data, now the Android app thinks it's no longer connected to the internet. Web app reports "Something went wrong" while trying to import from Wunderlist. Does not appear to be a useful "List" app, only focusing on ToDo items. Not a good replacement for Wunderlist.

Tried this out after the Wunderlist team was purchased by Microsoft and are pushing it on us in-app in Wunderlist. Unfortunately, it seems to have some bugs, particularly when list sharing with other people. Getting lots of errors and pop-up dialog boxes trying to share lists with others, possibly related to how long it takes when "getting a list ready" after sharing. Had to logout and clear storage a few times to get it setup. Going to compare with Remember The Milk (RTM) and report back.

Apparently inefficient, especially on a phone. I don't want a visual experience, I want an efficient way to manage my To Do lists (sharing with my family). The lines, from their screen shots, are too tall. This app may, or may not, be fine otherwise, however it requires a Microsoft account. Big nope.

I really like this app and want to love it. But I feel like I keep having issues where in the morning will set all my tasks on the app to set up 'my day'. Then in the office, I open the desktop app and it appears to be completed wiped and I have to do it over. Is this some user error on my end? Also I wish you could plan "my day" ahead of the day itself. Like a plan tomorrow option
It should be integrated with Microsoft outlook & calender so I would he able to see all my day schedule at one place. Please add it in coming update. It would be a great update for many users. Thanks
Little options, for example you can't plan thanks for the 1st Monday of a month or doesn't show the time when you complete tasks.
Would love to be able to drag and drop emails to create tasks.
I have use this app for long time but main problem i notice that the repeated task is not add in myday or other task list even I set repeat to daily then next day that task is doesn't show in list
nothing special

28-10-2018 Manages the tasks effectively. The app has a lot to offer with its simplicity and features. Edit: 01-02-2024 Needs update as the launcher has been same for the ages now. Folders, especially need a complete overhaul, such as larger sized folders, the option of unpacking of folder. The app suggestion could be better.
search needs improvement
really helpful to set reminders and its simple and easy to use. can be used simultaneously on multiple devices
Activate
Becomes redundant without wear OS watch support
Would give 5 stars, but you are unable to assign tasks to a team member in the "To Do" app. You can only create a task for yourself.
Don't like the fact I can't see a consolidated list and it's hard to find priority tasks.

A few glaring issues that make me not want to use it. 1) You can't reschedule a recurring task without it changing the recurring schedule. Meaning, if a task recurs every Monday but you can't get it done and schedule for Tuesday, it messes with schedule, sometimes recurring on both days now or switching days entirely. 2) If a task isn't completed, it disappears from My Day. You have to go digging for it. there's no overdue section
I mean... it definitely does what it's supposed to do, but the UI is so much straight out of 2015 so it sticks out of my home screen like a sore thumb. Sound effects are bad too.
good
I love it and I need it ... at the age of retirement more so than in my working life. It helps to organise, to set priorities and not to forget things above all.
would be better is there was more direct integration with onenote and outlook (rather than tasks being the default for these apps).
No estÃ¡ mal, solo que en algunos telÃ©fonos el widget se traba, no sÃ© actualiza, hay que entrar a la app para poner se que completÃ³ la tarea o ya es un nuevo dÃ­a.

Great overall look and feel to the app. One big thing I wish was available as a feature: Please provide an option on list settings to delete all completed tasks! I don't want to individually select many completed tasks in order to delete them when I still have tasks on a list. Even a select all completed tasks option would be useful in this scenario.

A great app, and so close to being perfect! I just desperately wish it had a way to queue tasks so you know what to do next (perhaps being able to manually add tasks to Suggestions, or create your own queue). I like to plan out what I want to do the next day, in the given week, and in the month, and having different lists doesn't really cut it, since I also use lists for categorization of the kind of task, rather than the time frame in which I plan to do them. Otherwise, it's fantastic

I love it. very simple and lovely interface, there are two reasons that I gave 4 stars; 1) I wish you add some more view such as week and month of calendar. 2) when I add an event to my outlookCal, then it automaticalky appears in my To Do List. (But currently it doesn't and I have to add tasks or events again in To Do List)

Getting better! The UI is becoming more modern, and I've always enjoyed the My Day feature. Some things I would like to see change include: removing or making optional the background image on lists; would like to see the title of the list at the top of the UI instead of mandating that space to an image. Also, there needs to be more integrations with other apps and services, instead of wunderlist.

I love the app so far. I really like how user friendly it is. But this app has a very limited selection of themes. Please offer more themes to choose from. Also, offering the ability to choose our own images from our computer or the internet for our task background would be great. Even though I chose not to use the Trello Task app, they have the above features I mentioned, and I loved having those options.

I've been using this app for at least 4 or 5 years now (when it was Wunderlist and now as Microsoft To Do). I use it constantly for weekly lists, groceries, and it has been wonderful for keeping track of odds and ends over time like books I want to read, music to listen to, etc. I like that you can attach documents. Only downside is I wish I could customize it more with different color schemes. Overall, very user-friendly.

Great app but one small thing annoys me. Everytime the app is updated the settings default to 'Play completion sound' on. I don't want a sound when I check that a task has been completed. Therefore every time there is an update I have to go into settings and switch 'Play completion sound' to off. A small thing but annoying and it would presumably be very easy to leave this setting as whatever the user has chosen.

Overall this is a great app for keeping track of what I need to do. Easy to use interface and clean layout. However, there is one big thing I wish they'd change. Pros: Clean layout Easy to use Good organization with different lists Cons: Can't change default alert options-- when you want an alert that's not one of the three default options, you have to change it manually every time you add a new task Would also like the ability to customize snooze durations

If you like Wunderlist, you should try this instead. Seems more logically organized, and I don't need to confirm every deletion in this app! I'd like to have the option for location based reminders like I can do in Cortana. So, it can remind me to stop for groceries when I leave the office, for example. Then maybe allow using both spatial and temporal reminders together!

This app works great. Very helpful for listmakers! Easy to add things, check off, make multiple lists and sublists. Only improvement I would make is in how you can organize the items on a list. You can do it by due date, alphabetically, etc, or all manually. I would like to sort some by due date, etc, and then have the option to order the others manually. Not an all or none option only. But that is a small thing. It is really quite helpful.
Muy buena aplicaciÃ³n pero el widget se me cuelga a veces

Been using this app for 5 years now. Best app for checking my assignment lists. Love the design as I can customise my own background hence it has been a great help in keeping up my motivation to come back for my assignment. No adds disturbing or money charges. However, one thing that I would like it to improve is that I hope it has a feature where I can move a whole category list to another category list instead of just on of it , else it will be too slow for efficiency as I need to scroll alot
I gave 3 stars because of 2 problems 1. Widget doesn't work very well. 2. It could have had more features.
i would like to connect with planner easily
Add archive, please! Other than that the app is super amazing!
great for business and personal use
Good app but lacks lists with multiple columns
Simple to use, allows flexibility to create groups of lists. Some awkward interfaces and glitches on the desktop app, but good for daily use
Could be a bit more flexible but it's my go to list app. The my day feature is a bonus

It would be nice if there were goals that the tasks could be related to. I don't need the business version of 365 just yet, so buying it just to get planner is not in the cards right now. So, having a way in todo to connect my tasks to my goals would be nice. That being said the app works well.

I really like it because it works from my computer and my phone and the information put in one will be accessible to the other. Great for making lists and being able to check things off. You can also reuse the lists for another time. I have a packing list that I have used repeatedly so I don't forget anything important. Planning meals so you can remember what was needed for a meal

With this app one can't forget anything! Simple tasks and daily chores that were awkward to add to the Outlook calendar are easily managed by this app along with complex tasks and events that integrate well with outlook calendar and OneNote. It keep synced with the desktop version and link well with win phone link. Incremental improvements makes it more productive. It's a useful companion to MS Android Launcher. This app is useful to all users even those who are not working in MS ecosystem.

The 'To Do: Lists & Tasks' app is going to get me on track. TBH organization has been my lack. I'm finnaly getting everything in order & this app is going to be so helpful. I think it's vital in this day and age to be prepared and organized. Just to gather all emails in one place to manage is nice, and setting tasks with reminders will be just as nice.

This is my absolute favorite app on my phone, and my PC. The fact that it's so easily ties into Outlook is amazing, and makes my life so much easier. Being able to add individual steps to each task to allow me to complete certain objectives in pieces is absolutely incredible, I feel like I am fully on top of my game and it is impossible to forget anything these days. Highly recommended for anyone that has a chaotic workflow and needs a little organization in their life. Absolutely incredible!

Edit: everything is working. I reached out to support and they asked to uninstall the app, restart phone, and install. I cleared the cached and data first, uninstalled, restarted, installed and was able to add both accounts without further issues. These apps work great and help streamline daily tasks. These nuances get in the way sometimes but I'm glad it's all working again! Thank you MS Support!
replyContent: Hi Nascar, To help you better please raise a ticket with us. Steps given below: 1. Open Settings 2. Scroll down 3. Tap Get support 4. Send us your problem, along with the copied UserID and SessionID. Regards, To Do Team

content: I was a longtime Wunderlist user and had a very hard time converting over to the Microsoft To Do. Once I got into the app and started using it I saw it was still a very good app even though there were differences between it and Wunderlist. I have completely converted over and probably use the Microsoft To Do app for more things than I did Wunderlist. The ability to switch between accounts is very helpful to separate personal and business lists.

Almost as good as Wunderlist. The only thing I would change, and this is very minor, is that every time I open the app, it goes automatically to the last list I updated, instead of to the main list of lists. That's my only pet peeve. My husband and I share grocery lists, Home Depot lists, etc through this app now that Wunderlist is gone, and it's very useful and user-friendly.

This is -to me- the most intuitive to-do app I've found so far. It's not big, it works well across my devices, it's simple but offers more depth when desired. Example: I can make a general list and decide which items need reminders etc. The app doesnt make me go through several screens for every single item, prompting me to set up dates, notifications, steps, etc.

I don't know where this app has been my entire life but I can't go without it now. I had paid for a different to do list app and it was absolutely terrible. There wasn't an option to set reminders, no due dates, no repeating events. It was a complete mess and I'd get so overwhelmed by it that I wouldn't get much accomplished, paper and pen would have been better. However, this app has been my ultimate life saver for my crazy busy life. It's so easy to use and isn't sloppy. You can add a task straight from your notification bar (s7 edge) if you enable that in your settings. I love not having to check it constantly throughout the day because I set a customized reminder with the task. I have this on my phone (primary use) and my computer, they sync without a single issue. My only complaint about this app is I personally don't need the "Important" list and there isn't an option to delete it.

For someone with ADHD who forgets things constantly (minute by minute), having an app that syncs across any device I want (PC, phone, work computer, etc) is a huge benefit. Think of some random thing I want to do? Add it on the phone, and then I can see it when I go to my PC next. It's a pretty darn good free app. It syncs with Outlook, too, for those of us who use it for work or whatever.

Love this app. Put the widget on your home screen and you'll never forget to do anything (I have ADHD)
Amazing widget

Its been getting better and better compared to other to do list apps available in play store and that too for free! So instead of paying to those premium to do list apps use this free of cost to do list app from Microsoft
Helping reminding task to do
it's useful to track
The software is extremely useful for short-term and even long-term programs. For forgetful people, the work is settled severely
It helps me simplistically list and categorize my to-do's and tasks.
if graphs and progress visuals/animations are added it would be great...
seamless syncing with Microsoft 0365 Calendars and keeping track of my business tasks

Horribly confusing, menus got stuck on top of other menus, it puts WAY too much unnecessary visual clutter that makes it hard to focus and figure out what is when. It kept things on the list highlighted long after they were over instead of fading them out... If only it was simplified, maybe a 24 hour clock but with AM/PM designations would be less intimidating than the weird wrap-around thing going on. Just lose all the weird background numbers & triangles so only the events at their hours.

Uninstalled...Not at all what I thought it was. This entire app is basically just a fancy way to look at the calendars you already have. Everything syncs both ways, so if you add your actually daily schedule minute by minute to this app you are also cluttering up your calendar(s) with the same things. Would've been neat if it actually had some kind of function, but I don't need to waste sd card space on a calendar viewing app.
replyContent: I always write the same thing in response to such comments.  The application does what it promises in the description and screenshots.  Please read application description before installation.  Then you insure yourself against wasting time on something that does not suit you.

content: Poor settings options. I tried to set a schedule for an entire day to be more productive. Kept getting emails for each task at the time I scheduled it. I also got notification pop-ups on my MacBook calendar app which seemed to sync itself with my Google calendar. I went to Google calendar to turn it off but it wouldn't let me. I had to delete all 10 emails, hide the notifications and now I will be uninstall this app. It should have an option to disable syncing. Nice idea. Lazy developers.
replyContent:
Included email notifications in the google calendar itself.  Turn off notifications for the necessary accounts in the settings of the google calendar application.  
Email me at 27applab@gmail.com, if difficulties arise, I will help

content: Exactly what i was looking for. But i have to sync it to my calendar? Why? I just want to put in 3 things that repeat every day and thats it. why do i have to sync it to other calendars for that? I cant even make a new event if i havent synced it to another calendar on my device or online? That doesnt make sense.
Downloaded because ibthoughtvit would be useful but I haven't been able to manually set events. Seems it had to run off of your calendars. I don't use them.

Shows you everything except for what you look for. I bought premium because I was very interested in a 24 h feature, but it is only available for the widget. The simplest things are constantly being displayed differently all over the app. While you can customise tons of color settings in premium, there is just no sensical priority to what gets shown big. It is difficult to find anything, like just a list of all events put into the app. Cool idea but insanely unintuitive execution.
For Daily occuring events it is showing next day event today, this is ridiculous. I have sent emails they didn't respond even though I took pro.

I wanted to love this app. I read all I could find on it and noted that it used Google calendar to create events. I guess I didn't process just HOW dependent on Google calendar it is. Even the five-star reviews didn't make it seem like such a big deal, so I figured it couldn't be that bad. Other than an appealing look, the app is essentially useless as everything, including notifications, are filtered through Google calendar. I may as well have just used Google and saved my $$. RE: YUP! USELESS.
replyContent:
Given the diversity of the needs of millions of people, usefulness is a very relative concept.
Thanks anyway for an honest and comprehensive review.
You can email me at 27applab@gmail.com to make a refund.
Have a nice day and take care of yourself.

content: You can only add tasks if you have a calendar app connected. I don't want to share that information, I just want a visual schedule.
replyContent: Hi, The application uses data only on the device for the widget to work and does not send it anywhere. This is written in our policy. But full autonomy would be useful as an option. We will consider, thanks.

content: The idea is great, however it adds only event to my calendar. I like circle planer idea and that I simply can put work and then event at work and that it reflects on this circle. This has potential but make it simple and functional. I was used to test some apps and for me this was not functional and easy going. Make it that 7 years old kid can use it.
replyContent:
Hello! We will strive for this! 
Please support us with a more positive rating.

content: Bought, tried & and didn't like it...can't find a refund button
replyContent: Hello, I have initiated a refund.

content: Too complicated and reminders they just disappear.
For Daily occuring events it is showing next day event today, this is ridiculous. I have sent emails they didn't respond even though I took pro.
Downloaded because ibthoughtvit would be useful but I haven't been able to manually set events. Seems it had to run off of your calendars. I don't use them.
Is not stand alone. Wants access to my calendar
Is this app for smart watch???????
replyContent:
Hello,
Watches on "Wear OS" are supported.
Go to Sectograph on your smartphone and activate synchronization with your smartwatch in the settings. In the settings for synchronization with a smart watch, make sure that the watch is paired with a smartphone. If so, there will be a button to the right of the status to install.

Updated: Still no watch faces in 2023 for Samsung Watch 5 or others. I would pay $5 for a watch face. .....Why even make a program like this if you're not going to have something practical and usable on a daily basis like a digital smartwatch. This app is a 5 min use install for novelty alone. Years after first installing, there are still no watch faces. The potential of this is great but wasted without the addition of digital watch faces.
replyContent: Hello. The application has full support for any smartwatch on Wear OS. There's Watchface and Tile. This also works on the Galaxy Watch. You can see what the watchface looks like among the screenshots on the application page.

content: Why it asks permission, I don't have google account for exporting data okay?
replyContent: Hi, permission is also required to use the local calendar repository.

content: I used to really like this app but now I can't get it to sync to my Google Calendar. I followed the instructions in the FAQ but found them to be written in an unclear way and nothing I tried doing in my phone settings worked to make the calendar sync. If I can get this fixed I'll change my review to 5 stars lol because I really did find it to be helpful when it was functioning properly.

Used to be an amazing app. Worked well with my phone's calendar and clock to show my upcoming calendar events and alarms at a glance. However it recently stopped showing calendar events on the clock face that weren't all-day events. All it shows now are alarms and all-day events. I can still view all old calendar events. It just wont show any that're more recent than Oct 21st if they aren't all-day events.
replyContent:
Hi Matt,
Strange.. We double-checked, the problem is not reproducible, and bug tracking and bug reports do not show any problems. Try reinstalling the application on your watch and smartphone. Check that the application version on both devices is the same 5.26.2. Don't forget to enable synchronization with your watch in your smartphone settings.

content: I REALLY want to try this app. It looks so awesome and helpful, and I must have downloaded it 4-5 different times thinking it might be fixed. Apparently, there's a bug, and the app closes whenever I hit the + (add task button). Please fix this, because the app looks pretty perfect!

This app was exactly what I was looking for. a visual of the day in clock form. Only issue is, if I add something to the clock it adds it to my calendar. I don't want that. I want an app where the calendar and app are separate. This was supposed to be for studying and exercise. I didn't want to have to add those things as into my ready packed calendar. it was a fast uninstall. Iif there was an option to disconnect the two, I'd reinstall.
replyContent:
The application is designed for calendar users.  
This is written in the description. The app does what it promises.
It is normal that the application does not fit all.  Everyone has their own tasks and needs

content: I have been using the fully unlocked version of this application for over a year. This is a fantastic app! However, it lacks the capability to sync with outlook calendars. For example, if I have subscribed to my work outlook calendar in Google calendar, the events will not be synchronized with Sectograph. This would be fine if this was the documented behavior of this application. However, subscribed-outlook calendars are selectable from the calendar selection menu...

The idea for this app is fantastic. But I can not get my Google calendar to show up on the app. I selected it as the calendar to use and when I click on add event it takes me right to the calendar. Once I create an event it does not show up on sectograph. I've waiting 24 hours to see if it was syncing weird but nothing shows up on this app but everything is showing up on my Google calendar. Not sure what I am doing wrong?
replyContent: Hi, This is how the application works. Device calendars, including the Google Calendar app, can provide their own interface for creating event edits.  The add form opens, we add the event, return to the application and see the added event.

content: I love this app. Paid for the pro package. Would be 5 stars, but the widget (primary way to interact with the app) refuses to display the current time without manual refresh from me. Have reinstalled twice and whitelisted the app for battery usage, still won't stay current. Hoping for an update to fix this. Nothing else out there like this app (I've definitely looked), or I'd be trying it.
replyContent: Hello, please email me at 27applab@gmail.com

content: Requires you to link your device calendar. Doesn't actually store your schedule, just provides a fancy UI for the calendar for some is the calendar features you're already using. It even opened your existing calendar to create events. I don't want to clutter up my existing calendars, or risk breaking important things, to try this out. It really needs to stand alone unless I choose to integrate with my existing calendar.
replyContent:
Hello. Thanks for your feedback! 
You can create a separate calendar in the My Calendars application menu specifically for the Sectograph to avoid overlapping with work calendars. However, yes, we need to add our own storage. And we'll do it in a couple of updates.

Maybe in the future you'll be able to link Proton Calendar and the widget will be stable, and then I'll gladly use this. Til then...bummer.

Really beautiful and great idea. It is unfortunate for anyone who doesn't buy into all things Google and don't use Google Callander. Just playing with the demo showed me the power of this style.

Best app for maintaining my daily activities. I recommend this to everyone that you can use it .

content: So nice this is very good

Though it was a great app, and I used it alot for over a year, even payed to show my support to the developer. I seem to have problems after the last update, and i can't use the app, tried everything i could think of. I ttied to reach for support, no answer for more than two weeks, I am little dissapointed.

I love the concept, but there are a few things I wish were different on the watch version: 1) option to keep current time pegged to "3 o'clock" position with events rotating around the dial -- this is similar to my other favorite watch face where the entire dial rotates 2) overlapping events from different calendars should be different widths -- they are difficult to read and even when opacity is set lower, perceiving them as different events is messy 3) tapping an event should bring up a card

This is a nice app, i wish it had a few more bells and whitles, like a timer for getting small things done, quick clean, workout. And a way to show goals or habits completed, to not completed. Maybe in a % style, or bar graph. Stackable goals and projects. I like how the wigget keeps your to do clock on home screan

This app is actually wonderful. I'm hoping you can add the "forward" and "backward" buttons on the widget (potentially just as another available function of those virtual buttons) like we have access to in the full app. It would be nice to click forward through the calendar and then, say, click the clock center to refresh and reload with the current time.
replyContent: Hello! We will try to do something similar.

content: It doesnt seem to be possible to delete a single event in a series. So if I want to block off an hour every day for the same thing, but then I have to schedule a one-off thing during that time, I can't just delete one occurence and leave the rest of the future occurences alone. I love the app otherwise but this problem is pushing me toward a different app.

I love this app ; the only thing that would make me like it more would be if the text wrapping on the sections made more sense. Sometimes the titles of my events get cut off and placed in odd spots in the sectors. Also I've found the colors are very limited. When it looks into my calendar to match the color my calendar has for events, it gets it wrong or doesn't have the color.

A little bit too complicated for me at the moment. I was looking for something simpler. I don't like the lack of face options in the free version. I created a whole cute design and didn't know beforehand that I was going to have to upgrade to save it. It wasted my time. Sure, I could have read the 'fine print' or tutorials, but I think what makes an app convenient is not having to study how to use it first because it is simple enough to quickly figure out.

Not really what I was going for. It's ok I guess if you want to use Google or your phones calender, but I wanted a detailed schedual with alarms to remind me to go to the next event. Love the look, but not useful to me. Biggest problem is the calendar goesnt have the right options for scheduling, like only choosing week days for a class instead of every day or every week. If it had its own options instead of going off the calendar it would be perfect!
replyContent: Hello. All right, the app is created for Google Calendar users. Everyone has different preferences. Have a nice day!

content: We need an update!! I love this app and use it daily but the fact that we haven't had an update in months bothers me. Here are some suggestions I have: add a settings option to default the amount of time you spend on a task (I use 45 min.), more color options for tasks, an option to change the notification sounds for each entry, a 'push all back an hour' option, and more widget options! Thank you I love this app but we could definitely use some upgrades!

It's pretty neat. I love the how everything pops out on the clock. Only thing is I tried scheduling things after 12 PM and it wouldn't pop up and I notice it only shows 12 hours at a time. If you buy the pro version it comes with the 24 hour feature, which I think is totally worth it. Seeing 24 hour option you can see everything from start to finish and not miss anything.
replyContent:
Hello. 
Yes you are right.  It works like a 12-hour clock.  
That is why it displays exactly 12 hours.  24 hours we added much later, at the request of users.

content: a little confusing at first, but it transfers your calendar and alarms to the app. one bad part is it adds everything on your calendar. like if you add "eat breakfast" it'll go on your calendar. so that's only a little annoying since my calendar needs to be clear and easy to read. but besides that. it works well
replyContent: Hello! You may find it useful to create a separate calendar for your routine. Go to the application, to the page "My calendars", click "+ Add more." Create calendars for any purpose.

content: I really have wanted this app to work, I'd really prefer to see my day filled on a clock in such a way so I even came back to try again, however I'm having trouble putting tasks in! After a certain amount they stop saving. I'm also struggling to see the clock in a way that makes sense. It looks very jumbled. Best of luck, I love the concept!

I do like this widget a lot however I left two stars blank for very specific features. First and most importantly I left a star empty for the ability to display battery status on the widget as I use this as my primary smartwatch face. Thus without this feature it is very hard for me to see the status of my battery at a glance and know when I should try to get a little bit of charging. The second feature is integration with Outlook calendar without asking for permission for the entire account if it needs to ask for permissions at all, as my workplace has very high security requirements. For each of these features implemented I will add another star.
replyContent: Hello. Thanks for the review. Let's try to provide these options.

content: I really like the app and associated Wear OS app, but it would be nice if the premium version was an app instead of an in-app purchase so it could be shared in the family library. I'd rather not buy it just for me, and don't want to pay three times for my family. edit: Removing a star. I just went in to upgrade to Pro and it's $8. Way too high for an app like this when there are less expensive options.

The app is useful on the phone and tablet. I purchased it believing that it would also work on my smartwatch as displayed in the pictures. You will only get reminders, not a watch face. The picture of the smartwatch is misleading. Either develop the watch face app or remove the picture of it.
replyContent:
Hello!
The app is compatible with any watch on the OS Android Wear. (Samsung Gear watches on OS Tizen are unfortunately not supported by the application).
If you have Android Wear, activate synchronization with smartwatch in the application settings on your smartphone. Go to the Play Market on smartwatch and install the app.

content: I like this app a lot, it is refreshing but to be 5 stars I should have more flexibility in setting intervals, like selecting days of the week so I can have work and nonwork day schedules that easily repeat. When I add something to a schedule a 10min before alarm should not be default, I'm using the app to plan my day primarily. Finally each new entry should default its begin time to the last entry's end time, with the new end time shortly after, say 30 min later. That would be a 5 star app.

Using this app for only 4 days as I wanted to schedule my tasks and time more effectively. The clock feature is a unique idea. Adverts are minimal, in fact I barely notice them. The main issue is that rescheduling a task can be very long winded and changing the time too. App appears easier to use in comparison to others. My suggestions is that they include more colours, that rescheduling is made easier and that the clock feature is more inline with the time of day, where tasks can't be hidden.

I appreciate that it does so with Google Calendar but it seems tasks would be great to see as well, even if only on the pro version.
