I look forward to more apps and more innovative ways than to do the str8 path. We all need the str8 path but the way life comes at us sum of what we want never really comes win we desire them to. So if we don't persist around uniquely. Such time will be lost.

Made a Persona style day-part clock with this app, and it really has helped me stay on track. I have a fairly set schedule, so this is really helpful. I can imagine it being a bit more difficult to keep up with if you are constantly adding reminders to it, so I don't know if I could recommend it to someone who has a wild schedule.

Overall great but could be better? Great way to display the data as a watchface. I do wish that once I change the color for a recurring event that the app would remember it. I like having the tile version as well when I want to change the watch face to something else.

It took me 3 days to figure that my outlook work calendar not syncing was not the app's fault but a company IT policy issue. I don't understand why you don't point users in the right direction in your FAQ? You're probably loosing quite a few potential clients who probably just give up where they could just chat to their IT administrator to sort it out. Also I cant access the detail view pressing on an event on the watch? Wherever I press it just keep switching between 12h and 24h view
replyContent:
Hello, 
We really should add information about this, thanks. By the way, if the version of the application on your watch is 5.26.+ , touch actions for sectors should work on the watch face (but not for tiles). Also, during the day, a stable update 5 26.2 with bug fixes will be released.

content: I love this app and the way it displays my calendar!! I also absolutely love the Wear OS integration!! When I found out this can be a watch face I got a smart watch literally just for that!! One setting that's needed: It would be helpful if the day or multiple days long events can be hidden on the widget and watch face. Or a setting where it can be tucked inside the arcs/events diameter. Having a separate diameter specifically for day long events is nice but it makes the watch face smaller.

Very good app. It helps me tremendously with my ADHD time visualization problems ("time blindness"). One suggestion: make an option to use the watch face as a Tile and not just a watch face. I have another watchface that is much more useful to me for displaying fitness tracking information and app links, which I use too frequently to have to go into the app drawer every time. But if Spectrograph could be a Tile, I would be able to put it one swipe left or right from the watchface home.

good experience so far. Nicely synchronizes with Google calendar. It also keeps track of the alarms on my phone. Lots of options and customization. Only complaint is that the widget stops synching with the current time after a while, and you have to manually sync it by tapping the widget after you realize that the clock face isn't accurate. Kinda annoying when you want a quick look at the time and events but it shows the wrong thing.

Good app, but not exactly what I was looking for. This app uses your calendar events and organizes them in the circle. The controls are great, I love when I move the red time bar it scrolls through all the things and shows the time changing. Love the widget. I wanted this to work out a homeschool schedule. I ended up having to make a new calendar and syncing only that one. I was able to change the colors of each event in the app. Very easy to use overall.

Excellent and useful! I wish I had a smart watch to put it on but it's good on my phone too. Occasionally the widget can glitch and turn invisible but it will come back. The outside clock face numbers are only black? Can't see them on my background and can't figure out how to change them. The widget palette is great, but I can imagine customization with background images of clock faces, different hand shapes, and/or color gradients to make it look really impressive!
Great app. Would love if there was something similair for garmin watches.
VERY useful representation of my schedule for the day. Responsive and easy to use.

Sectograph is an impressive app and I greatly appreciate the hard work of the developers behind it. However, it seems that there are a few crucial features missing from the app, such as dynamic theming and also a 'copy task' feature is much much need. Kindly take these suggestions into serious consideration. I'm hopeful that an update incorporating these requested features will be released soon.

Almost perfect. However, I would hope that the center of the smartwatch could be customized to show, for example, daily steps instead of the time and date, and the ring to show the progress of the step goal instead of the battery charge status. Also, I still would like integration with google tasks,or that the sectograph would include its own task management.

Good app to track but needs improvements. 1. There's no shortcut to mark the task completed for the event 2. Tasks in calendar view doesn't show strike out which you see on day view 3. There should be notification/alarm sound or alert to dismiss for the reminders

I like the concept and the execution. Regretfully, I cannot use it. I use my calendar for events, reminders, and tasks, so it is very, very busy. I really wish it would work for me. Nicely done! Now if you could do that for a to-do list that would actually use the phone's audible alarms --- yes, that might hold my interest. It would need a couple different things than a calendar, but that might be a very nice adaptation of this app. Well done, good luck!
Just downloaded. I wrote the descriptions of my tasks, but on the clock, they do not show up. Is there a way I could fix this. Now, there are no descriptions, just color if the time slot was taken.
Good
Good

Love the app, I wonder if there will be an option to use large ions in sectors as shown on app icon, rather than text? It would make the feel much more neat! Also,a good addition would be integragtion with reminding apps, e.g. samsung reminder.

Great app and it is free. Well structured. All the necessary information at one glance. Gives a good idea visually how much time certain tasks occupy of a day. Great if you want to simplify managing your time. No bugs, no glitches, no annoying ads. I feel almost bad for using this app for free. I am going to get the premium version for the visuals and to support this. Thanks for this amazing app. I love it. It's excellent. Very happy with this. Yes.

Sectograph, an innovative app, transforms my daily tasks into an intuitive visual pie chart, enhancing time management. Its seamless integration with calendars and color-coded segments aid in efficient scheduling. This app not only boosts productivity but also adds an aesthetic appeal to planning. Highly recommended for optimizing daily routines, Sectograph is a must-have for efficient and effective time management.

As a forget and visual person... (I'm not paid to review) I absolutely love this app. I struggle with visualizing the amount of time I have between tasks and events. Usually always late. It's so convenient to have it as a widget on my main screen to keep me in check throughout the day! This is such a beautiful app. I've used it for about a month and it's also helped with keep with a routine which is so important to my mental health. Highly recommend to those who has difficulties monitoring time.

I really like the visual aspect of this scheduler. I have ADHD and I'm on the spectrum and establishing a routine is really hard for me but to visually be able to see what's coming up and not too far ahead to start worrying about things unnecessarily really helps me to focus in on right now. And it's the visual nudge I need to Make the move from one activity to another which is difficult for me. This app is neurodivergent-friendly.

SO nice to see my day on a clock face! This makes it way easier to keep it straight in my head and I love the versatility with being able to add just a line for a start of an event, block out the time, hide events, or have the flags if it's several hours long (my husband's work schedule doesn't take up the entire space anymore ðŸ˜„) I know there's more features because my husband keeps showing me the next cool thing he just figured out it can do- tons of thought and effort into this!! Thank you!!

So far this app has been really helpful to me. It is a very intuitive way to view time. It helps me realize how much time I *actually* have in my day (which is less than I usually think). It's convenient to have repeating events in it as well. The widget is probably the best part. I get to see my whole day as a nice snapshot and I can always reference what I'm supposed to be doing when. So far, excellent app.

This app has been immensely helpful in keeping me organized. I prefer to create events in here as I can't set the duration of an event and that is sometimes more intuitive for me. One thing I would love is having events that happen concurrently stack, instead of laying over each other. I like to schedule small tasks during events where I'm expecting to have free time. I would also love to be able to duplicate events and change the calendar an event was assigned to.

Thank you so much for adding the ability to tap an event sector on my watch and see the event details. I noticed that I can not turn off the numbers on the face of the watch now. I see the setting on the app, but nothing happens on my watch when I change the setting. The numbers are always there.
replyContent: Hi, At the moment, clicks on sectors for smart watches are not supported.  We will add this feature.  Recurring events should be displayed.

content: Great app. I have a couple of feature requests. 1. Let me create a template, where I can have an event set up with a particular duration (45 mins) and reminder alarms turned off, so that I don't have to keep customizing those details many times per day for many events. 2. You already have a setting for the default duration of an event, but there are only a few options. There should be a numeric dial where I can set any value from 1 to 1000.
replyContent: Thanks, we'll work on it!  By the way, you can turn off the default reminders in the settings "Event editor and calendar"

content: I'm testing this app for a disabled person. I am loving it within 15 minutes of using it! One thing I think would really benefit him and myself would be to have a button or link within the task details page to open the alternate calander that is selected, such as Google Calendar. The Sectograph Calendar does not allow attachments. This way, an attachment such as a picture can be added to the task. Great app!!
Very nice app

Even the free version is just great, it provides just enough. I love it. The only watch face that's complicated enough to look good, but in a way that it's not just design, but actually improves productivity.
This has been an amazing app to help me visualize and understand my full day at a glance. I can't recommend it enough for folks who want to be on to of everything they do.

I love â¤ï¸ ðŸ˜ ðŸ’– this app very much. It is very easy to use.. hats ðŸ‘’ ðŸŽ© off to makers..... It is very good app because as a student I can make my sectograph of a day ðŸ˜Š ðŸ˜€ Thank u â¤ï¸ ðŸ˜Š
Good

This app clock is great! I really like it. I've been using it for years nowâ€”still using it!â€”and it just keeps on getting better. A suggestion tho, it would also be great if there's a desktop version of it and free syncing between computer and phone. Anyway, thanks for this!
It is on my must have top five list!
With a small learning curve, it is a beautiful, intuitive way of scheduling the day.
This is the app that I have been looking around to find for a looong time. Thankss

Great app especially for people with ADHD. I'm positively surprised by experimental feature of showing next alarm - it is working for me even through I use Xiaomi Alarm App instead of standard Google one (looks like timezones are mixed in this experimental feature and my alarms are off by one hour but this will probably be fixed before feature goes out of the experimental phase).

Nice app, but I uninstalled because you have to pay for pro ver. in order to sync with Google Calendar. I'm sure there's something like this out there for free. This is free, but you have to pay to sync with Google calendar, otherwise you can only see one day at a time you can't see monthly or weekly view or the rest of your schedule. Reply TuneTime: Syncing to Google Cal. with no charge in the free ver. There are apps worthy of a pro version, in my opinion this one is not.
replyContent: Thanks for giving more details ðŸ‘ We'll evaluate the possibilities for future versions ðŸ”Ž

content: March 2023 Update: Keeping that one star rating because I was forced to update the app and it sucks yet again. I can't just highlight something in the schedule and move it with the arrows like I used to because the arrows are not there. The template aspect of this new update is also terrible and confusing. Why can't you guys just fix the glitches if there are any and leave everything else alone? There's no need to revamp this app everytime there's an update. Keep it simple.
replyContent: Hi. In the current version you don't need the arrows when editing a template. Just long-click on a block and drag it to another place. This is not available on the schedule section yet but it's on the way. Depending on which version you were using before, we recommend checking out the big changes in version 4.0: https://timetune.app/timetune-4/

content: Overly complicated. I have tried using it multiple times because it has good UI layout. But everytime fails with waste of time trying to learn this app. I would at least spend 30minutes on trying to get started with this app before giving up everytime. I guess using a Google sheet or excel document to track schedule would be much better option than this app.
replyContent: Did you check the tutorial from the help section? Most users tell us the tutorial clarifies everything. This is the link ðŸ‘‰ https://timetune.help/en/getting-started/ ðŸ‘‰ If after checking the tutorial you still find it complicated, we'd like to hear more specific details at timetuneapp@gmail.com, to see where you get stuck and find solutions ðŸ”Ž

content: I find the app fantastic. The reason I am giving it only one star is just one single problem which is so tremendously important that without it any app, no matter how well-designed, is worthless: portability. Currently, the full-featured version relies on Google services, so if a user buys a subscription they are locked-in in Google's ecosystem. A long time ago, I bought permanent access to the full-featured version via a one-time payment, and I don't want to lose it when I switch to GrapheneOS.
replyContent: We read that it's possible to install Google Services in GrapheneOS on a controlled profile to keep using apps. But if you don't want to use Google Services, that's another thing. When you made the purchase you agreed to buy a Google license, that's it. They dont allow you to use the license outside of Google. We as developers are tied to this too.

content: I found it odd that the app didn't have preset hourly reminders. Most people have habits that require them to do them on specific hours (for example; gyming twice or thrice a day) the app should have a feature on where you can input the exact times in the day when it should remind you Another example of this would be:  Reminder: on every Thursdays at 7am and 8pm I should be reminded of (insert habit).  Instead it's jungle of toggles that seem to not make sense
replyContent: Thank you very much for giving more details. What you need can already be achieved with the app (with a routine for example). But you're right, some things are not intuitive. For the moment we recommend to check our 'Getting started' page (https://timetune.center/android-help/) but you can contact by email after this as well. We'll be happy to help

content: Still unable to be productive with the app even after the update. 1 - It duplicates events, so instead of getting two notification for when an event has ended and a break beginning, i would instead get 16 notifications. 2 - After two to three days it just stops, and the routine is completely clean, when i try to reactivate it, it duplicates events even further, now from 16 notications to 32 notifications, at the end of the day i would end up with nearly 320 notifications.
replyContent: Hi. Most of the time, when events or notifications duplicate, it's because the template has been applied in a way that overlaps itself. Please contact us at timetuneapp@gmail.com so we can tell you exactly what's happening. This might be very easy to solve and we want to help, but we can only do it with your collaboration. Thanks.

content: This app started out great. Everything was so organized and I was happy I had a digital schedule with reminders to carry with me. But it stopped giving me notifications, it also stopped showing my reminders all together. I wanted to uninstall the app for a while because it's never working, but today was the last straw. I had a reminder put for my midterm, but of course since it's such an awful app... it didn't notify me. I missed my midterm. Screw this app, don't download it.
replyContent: Hi. This happens because the Power Saving Mode on the device is enabled and blocks our notifications, it's not a fault with the app. As you pointed out, the app worked correctly and then something else made notifications stop.

content: I loved this app so much after I downloaded it and used it for about 2 weeks. Because I loved it so much I decided to purchase the pro full version and payed Â£4.99. However, it was not worth paying at all. I would have rather used the free version with the ads. I will recommend everyone to download the app and use the free version but dont get the Â£4.99 ad free version because it doesn't really give you anything extra. I would recommend the creator of the app to add more features for payed.
replyContent: Hi. If you contact us at timetuneapp@gmail.com we'll make a refund for you, there's no problem in that. Thanks.

content: I'd like to give it a 5 star, VERY MUCH. The app is very useful, convenient and easy to use and what's even better is that it allows the user to modify the alarm (sound, icon, etc) as we please that makes it much easier to organize our schedule. But the app no longer works after i've changed my phone, i don't know if the issue is about my phone (i used Mi A1 before and oppo currently) or the app. I've read about the configuration to get the app back to work but to no avail, please help. Ty
replyContent: Hi. This happens because Oppo devices block background tasks very aggressively, it's not a fault with the app. You just need to find the proper configuration for your model. We have general instructions for Oppo here: https://timetune.help/en/troubleshooting/ But if these instructions are not enough, we recommend to check in Oppo forums. Thanks.

content: Paid for lifetime premium for this app before back when it was a one time payment then they kept the money and in order to for me to get premium again they want a subscription fee. Not worth it. Your calender has the same function.
replyContent: Hi. We honored previous lifetime purchases for everyone. If you are seeing the subscription page, the problem might be something different. Please contact us at timetuneapp@gmail.com and we'll solve it right away.

content: Paid for lifetime premium for this app before back when it was a one time payment then they kept the money and in order to for me to get premium again they want a subscription fee. Not worth it. Your calender has the same function.
replyContent: Hi. We honored previous lifetime purchases for everyone. If you are seeing the subscription page, the problem might be something different. Please contact us at timetuneapp@gmail.com and we'll solve it right away.

content: Totally worst app

content: 3rd time I am unable to ad things go do ALL OF THIS SUCKS
replyContent: Hi, we don't understand the problem. Please send a screenshot of the issue to timetuneapp@gmail.com, so we can help you properly. Thanks.

content: The block vs templates is making a simple thing more complicated. The "edit original block" is an extra step that wastes time and interferes with scheduling a task for later.
replyContent: Hi. Remember that templates are not compulsory. You don't need to use them if you don't want to. Editing an original block is not compulsory either. You only need to edit the original block when editing a repetitive block to change all its instances, but this is the same as in a calendar. Compared to Google Calendar, there are no extra steps.

content: It's just immediately confusing to me
replyContent: Please check our tutorial, you'll see it's easier than it seems ðŸ‘‰ https://timetune.help/en/getting-started/ ðŸ‘‰ You can also find examples in our blog ðŸ‘‰ https://timetune.app/morning-routine/ ðŸ‘‰ If you have specific questions, let us know.

content: most of the time app drops to give alarm
replyContent: Hi. The problem happens because Infinix and other manufacturers block third-party apps by default, it's not a fault with the app. You can read more about this problem on https://dontkillmyapp.com/ ðŸ‘‰ To solve the problem, we recommend asking in Infinix forums for instructions about your specific device model. Thanks.

content: notification not coming
replyContent: Hi. The problem happens because Vivo blocks downloaded apps by default, it's not a fault with the app. To solve the problem, follow instructions for Vivo here ðŸ‘‰ https://dontkillmyapp.com/ ðŸ‘‰ https://www.undoze.com/

content: I want to like this app, but there is so much wrong with it. For example: even though I'm clearing my days to start fresh after having applied templates, every day is still populated. So any day I input anything, it will overlap and I'll have to go in and delete every individual event. Don't like that you can't schedule anything overnight. There also seems to be a lot of bugs in it, so at this point, it might just be easier to do all of this in Samsung Calendar instead.
replyContent: Hi, we're sorry you experienced problems with the app. If you also created individual blocks (besides templates), those blocks may create overlaps too. If you contact us at timetuneapp@gmail.com we can tell you exactly what's happening and how to solve it. Most of the time, the solution is simple. Thanks.

content: Every time I schedule something using the templates it makes duplicates. One change to the schedule throws off all other entries and everything overlaps. Most additions to my schedule cause me to have to alter the entire schedule just to make them fit and not just show them overlapping or double populated on the schedule. Why is there a learning curve for a scheduling app? Idk either. It should just work when you make entries.
replyContent: Applying a template doesn't remove other created blocks. Overlaps usually happen when the day was scheduled with individual blocks first and then a template was applied. A solution is to remove individual blocks and use templates only. You can remove individual blocks by swiping on the 'Blocks' section. Contact timetuneapp@gmail.com for better help

content: Broken App. It keeps doubling up items in the schedule every day. Clearing doesn't work. Applying a blank template doesn't work. I can't manually delete them because it repeats for every single day. Furthermore - if I do manually delete them for a day then apply a template - they double up again.
replyContent: Hi. Applying a template doesn't mean that other templates get un-applied. You can apply multiple templates at the same time. That's for example why applying a blank template doesn't make other applied templates disappear. The solution is to clear the *whole* template calendar ðŸ‘‰ Calendar / Top menu / Clear everything

content: (edit) Been using it for a while occasionally and every time it feels like a hassle to find what I need to reach within the app.. I only use the routines, no events or reminders, I have a separate app for that, Google Assistant wit a calendar. To add a change to one day it requires a lot of clicking to amend it.. I end up writing down the rest of the day tasks on paper, deleting, amending the times and adding them manually with the new times.. That's counterproductive. I need an easy way to move
replyContent: Thank you very much for your feedback, Alex. We're evaluating different possibilities for that.

content: I came back to this app a go three times over the last 2 years because I really wanted it to work. Each time I tried, I spent a couple of hours trying to navigate around the features and failed to get anything out of it. Incredibly unintuitive, no in app explanation, and the online "getting started page" doesn't explain much on what each features do. Edit: Thank you developer for the reply, it shows that you care. I wish you all the best in making the improvements, the idea behind the app is honestly good.
replyContent: Hi, sorry about that. We're working on several improvements to make the app more intuitive. There will be several changes in 2020.

content: Has potential and seems reasonably thought out in terms of intuitiveness for the user. However, it bugged horribly at me in the most basic thing you could ask of it: assigning a template to multiple days. Specifically, it doubled all of the tasks in all of the days assigned the template and removed the task titles. That pretty much made the app useless to me.
replyContent: Hi, sorry for the trouble. When blocks get duplicated, the cause usually is that a template was applied in a way that overlaps itself (for example a 7-day template only has to be repeated on the first day). That has a solution. Contact us at timetuneapp@gmail.com and we'll show you how. The problem with the titles will be solved in coming updates.

content: I dream this will become my favorite app in the future, but right now, it's more toilsome even than just using pen and paper. All start and end times must be entered manually. There's no drag and drop, no moving blocks around, no changing their lenght, no duplicating them easily, no default block lenghts, no autoschedule. If you have to make just one little change to your plan, it's easier to just scrap the whole day and start anew.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for your feedback. The app is still growing but we'll add more improvements with each version. Thanks for your understanding.

content: It's been nearly a year since I downloaded this app, and it's still clunky and hard to use. Blocks still don't have the option to appear on the calendar. You still can't organise the blocks by different orders, eg. 'Sort by date descending/ascending' I have to scroll through months of blocks to get to the most recent. There's still no 'home screen' to see all commitments. I thought I'd downloaded in early stages and it was just going to get better, but it seems this app is stagnant.
replyContent: Hi. The app is not stagnant, it's still evolving and in active development (for example, we published an update three weeks ago). We've been updating other features, but all suggestions are still under evaluation. Sorry for the inconvenience.

content: This needs trial period! I'm currently looking for an app that allows me to plan my day to the minute, that gives notifications when i want, and that is easy and intuitive to use. At first glance this app seems to provide me with everything i want.. However all those features seem to be locked behind a paywall. Now i am fully willing to pay for an app that does what i want it to, but i do want to be assured of that. In other words, it needs to feature a trial period for the premium version.
replyContent: Hi, sorry about that. We don't have a trial version yet but it's on our plans for the future. Meanwhile, we offer a 100% refund guarantee if you don't like the Premium version. In other words, you can upgrade to Premium with confidence, give it a try and if you don't like it we'll issue a refund without any questions. Thanks for your understanding.

content: It is a good idea, but it's not really easy to use.. in fact it's quite complicated :/ I bought premium because they advertised I could set schedules per day, and I can, but not how I had hoped. I recommend to make it simpler by allowing the user to toggle days per schedule in the routine editor, and additionally make any small changes in each individual day.
replyContent: Thank you very much for your feedback, we really appreciate it. If you want a refund, please contact by email and we'll do it. There's no problem in that. Thanks.

content: it is unstable with time in my Android phone , i.e it doesn't goes with time to time in order you should enter to the app so its become upto time
replyContent: Hi, the problem happens because Infinix is blocking the app. To solve the problem, please check https://dontkillmyapp.com/ or ask for specific instructions on Infinix forums.

content: I find a better called structured app and prosper.Kindly improve your or perish.Im not rude, but I am informing you how time blocking apps should work.Kindly give the users a better app experience.I would like to give my humble opnion before deleting your app.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for your candid review. We're evaluating different possibilities for the future.

I can't manually delete them because it repeats for every single day. Furthermore - if I do manually delete them for a day then apply a template - they double up again.

content: Two star just because of not adding the Task add option or project as other. The developer should alter this app. Look at the apps such as Timenoder, todos and planner apps
replyContent: Hi, we don't understand your suggestion. Could you give us an example of how you would use this feature? If there's another app that has this feature, let us know the name of that app so we can better understand the suggestion. Thanks.

content: Older version was much better.

Once you understand the changes, you'll see it's very easy ðŸ‘‰ https://timetune.help/en/templates/ ðŸ‘‰ https://timetune.app/timetune-4/

content: I want subscribe the app but it errors
replyContent: Hi. Please send a screenshot of the problem to timetuneapp@gmail.com and we'll help you. Thanks.

content: Not what I need. Lacks managing individual tasks
replyContent: Hi. Do you mean the possibility of adding checklists to time blocks? Or do you mean something different? Let us know and we can consider the possibilities (also, if there's an example of another app with this approach, let us know too and we can take a look).

content: There is a permanent banner ad about upgrading. It's very distracting.
replyContent: Hi. For a long time, we had been using the bottom banner to show general ads. But we recently decided to stop generic advertising and promote our own apps only. content: It's really only useful if you are doing recurring tasks at the same time, on the same days, etc. I set up a lot of tags (categories) but they can only be applied to the routines, not events or reminders. I was also not able to copy/duplicate events, which would have allowed me to reuse the same tasks at different times or days without setting up a brand new event. Disappointed in the app's scheduling capabilities.
replyContent: Hi Carrie. Keep in mind that the project is still young and evolving. We'll be adding features progressively. Thanks for your understanding.

content: I bought the pro version in hope I can organize my time to do my tasks, but the progrmer just disables the routine, that's all!!!! really?!!! the other thing I didn't like was to set a routine for a reoccurring like school or sleep I had to set it for every single day, one by one!!! you could have add a reapet feature to it. I'm not happy I wish I could get my money back!
replyContent: Hi. The programmer allows to schedule any routine in a specific date or period (check that the default program is not set as 'All routines disabled'). About activities, you can create only one and make use of the clone option (long-click and clone). In any case, if you prefer a refund please contact by email and we'll do it, no problem. Thanks.

content: My original review seems to have disappeared. I have an issue on my Galaxy Note S8 where I can't turn off the alarms without uninstalling. content: Have been trying to find a good schedule & alarm app for a very long time. This is a good schedule app. It sends notifications as set ( using free version). I would give this app 5 stars if it included an alarm & clock that could be displayed on home/lock/screen saver screens. The blocking works well, except when something overlaps. If it over laps you get over lap message in schedule to manually open it. Should see warning at creation accept or deny. Then show both in schedule.

content: Review as of 4-25-2022. Pro user This is a decent time managment app that is clean and simple looking. The ability to create routines is handy and they have added the ability to see overlaps but have removed the ability to turn routines on or off. Tags can now be turned on or off if you use them in blocks. If you use routines the calendar also becomes useless. I would like to see more personalization options reguarding the look of the app as choices now are very slim, though not vital.
replyContent: Hi. The old button was handy but didn't allow you to plan routines in advance. However, we didn't remove that possibility, it just works differently. The calendar allows you to turn them on and off. On: Calendar / click on a date / Apply template. Off: Calendar / click on a date / Clear from this day forward ðŸ‘‰ https://timetune.help/en/templates/

content: App duplicates set templates. Shows overlapping times for the same events when using the duplicate to every day feature. Unable to edit days once the event duplicates, making this app more of a headache than helpful. Spend more time editing than getting benefits of saving time, but the concept of the app is great. Just wish it was more user friendly.
replyContent: Hi Tiffany! Please contact us at timetuneapp@gmail.com and we'll help you. This probably has an easy solution. Thanks!

content: It was alright. I am a minimalist so I don't like cluttered apps, and this app is extremely cluttered. It's great to track your hourly schedule each day and to save daily schedules so you can reuse them! The colors are nice and it isn't hard on the eyes. It's just over cluttered with tabs I don't think I'll use.

content: This app has potential. I paid for the premium version in two weeks of using it. content: Would be great if you could change the email address on the account without having to REPURCHASE the premium version. I have the premium version but everytime I try to download the app it automatically connects to my boyfriend's email address when his email isn't even on my phone and gives me no option to change it.
replyContent: Usually, downloaded apps use the address used in Play Store at the moment of download. So you can try this: uninstall TimeTune (backing up your data before from the app settings if needed), open the Play Store app, make sure you are now logged in with your account, download TimeTune again. If that doesn't work, contact us at timetuneapp@gmail.com

content: This app is great. The reminders work and the customization is great. As someone with ADHD, this is super helpful in my daily routine. content: Great for maintaining and keeping a routine. This is detailed enough to develop any kind of daily/weekly/monthly routine, and flexible enough to incorporate out-of-routine events and distractions if you use it right. It is a bit tedious for some people, (that's why the 4 stars) but they can keep it simple and high-level if they like. But, if you really want to tame that beast called your work week, school agenda, or personal days like me, this will take care of it.

This app is great, and they're super quick to respond if you have an issue/question. This is the only app of it's kind I could find that you can plan intervals w/ start/finish alerts (w/ more options too). The only drawback I have that keeps me from giving 5 stars is the lack of desktop access. I also wish there was a way for blocks to overlap in more of a visual way, and that the length of time for the blocks was more visually represented as well. But overall, this app is super helpful!

content: I really like this for scheduling my daily activities. It helps me stay on task. I just wish there was a way to use it in the computer as well as the phone.

content: Best timer and scheduling app out there by far, in my opinion. This app makes it super easy to visually organize and schedule your entire day and stick to a routine. I'm a very visual person, so being able to schedule my day via colorful time blocks and add tags to each activity helps me stay focused and on track in a way no other app has managed. Been using this app for close to 10 years now (or earlier versions of it) and don't plan on stopping anytime soon.

I am RARE to review anything but this app takes the cake of my approval. I have executive function and attention issues so I find colors and ads overwelming on most apps leaving me irritated and discouraged from using most apps out there but this one has no pop up unless I want them. I highly recommend if you need to start a routine or habit and need a simplistic format this is the best app for your structure struggling needs. Bonus is the low ONE time price in which I bought it for.
replyContent: Thank you very much for your support! ðŸ¥° We're really happy to hear that TimeTune is helping you ðŸ˜€

content: This app has been a life-saver so far in college!!! I have several routines worked out: sleep schedule, school week schedule, crunch-time schedule for exams, and another for when my late-start class begins. My class times are a bit confusing, so this ensures I don't forget which day is which! I love all the features it supplies to set reminders or events, and timers that help me keep my pace when I read. Just absolutely love it, use it everyday!

I've tried a lot of routine apps, and timetune is amazing. I use another app to check off whether I've completed each item or not, because i like the widgets that I get for that feature kn other apps and tracking is good. But the schedule and time manageability timetune gives is GREAT, and I love the alarm features. I would love to see better themes, like custom backgrounds. And I would also love to be able to manage notifications better. The Persistent is too much, but the regular schedule isn't quite as intrusive as I'd like. Need a more customized notifications option. But all in all, 5 golden stars, great app!
replyContent: Hi! Thank you very much for your feedback and suggestions ðŸ‘ The app is young but we'll be adding improvements in successive versions.

content: I loved this all before, but with the new updates, it is the BEST!! I lose track of time easily and this allows me to make a schedule and choose which items give a notification. This helps me SO MUCH to stay on track throughout the day. Perfect for an ADHD brain! I'm a homeschool mom with a busy schedule and I struggle to keep the household running efficiently. This app is a gift to me!! Additionally ... I haven't encountered a single ad. â¤ï¸â¤ï¸ Well-designed app. HUGS TO THE DEVELOPERS!!

When I have routines scheduled in the programmer, some of them show a random tag that's not part of the routine at 12am on each of those dates in the itinerary and widget only, but when I click to edit it, that tag is not actually in the routine. Also, one suggestion for the future: create a feature that allows you to set a whole day back or forward in the number of minutes desired.

content: Love the app, it serves its purpose well. I've found that routines are a must for effective and long term habit building. The latest update allows 2 tags per time slot which is awesome. But, the notes now visually appear seperate, or disconnected from the timeslot and tag. It's really just an aesthetic issue, but I do wish it were fixed.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback, Janie! ðŸ‘ We keep gathering opinions about the new design to make decisions for the future ðŸ™‚

content: timetune is a very simplistic, organized, and helpful app! i have been looking for an app like this! it's nice on the eyes and you can customize almost everything! it has a dark mode and a cute little widget for your home screen. i recommend it for people that procrastinate and easily forget tasks! â™¥ (i thought this app had a bug. later on, all my apps started crashing. the developer kindly responded, but had it not been for the response, i might still be trying to fix my phone. thank you!!)

content: This is exactly what I was looking for in an app. It allows you to set up a routine, and choose whether or not it repeats daily or weekly, or a certain assortment of days (such as monday, wednesday, saturday etc.) This app also has notifications for each event to help stay on track with the schedule. It is very easy to use and read, and can be used to plan events, daily tasks, appointments, etc. I absolutely love this app, and to make it better all these features I spoke of are free.

For being a young project and all the features it has, it's doing a great job. I wanted something that wasn't exactly a calendar or a scheduler or a to-do list, but help me figure out where and how I am spending my time. This is helping with that beautifully. Love the interface, love all the colors. Probably spend way too much time picking out colors and tags! No glitches or problems. Definitely starting a wish list as I use it more! Would love to be able to analyze data in more detail.
good
easy block based time scheduler with templates and everything
Time Tune helps me a lot to organise my daily schedule.
Good

The app is phenominal. It's essential to have a time blocking app. and this app does it perfectly. I had just one suggestion in regard of intervening unplanned event that might occur in the middle of the schedule.
Great app for organizing your time.
good app
it works!
if this app disappeared my life would fall apart 10/10 would planner again

content: I was charged for a trial that I wasn't aware existed. There were challenges getting it set up on the app and I did more on-my-own navigating and reading than I would have liked. replyContent: Please reach out to customer support and we will help you cancel and get a refund if you don't plan to use Artful Agenda! When you sign up for a two-week free trial you agree to a subscription unless you cancel but happiness is guaranteed or we will make sure you get your money back.

content: This app is really basic and doesn't have a lot of options or functions. I like that you can link a calendar, but it needs to consolidate those views, it's really cluttered. replyContent: Hi Shevaun! Please reach out to our support team and we will make sure that you can cancel your subscription effective immediately and get a refund.

content: I hoped it would be good, but unfortunately, the only way to use itis to pay. When you open it, you're brought to a register page where you can start a 14-day trial. Not everyone has the capability to pay for an app, and I bet this would definitely reach more people if it wasn't pay only. Disappointed.
replyContent: Our aim is to offer a beautiful, customizable, ad-free planning experience to our subscribers. We prioritize ongoing app development and dedicated user support and are committed to fair and equitable wages for our team. The subscription model enables us to deliver an app that we are proud of and that is an exceptional value for the annual cost.

Overall, I ended up wasting my afternoon freetime trying to set up this calender/planner, but ended up frustrated, deleting the app.

content: No alarms for tasks. The widgets only show calender items(google already has this feature), not tasks. The stickers are garish and there is no option to upload your own art for the cover! content: I did the free trial. This planner does NOT have push notifications. You can set up your events and appointments, even make them reoccurring, but Artful Agenda App will NOT remind you or notify you. What good is a digital planner if it does not have push notifications. If I am going to pay for an app, it should at least have most of the features a free app has.

I downloaded this after seeing someone advertise it. Looked cool so I figured try it out, right? Until I downloaded and it prompted me for a subscription. Lady you are nuts. People rather by the paper agenda at the store for cheaper. You do not see the full texture of the book, it's an online planner on top of it. I'm not paying you for that. I downloaded a FREE calendar that does the exact same thing. Terrible marketing skills.

content: A creative digital planner that can sync across all my devices? What's not to love? Yet, aside from the numerous amount of stickers and covers, there is very little custom ability. Last, sticker placement does not translate well across devices. Great potential, not enough to transition from paper planners.
replyContent: A custom quick select palette is on our roadmap but you can currently save your custom colors by assigning them to each calendar category you create. You can change the titles of the task boxes on the Day view by using the pencil icon. We recommend adding stickers to the smallest device and making tweaks to the larger one for best results.

content: EDIT: That's great. Once there's a monthly subscription option available I'd love to give it a try. Cute but I'm not paying $35 for the same functionality as my phone's built in calendar. Only offering an annual subscription is ridiculous.

content: Love this app, it's almost perfect. Use it everyday across all my platforms. The only thing missing are note pages, then I would have everything in one place. If you need any help with getting your Lists tab set up, fill out a support ticket through the app, and our team would love to assist!
