content: Pretty but just too many ux issues to subscribe. Weekly view's all-day events need a caret on the left for expand/collapse; the expand target is too small. Would like to leave it expanded always. Adding tasks is awkward: the task text gets duplicated on the line below, the next/enter button doesn't add a new line, & the âœ…ï¸ is hidden behind the hamburger. The check bubbles below the days in weekly view should be different colors if: 1. There is a task, or 2. All tasks are done. Ditto for meals.
replyContent: Hi Molly, we appreciate your feedback! We would also love it if you submitted a support ticket for the issues because this is not our typical user experience and we want to resolve it for you right away. It is possible that if you enlarge the font size in the app it will also expand the target for you as well.

content: I'm really glad someone is making an app like this, but it feels like a very early version and it makes more sense to have a kickstarter instead of subscription if you need the cash for primary development. Loads more customization is needed, including a) allowing uploads for your own artwork for cover/theme b) ability to add/delete the modules you need (delete at least - I don't track water so it's a waste for me) and c) landscape mode. I plan to follow development though and good luck!
replyContent: Hi Lauren! We encourage you to join our Artfully Obsessed Facebook group where you can learn about our development process/future plans. The features you mention are on our product roadmap! Part of our subscription fee goes to ongoing development, but the main purpose of our fee is to provide excellent technical support and an ad free experience.

content: I really like it, a LOT of potential. But it's new so not perfect. Overall C+ Feedback: - Not loving the sticker styles - all very cartoonish - Make the subscription available to pay thru Google Play - Widgets need a daily or list option - If I'm paying for the app, don't make me pay for more stickers etc. Have a paid option or a free option where you can buy add-ons. - I'd like lists to be multi level. example: Click on list for 'Work' and it lets me have a list of notes FOR work.
replyContent: Hi Veronica! Thank you for your feedback. Feel free to submit it through the Tech Support section of your Artful Agenda under the category Artful Suggestions.

content: I do like this app. The aestetics & functionality are exactly what I was looking for & it has helped me plan out my days. However, for the price, I would expect it to be far less glitchy and for there to be more customization and sticker options. Every button in the topbar leads to the same menu; it's redundant and could be sleeker. It's a good app but I don't think the contents match the price point quite yet. I hope there are updates in store.
replyContent: Hi Jess! Can you please fill out a support ticket through the app? We're confident that our dedicated support team can find the solution to what you're experiencing! We are also continuously adding new stickers, covers, and other features to help you customize your Agenda! Stay tuned in to our Facebook group, Artfully Obsessed, for updates!

content: So far I love the layout and look... I'm not giving it 5 yet but will update as I use it more... I don't like that if I click on my notification that it opens the event to save or delete I stead of just looking at it or giving me the option to complete. My other issue is not being able to change the time I want an all day reminder. Again I love it so far but would like to see that changed.
replyContent: Thank you so much for your feedback! We are going to add these suggestions to our product roadmap.

content: Its a beautiful app. I find it to be a halfway point between a pdf planner and any digital calendar such as Google calendars. The deal-breakers for me are that it overrides my Google calendar color coding, and the sticker organizer isn't very intuitive. Not a huge fan of it being subscription based, I'd rather pay 20 bucks outright, but I won't say it isn't worth the money.
replyContent: Hi KB! We can help you set up your AA with the exact same colors as your Google calendar, no problem! Our stickers tab now has a search, most recent, and most frequently used function that makes finding the sticker you want easier than ever. Our subscription allows an ad free experience, frequent updates to the app, and a dedicated support team.

content: This planner sounded perfect for me, so I downloaded it. There is a gracious 2 week free trial. But, then it's $34.99/yr! I thought that some reviews said that the subscription was less than what they spend on planners in a year! I was expecting a subscription at $15-$20! How many planners are you buying that you're spending $35 a year, lol?! It said in the app, something about a per month subscription. But, the only way I saw that it allowed sign up was per year. I can't afford that:(
replyContent: Many of our subscribers save considerably compared to what they spent on paper planners, stickers, washi tape, colored pens, etc. and they actually use AA because it's always with them. Our annual subscription allows our users to have an ad-free experience, dedicated customer support, and frequent updates to features, many user requested.

content: I've been looking for an app like this for like 2 years. Good notes is great, IF your an apple user which I'm not. We really needed something similar for android. I was really excited to see it and was getting ready to just purchase the yearly subscription for $38, until I realized it wasnt s-pen compatible. ðŸ˜¥ Half the reason people like planners is because we enjoy writing with a pencil. It was ALMOST perfect. Uninstalling to wait on the perfect one. Not settling.

This app has great potential! Great tutorial that helps show you how to access different functions. I particularly enjoyed the tasks layout and that we can track our meals and water intake for the day. However, it was very difficult to sync Google, Microsoft, or iCloud to the account and you cannot continue unless you sync one of those accounts. Another downfall is that I could not actually enter in anything to the calendar. Bummer! Will possibly redownload after it's out of beta.
replyContent: Hi Mykailah! At the time you were trying to sign up we were dealing with an issue that was preventing users from linking new calendars with Artful. This isn't typical for our user experience, and a short time later we were up and running normally. We hope you will give it another shot so you can actually see Artful Agenda in action!

content: I downloaded it first on my phone, then was very intrigued to see the laptop version. Unfortunately I run an earlier version of Mac OS and won't be able to. The phone version was very easy to use, integrated with my calendars and had a wonderful design. The designs are also customizable, so you can always change up the look. If they offered older versions of the app for Mac OS that would be awesome and I would definitely be a subscriber.
replyContent: Hi Gabby! Thanks for your review. Our web app is great and robust, so it's a good option. Our desktop apps can be found here https://www.artfulagenda.com/desktop-apps/ and work on most devices, but if your device can't be upgraded to a current version of iOS, you can create a shortcut from the browser that you can pin to your task bar instead.

content: It's Okay Pros: It can be synced to alot of your devices for consistency across platforms, there are no ads, can be cheaper than a paper-planner, less paper waste Cons: It can't be personalized to what you're wanting in a planner (features), it is only a planner- there's nothing for financial recording, daily note taking, habit tracker, journaling prompts, etc.
replyContent: Hi Deanna! AA offers many customizable features such as being able to title the task boxes to whatever works for you and one of the boxes in the daily view can be checklist or paragraph style giving you a place to journal daily. We have trackers on the road map for development, and our FB group shares lots of ways they track habits & finances in AA

content: This app is as close to a planner app (short of using Penly to create my own digital planner...which takes A LOT of time and work) as I have been able to get to! Why 3 stars? The ONLY reasons I may not use it after the trial is that I can't create a calendar that ISN'T in the cloud (just on my phone) and it also doesn't seem to properly work without internet. My planning time is on my commute which is in the subway (no reception) so edits are either not possible or revert when a connection hits
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback Metah Fore Genome! Our current offline mode is still in phase one which is read-only. Stay tuned to our social media channels for announcements of future updates that may make Artful Agenda better for your lifestyle.

content: Great concept the idea of this is great but theres a couple things that need work and i have a few ideas app is very slow or laggy. Sometimes it wont let me click on the sugested address. Also would be useful to be able to click address in planner and pull up directions in google map, i would also like to be able to link a list to a event and or address would also like to be able to "build my desired layout ,more themes and stickers

So the idea of this app is perfect, and exactly what I'm looking for, but the subscription is wayyyyy too much for the miniscule amount of customization and stickers they offer as of this review. Perhaps in a year or so they'll have enoight content to warrant that pricing, but until then I'll just have to keep hoping for an app just like this FULL of features.
replyContent: Hi Christine! Artful is priced to reflect what users were previously paying for a paper planner. The subscription fee allows us to continuously update the app and add improvements based on user feedback! We encourage you to stay tuned in to our Facebook group, Artfully Obsessed, for updates and hope you give us another try in the future!

content: I really want to enjoy this app, I do â€” but the forced log out sessions when offline / in airplane mode make me not want to use it moving forward. If there were an option to stay logged in permanently, I would definitely consider using it again. I think the app is very intuitive! I just don't enjoy the log out sessions.
replyContent: Hi Devondria! Very soon we will be releasing our offline mode, which is currently in beta testing. But we encourage you to submit a support ticket because even without offline mode applied it should not be logging you out. You can submit a ticket through the main menu of your Artful Agenda app.

content: It's not bad if you're trying to switch from paper to digital. There are some free decorative backgrounds and stickers but most you have to pay extra for. There is no dark mode. They just added another tier to pay for to access some new features. I don't like how the placement of stickers moves. If I add them on my phone and then look at it on my computer, they are all moved around. It is annoying that it doesn't save colors you put in, except now that's a feature behind another pay wall. NFM
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback Lisa! We are open to suggestions from our subscribers as to what types of additional free covers and stickers they would like to see, so please submit through Tech Support under category Artful Suggestions. Color coding by category is a great way to save the colors without Artful Plus!

content: Great idea but only about 90% done It's amazingly beautiful and is a great alternative to outlook calendar and maybe some task lists. Currently searching for a Windows/Android app that will allow me to replace the multiple different programs I have to use. The biggest missing feature that would allow this to truly be my must have app is the ability to use my stylus and write on the notes feature. Foldables and convertible laptops are becoming more popular and need this functionality.
replyContent: Hi Paul! Adding the stylus capability that our tablet apps already have to other devices like the Galaxy Notes and ZFold and Microsoft Surface Pro is solidly on our roadmap for future development. Due to the unpredictable nature of app design and development and the lengthy list of new features we have planned we don't have an ETA but it is coming!

content: I like it but it cost money
replyContent: Our aim is to offer a beautiful, customizable, ad-free planning experience to our subscribers. We prioritize ongoing app development and dedicated user support and are committed to fair and equitable wages for our team. The subscription model enables us to deliver an app that we are proud of and that is an exceptional value for the annual cost.

content: I like that you can enter in one area and it will populate in all necessary areas. However I do not like that I have to link a calendar (such as outlook or Gmail) to schedule stuff.
replyContent: Hi J Myers! One of the goals of Artful Agenda is to increase integration, so you do need to link a source calendar to use the app. If you don't want to link any of your current digital calendar accounts you can create one to use just for this purpose. https://accounts.google.com/signup

content: It's a decent app but I wish it had more. It doesn't give you the choice to make menus or to play and other things out
replyContent: Hi Sarah! If you haven't already, please join our Facebook group Artfully Obsessed so you can see how our subscribers are currently using the Meals section to plan their menus and the task boxes and List tab to plan things out.

content: A monthly subscription is needed after a 2 week trial but not advertised until you download and set up an account.
replyContent: Hi Nancy! Our app description clearly states that it is free to download but requires a subscription to use. We offer a free 2-week trial of Artful Agenda so you can see if it is for you before you are charged. Our subscription allows our users to have an ad-free experience, dedicated customer support, and frequent feature updates.

content: Looks great! Would have liked to try this. But I have to give my credit card details just to be able to do a trial and actually see it. No.
replyContent: Like most subscription services, we require a valid form of payment to create an account to qualify the subscriber and ensure uninterrupted service. A 2-week trial lets you see if AA is right for you before you are charged. Users can cancel immediately after setting up their account and still use it until the end of the 2-week trial period.

content: This app is as close to a planner app (short of using Penly to create my own digital planner...which takes A LOT of time and work) as I have been able to get to! Why 3 stars? The ONLY reasons I may not use it after the trial is that I can't create a calendar that ISN'T in the cloud (just on my phone) and it also doesn't seem to properly work without internet. My planning time is on my commute which is in the subway (no reception) so edits are either not possible or revert when a connection hits
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback Metah Fore Genome! Our current offline mode is still in phase one which is read-only. Stay tuned to our social media channels for announcements of future updates that may make Artful Agenda better for your lifestyle.

content: Same as Google Calendar but prettier. Exact same functions as Google calendar, day/week/month. I didn't use it long, but the widget wasn't as useful as Google calendar. I like being able to see the month overview on my home screen. The only plus seems to be that it is pretty. Stickers covered up events, so they weren't helpful either.
replyContent: Artful Agenda typically appeals to people who love paper planners but just cannot get them to work for their digital lifestyle. Artful Agenda is much more than a digital calendar. It has custom task boxes, meal planner, water tracker, month and week goals, a place to journal daily, a tab to keep lists and notes, and beautiful covers and stickers!

content: It's a cute app. I like all the customizations that are available. One thing that needs fixed is the alarm. When you set the alarm for days or weeks prior, you can't change the time for the alarm. I want to set it for 5 pm, however, it will not lemme change it. If this could be fixed, I will be glad to give it 5 stars. Thanks for the response. I use it as a bill pay reminder and need to set those days as all day events. There really shouldn't be a default for the alarms. It seems pointless.
replyContent: Hi Nikki, thank you for your feedback! Currently, all-day events are set to default at 9am but scheduled events can be set minutes, hours, days, weeks, etc. Please submit a suggestion through the Tech Support section of your app under the category Artful Suggestions and we will pass it on to the development team!

content: Easy to use
replyContent: Hi Katie, thanks for your review. We are happy to hear that you are finding your Artful Agenda easy to use!

content: Must be online to use, otherwise I loved it, but that was a major issue
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback KA! Our Phase 1 of our Offline Mode is currently read only but in the future, we hope to have the ability to edit while offline as well.

content: It's a very nice app, but it would work better for me if my all my tasks, already entered in my email accounts could be imported. Having to type them again is not something I want to do. How do I request my data to be removed. I see that is a request I need to make from the app developer. That should be an option asked when I uninstalled the app from my device.
replyContent: Hi Tracy! Being able to sync with Google tasks is something we may consider for future development. You can send an email to hello@artfulagenda.com and request that your User profile be deleted from our system and we will be happy to do that for you.

content: This app is on the right track, it just doesn't make sense for me to move to this calendar if it can't integrate with Microsoft. I don't need admin permission for any other app to use my work Outlook account. It's a small thing, but a big necessity for me to want to pay for a calendar. It has to actually be able to handle everything in one place.
replyContent: AA does sync successfully with Outlook calendars but we don't have any authority over individual organizations' cyber security restrictions and what criteria they use to determine what apps they will or won't allow syncing without admin approval. We understand that this can be an obstacle for some but unfortunately, it is out of our control.

content: Has a lot of promise but not quite there yet.
replyContent: Hi Salmonde! Would love for you to submit a Tech Support ticket through your Artful Agenda under the category Artful Suggestions to let us know what features you would like to see added.

content: Honestly, not a fan. I tried, long enough to be charged the $30 yearly fee. But it's not for me. The alarm setting/feature doesn't work. It just sends a notification. In which case it shouldn't be called an alarm. It absolutely does nothing to help me stay organized on a daily basis or keep me on schedule unfortunately. Definitely not for you if you're ADHD or anything of the like. Don't even bother. Guaranteed it'll just be a headache and a waste of your $30 if you try.
replyContent: We are sorry to hear that AA wasn't a fit for you. Please reach out to support so they can help you cancel and process a refund for you. Our founder Katy Allen has ADHD and designed the planner as a way to help herself stay organized. We have many members of our FB community with ADHD that say it is the only planner that has stuck for them.

content: You tricked me. A free trial is not a free app. Not looking for another subscription or cost in my household.
replyContent: We are sorry it seems misleading but because our app is free to download and use as part of your AA subscription, the same as the Netflix app is free to download, the Google Play Store requires us to list it that way. We have made it clear in our app description that although free to download, it requires a subscription to use, no secrets!

content: I wish it was as quick as Google calendar. The extra second or 2 to load up or perform small tasks is kinda tough. Other than that, it's a natural learning curve to get used to.
replyContent: We are sorry to hear that it is laggy for you! Feel free to submit a support ticket and the developers can take a look into that for you to see if there is any way to improve the performance.

content: Really buggy on my phone. Great on a desktop
replyContent: Kelly we are sorry to hear that you are experiencing issues on your phone! Please reach out to our support team through the Tech Support section of your AA so we can help you troubleshoot the problems you are having.

content: Didn't have notifications so I didn't stick around to check out very much.
replyContent: Hi Michelle! We do have push notifications for events currently. Push notifications for tasks are on our roadmap for future development.

content: I love how it syncs with Google for my husband. I'm using the meal planner and grocery lists which I enjoy as well. I'm still waiting and hoping for additional tracking like fitness and budget. Why artful agenda are you now charging an upgrade fee for those of us that committed and have stuck with you? This is super disappointing. As my original review shows I was asking for these things. When you said it was coming I purchased. Now I have to pay again not right not right at all!
replyContent: For those with legacy pricing, this comes out to $1.25 more a month when spread out over the year. We did this to offset the increased costs of data storage involved in these features as well as the costs to develop and maintain them. This business model ensures our long-term stability, safeguards your investment of time and protection of privacy.

content: I love the idea of this app. This is exactly the kind of planner app that I would like. I love the concept of a paper planner format with google calendar integration. However, there are still too many bugs to be functional. And there is not pen support that would make this perfect with my Samsung tablet.
replyContent: Hi Amanda! We would love to have our dedicated support team help resolve any issues that you are experiencing with your Artful Agenda. Please submit a ticket through the Tech Support section of your app and we are confident our developers can troubleshoot solutions with you. We do have stylus capability in the tablet app under Drawing Mode.

content: Very good calendar/planner. I love paper planners and this has come the closest to replicating that feel with the functionality and portability of a digital planner. Syncs quickly and easily with Google Calendars, which we use so keep track of home vs. work vs. extra schedules, activities, meeting, etc. I would like to see the ability to change the time for an event notification as well as more comprehensive customability for recurring events.
replyContent: Thank you for your review and feedback Amy! We are glad to hear that you are enjoying the best of both worlds with your Artful Agenda. Please reach out to Tech Support about your suggestions regarding notifications and recurring events, we have a category for Artful Suggestions!

content: Best calendar app I've used! Constantly improving & adding features. Still missing a few important ones (make lists private/only for 1 user & not others, repeat/rollover tasks is awesome but sometimes does not work correctly, edit a task in Artfully if pulled through from another calendar, etc.). At times a bit clunky, but overall it's extremely helpful & incredibly beautiful! Its fun stickers and gorgeous backgrounds always make me smile, too! (Thanks for all your hard work, Artfully team!)
replyContent: Thank you for your review Allison! We are thrilled to hear that you are enjoying the fun and functional features of your Artful Agenda. Whenever something isn't working quite right, please submit a support ticket so our team can look into it for you. Happy [digital] planning!

content: This app brings together everything I wanted in an agenda. I can easily track my goals & to do list as well as see my calendar. The website is better than the app. I have to clear the app from my recent apps in order for it to respond when I try to mark a task as complete. Customer service solved this problem. I also don't love getting notifications from this app for calendar events, and so still in put data in Google Calendar, but it syncs perfectly with this app. The cost is appropriate.
replyContent: Hi Bonnie! Thank you for your review and feedback and are happy to hear that you are enjoying your Artful Agenda. We would love for your to submit a tech support ticket for any issues you are experiencing and for any suggestions you have for how you feel the user experience could be improved under category Artful Suggestions. Thanks!

content: I love the app! It's great and syncs well with my other calendars. The only thing I wish they had was to choose different weekly and daily layouts. It's the best planner I have used and always end up abandoning my paper planners. Haven't done that with this one!
replyContent: We appreciate your review Marva and are happy to hear that you are loving your Artful Agenda and you are sticking to it to stay organized! If you have any suggestions you can submit them through your app in the Tech Support section under the category Artful Suggestions. Thanks!

content: I love all the features about this app. I have been a hard copy planner and digital calendar user up until now. My biggest complaint is the drawing feature on the ipad (which is the main thing that makes me a convert) is very buggy and the app crashes very often on the ipad. The drawing feature sometimes deletes randomly or moves things drawn to odd places. If those issues were fixed it would get 5 stars. Love the sticker feature. Would love a check mark sticker. Wish stickers could be resized.
replyContent: Thank you for your review Alice! We are so happy to hear that you are loving your Artful Agenda! Stickers can be resized by double tapping them and two finger pinch to zoom and rotate. Please submit a support ticket through your iPad so our development team can take a look at your issues with the drawing feature!

content: Overall I really really LOVE this digital planner. I do see room for opportunities but that's with anything. Things that would make it 5 stars would be: 1. Putting tasks on the daily view and allowing task reminders, alot of people miss tasks because you specifically have to look to remember to do it. 2. Having a budget add-on where you can manage income and expenses in the app on a daily/monthly basis. 3. Being able to show the calendar in a widget form for your phone/tablet.
replyContent: Hi Brianna! Glad to hear that you are enjoying Artful Agenda. There are 3 separate task boxes on the Day view that you can name whatever you would like and task reminders are currently in development. We have an agenda view and a month view widget available with your app. Budget trackers are solidly on our roadmap for future development as well!

content: I've only had this planner a day, but so far I love it. I need to be organized and have several calendars, including a paper calendar, but can never find a digital one I like. I love being able to customize the look. I also like the menu option, as I usually write my menu in my paper planner and on a wall calendar. It's nice to see on my computer or desktop and keep track of for shopping. I'll update when I've used it for longer, but so far I really enjoy my first impression.
replyContent: Hi Krista! Thank you for your review! We're so glad that you're enjoying the app!

content: It is a well thought-out agenda, but I would rather see the weekly view in an up/down format with full agenda at a place, rather than small boxes going side to side. Fonts are adjustable in 'list', but in calendar they are to small to read without zooming in, & they can't be adjusted. Would also prefer black fonts with the highlight, rather than white fonts.

I do not spend time writing reviews however, I love using my artful aganda it what I needed in my life and it has MOST of the features that I need in my day-to-day life. I am writing this view in hopes to bring awareness and bring attached too their daily quotes. It would be wonderful to read from people of color, LGBTQIA2S+ and our disability community during each celebrated months. Representation matters.
replyContent: Hi Jasmine! We appreciate your feedback and your review. So glad you are loving your Artful Agenda to keep your schedule on track. Please submit your suggestions through Tech Support under the category Artful Suggestions so they don't get lost here. Thanks and happy planning!

content: Being a full time employee, full time grad student, and a mom, my schedule is crazy. This planner has been a game changer for me. I can color coordinate and use it on multiple devices! It's great! I just wish it more security. So like a bank app or something you need a pin or fingerprint to access it.
replyContent: Hi Adriana, thank you for your review! We are so happy to hear that Artful Agenda is helping you stay organized with such a full schedule!

content: No Pen Support. I liked this app... the ease of use for the calendar is great. I didn't realize that there is no pen support. Canceled my trial. May check it out again later.
replyContent: Hi Judy! Certain keyboards like Google Keyboard with Handwriting Input should allow for handwriting-to-text, and our Artful Plus tier includes drawing/handwriting capabilities within the planner.

content: Love this app .I would have given it 5 stars if it had a option to pay monthly instead of just yearly.
replyContent: Thank you for your review and your feedback Alinda! We are thrilled that you are loving your Artful Agenda to stay organized. Happy planning!

content: This is a great app I just wish they would offer a monthly subscription also
replyContent: We will pass along your feedback to the rest of the team Silki! So glad you are enjoying your Artful Agenda, happy planning!

content: I am very new...about a week! I love that i can see AP on all devices (even an OLD ipad!). It is taking me along time to get it set up, to figure out how i want to use it. I am SO greatful for this app!!! i have spent too much money buying other digital planner apps that i was unable to figure out how to use. I am so happy with Artful Agenda Plus! i looks like something accomplished! the Admins are super friendly, the communnity is very friendly and cheerful!!! I am quite happy i bought this
replyContent: Thank you for your review Missy! We are thrilled to hear that you have found planner peace with Artful Agenda and the new Plus features and are enjoying our community! Happy [digital] planning!

content: The calendar is really cute. It is very aesthetically pleasing. I like that you can add stickers and link Google Calendar. There is a section to add Monthly, Weekly, and Daily Goals. As well as customized sections on the Daily view.
replyContent: We appreciate your review Yvette! So glad you are enjoying all of the fun and functional features of your Artful Agenda. Happy [digital] planning!

content: I love how it syncs with Google for my husband. I'm using the meal planner and grocery lists which I enjoy as well. I'm still waiting and hoping for additional tracking like fitness and budget. Why artful agenda are you now charging an upgrade fee for those of us that committed and have stuck with you? This is super disappointing. As my original review shows I was asking for these things. When you said it was coming I purchased. Now I have to pay again not right not right at all!
replyContent: For those with legacy pricing, this comes out to $1.25 more a month when spread out over the year. We did this to offset the increased costs of data storage involved in these features as well as the costs to develop and maintain them. This business model ensures our long-term stability, safeguards your investment of time and protection of privacy.

content: Thus far, enjoying the app, cross-device use, connectivity, and ease in adding the multiple personal and business accounts I monitor. One product suggestion which was submitted to tech support, have Samsung Galaxy Tab 6Lite and the pen to text does not work. Will this be a future feature.
replyContent: Hi Hope, thank you for your review! We are happy to hear that you are enjoying your Artful Agenda. We have passed on your suggestion regarding S pen compatibility. In the meantime you may want to look into using the Google keyboard Gboard with Handwriting input to do handwriting to text in your Artful Agenda.

content: I love the idea of this app. This is exactly the kind of planner app that I would like. I love the concept of a paper planner format with google calendar integration. However, there are still too many bugs to be functional. And there is not pen support that would make this perfect with my Samsung tablet.
replyContent: Hi Amanda! We would love to have our dedicated support team help resolve any issues that you are experiencing with your Artful Agenda. Please submit a ticket through the Tech Support section of your app and we are confident our developers can troubleshoot solutions with you. We do have stylus capability in the tablet app under Drawing Mode.

content: I never thought I would use a digital planner, much less love one. AA is the best planner I've ever used. It's easy to learn, great access on all my devices, no extra or hidden fees. AA a great organization system. Quick and easy access to calendars, notes, and connects with all my online calendars. It's a game changer for this busy employee/teacher/student!
replyContent: We appreciate your review RA! So happy to hear that you have found the best of both worlds with your Artful Agenda and it is helping you keep your busy schedule on track!

content: Edit: Support has remedied the situation already. While the app was not a fit for my needs, customer support is excellent. I signed up for a 7 day free trial today and was immediately charged full price. I canceled it immediately after. Hoping i receive a refund as I was supposed to have the option of canceling if the app did not meet my expectations, and it did not.
replyContent: Is it possible that you previously tried Artful Agenda? It's our goal to always allow people to have a two-week free trial, but if Google recognizes a Google ID that has tried Artful Agenda before (even if a different email is used at registration), Google will not allow a second trial. Reach out to our team and we will make sure you get a refund!

content: I'm in! Thank you Thank you Thank you! Only a week into the 2 week trial and I'm a fan! The checkmark feature alone is enough for me but the entire planner is such a streamlined experience. replyContent: We appreciate review and feedback Reebs! We are thrilled to hear that you are loving your Artful Agneda. content: Beautiful!! I love this app!! I can sync all my calendars in one place, choose the colors for different calendars, and it looks and acts like a planner. Switch from portrait to landscape Both of those can happen for several reasons, and neither should EVER cause tasks to be deleted. These bugs need to be fixed ASAP.

content: 28 Oct 2018: same problem. Repeating tasks do not update and advance to next due date when completed. The repeating task function didn't work well either.
replyContent: To add a repeating task: Create a new task, add a date and time (next occurrence e.g. 9am tomorrow), enable the reminder, add a repeat e.g. daily, save. You will receive a notification at 9am from tomorrow onwards. If you complete the task it will be reset at midnight (automatically) ready to be completed again the following day. Thanks, Steve

replyContent: Asif, this is possible! To drag and drop simply use the drag handles (dots on the right). When you first opened Tasks you will have seen context based help. Drag and drop os one of the first things it teaches you. Did you see this?  I hope this helps, Steve

content: Compared to the competition this is a very good todo app. It does the basics the best. The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that it does not seem to have a way to sync with a desktop or web application.   One thing that doesn't work well in my day to day life, in any to-do app, is more customizable sorting. Either it's too manual, making the todo app more of an interruption, or the sorting doesn't predict my priorities well. The simplest solution would be to combine basic sorting (priority, due date, category, etc) with manual sorting somehow. One way would be to have items initially sorted by your selected method. Then allow the user to manually sort any item. When a new item is placed in a list  the new item would be placed in order according to the those items that have not been manually sorted. If all items in the list have already been manually sorted then there are two approaches I can think of. Either have new items automatically be placed at the top or bottom in those cases, or even better the app could have hidden values for this. e.g. an item due 2/16 that's manually moved ahead of an item due 2/12 would be considered having a "due date" of 2/11 for sorting.
replyContent: Hi Justin, thanks for your feedback.  Sync and web app have been very popular suggestion and so I am currently working on server code to enable device to device sync, cloud backup and list sharing.  Once complete I will be working on a browser based web app.  I hope this helps, Steve

content: I switched from Microsoft To Do to Tasks and it has been a great step up in features. I would love to see the addition of being able to schedule tasks on the nth day of the month. For example, adding tasks to the first Tuesday or last Friday of a month. Also needing to set a time for an all day event to be recurring is a workflow that is odd.
replyContent: Hi David, recurring tasks need a time so Tasks knows when to repeat the task and show a notification/alarm. Without a time I would have to assume a time for you e.g. 9am. This may work on a few occasion but for the 5 seconds I think it is better you select the actual time you want. To discuss further, just email me. Cheers, Steve

content: I really this app. Very sensible and open to various list styles and it doesn't lock a bunch of critical functionality behind ads or premium mode. If I could make a recommendation for something that could improve, I'd personally really enjoy if after you completed a full list you got a little celebration? Like some confetti and a cheer maybe? Just a thought, it could make it easier to remember to finish a list if it came with a little bit of positive reinforcement at the end.

I was using Microsoft ToDo. It started sending out notifications a few minutes after they were due, so I looked for an option. This app has a way better interface and is much prettier. Beyond that, I emailed Microsoft about the issue a couple of weeks ago as of this review. I have not heard back. This developer responded to questions I had within hours. Having a responsive developer is extremely important to me. I highly recommend you try this. Update - The more I use this, the more I love it.
replyContent: Hi Dana, thank you so much for the amazing review and support for Tasks! It's wonderful to hear that you're enjoying my app and find it prettier than Microsoft ToDo. I believe that being responsive to user questions is crucial. If you have any questions, just email me. I'm always here to help. Happy organising :) Steve

content: It is amazing because it doesn't restrict you to make just one type of list or task (example, I can list my to do list with a sub section for phone calls and another for errands and another section separate for my shopping list!). With that being said, it might take a few minutes to understand how to properly use it, but the time that goes into understanding only makes the experience that much better. Love love love it so far!ðŸ’Ÿ
replyContent: Hi Katie, thank you so much for your amazing review of my app. For help with Tasks features check out the Help (main menu), the YouTube videos or just email me. I'm always here to help. If you're able to please consider supporting my work with a donation or Premium account so I can continue development and keep Tasks advert free. Thanks, Steve

content: Very useful, with great features. I have grocery lists for the stores I use the most, sorted in order of the position of items in the store aisles. I can check and uncheck the items I want each week and highlight them or flag with different colors. When the stores move things around it is a simple drag and drop to adapt my lists. You can have many different lists and the format is easy too read. Love this, great app.
replyContent: Hey, thank you so much for your wonderful feedback for my app. I do exactly the same around the supermarket :) If you're able to please consider supporting my work with a donation or Premium account so I can continue development and keep Tasks advert free. Thanks, Steve

content: I've tried ever app available and this is by far the most functional while also being the easiest to use and more attractive interface. the pro plan is a bit steep in price, but there are very few restrictions without it. you could easily donate a few dollars to help and are still getting the most fully featured list/todo app on Android. things you can do that most apps can't.. Move items between lists and subslits. Have sublists. lots of color customization. quick entry. full export to csv.
replyContent: Hi Sean, thanks for your kind review of my app. Unlike other apps I do not take your data without permission. I do not sell your data or profit in anyway from your data or include adverts. I rely on users support. If you're able to please consider a donation or Premium account so I can continue development and keep Tasks advert free. Thanks, Steve

content: Hi Steve, vibes again w/ settings off. Prob my phone. Fav feature: choose snooze time when alarm sounds, works flawlessly! Found alarm duration in settings ðŸ‘. Couldn't understand how the filter for history works. The to-do page is confusing. It's organized by date, irrelevant of today's date, so when i see it i get overwhelmed and can't understand what alarms are coming up. Probably my brain.
replyContent: You're welcome. By default the alarm will keep ringing until your phone dies. However, there is a setting for alarm duration. If you miss an alarm a notification will be shown. Over due tasks will also be shown with a red date next to them. You can easily create a filtered list to show all overdue tasks. I hope this helps. Steve

content: I have found this to be the best management app so far. The option to have multiple lists and sublists for all the different categories in life. Being able to add notes really helps simplify many tasks. It has premium features that definitely make it nicer but is perfectly usable for free. Being able to have customizable reminders and due dates for various things without clogging my Google calendar. Tasks are also very easy to update which is very helpful when they don't go as planned.
replyContent: Thank you so much for your kind review of my app! Itâ€™s great to hear that Tasks is helping you manage your life effectively with its multiple lists and customizable reminders. If you're able to please consider supporting my work with a donation or Premium account so I can continue development and keep Tasks advert free. Thanks, Steve

content: This program takes Google Tasks to the next level. I keep two lists running. "Big List" tracks all jobs, planned and completed. "Daily List" extracts and isolates location dependent plans (hopes?) for the day. Task labeling and easy movement of tasks back and forth between these lists is key. Access from separate locations, the reason I bought a lifetime subscription, amplifies the power. This is simple, functional support for planning and advancing multiple complex jobs simultaneously.
replyContent: Hi Jim, your amazing feedback made my day! I'm thrilled to hear how Tasks is helping to organize your day and complex jobs. Your lifetime subscription will help me continue to enhance the app. Thanks again, Steve.

content: This app really helps my scatter brain keep organized!
replyContent: Hi Amber, thank you so much for your amazing review! It's wonderful to receive such positive feedback and hear that my hard work is helping you stay organised. content: New update Doesn't download from Google play. Get error message. I bought the after Amazon not the Google Play store so I'm not even sure why it's trying to update through the Play store. Regardless every other app works fine on my phone with regard to downloading just yours is broken. In addition the confusing nature of which version I bought is unclear. It doesn't help that your help teams English is not great. I could not understand what was trying to be articulated in email

content: Not a fan of how this directly links to your calendar. I wanted a separate app to track two different sets of calendars. If I wanted to see the calendars shared with me on Google, I would just use Google calendar. When you turn off the view of one calendar in this app, it also turns it off in your Google calendar. I like the concept of the tabs at the bottom but unless I can un-sync this from Google, it is useless for me.
replyContent: Hi, you clearly are not informed how your device works. Note that both GC and BC use the same calendar storage on your device it means they show the same data. Take a look here for further information: https://appgenix.uservoice.com/knowledgebase/articles/2005336-can-i-use-two-calendar-apps-parallel-and-separatel

content: First off, I LOVE this app on my Pixel 7. But it is useless on my Pixel watch. It rarely synchronizes ("Loading Events" just spins forever and never loads anything). Sometimes it works for a day or two, and then nothing again. When it does show some events, it's not complete so you can't rely on it. I have installed and uninstalled it a dozen times. I'd be willing to spend time with a developer to troubleshoot. It has great potential and I would enjoy having it work reliably.
replyContent: Hi, please provide us the detailed information about both of your devices and we will take a look into it.

content: Full screen ads ruin it all I've been using this since it was just "business calendar". It was still $7 back then so I wouldn't buy it but would click the ads every now and then. Now with the full screen ads it's practically unusable. Also, before the dev comes in with the stock "the free version has ads" response: no duh it has ads. We didn't pay for the app because its upfront cost is too high so we liked the corner ads. Now you force them to take over our screens. Uninstalled and 1-Star.
replyContent: The free version is still functional as the skippable ads appear only every 18 hours! It means it is 2/day, if you're unlucky. Otherwise you can use the app without any further disturbance. Please note, that this free version needs to be developed and maintained on the daily basis. This requires a lot of time and work investment

Very frustrated.

content: Ok app. It's better than the default app that came with my phone. However it has a lot of issues. You can't organize tasks or events, it automatically alphabetizes everything. I tell it I don't want notifications. I change it in settings & it adds a random notification. If you set something to be a recurring monthly task, once you click it after it's done, it moves it to a different day the next month. It's not reliable. I switched to a paper calender, which is easier to view & organize.
replyContent: Hi, we don't have enough space to address all you issues here. Please contact our support and they will tell you how to use the app & resolve the problem with reminders being synced to your device.

content: Update: My events prior to 2021 are all gone! Do you delete events after a certain time??? replyContent: We can't verify your support request searching by the name you use here. As for the problem, on our end there are no limitations of the display. Your issue is caused by the sync limitation of the partner: https://appgenix.uservoice.com/knowledgebase/articles/903366-i-am-not-able-to-see-past-and-future-events-in-bc What colors do you have in mind?

content: I've had this app for years, even upgraded it to the premium version. Loved it.. then as the developers started updating, I started having many issues. Each time i used the app it would show in the premium or free version; it was inconsistent. I wrote the customer service for assistance and I didn't get any help. So i lived with it. Most recently, I started receiving ads after every entry; Not okay!! I sent another email 2 wks ago which they have not responded to; which is why I'm here. Help!
replyContent: Hi, you don't need to play twice. The license is valid without any limit as long as you use the same account and app store. Take a look here: https://appgenix.uservoice.com/knowledgebase/articles/908211-i-paid-for-the-app-but-i-lost-the-pro-features

content: I am going to drop this app after years of use because of recent full page video ads which are out of control. Edited to add: of course the free version has ads. Always has, and I don't mind, because *something* has to pay for app development. But these new full page, video that can't be shut down, in your face for many seconds ads are new and intolerable. That was a bad business mistake you can correct. I hope you correct it soon. I'll be checking back to see.
replyContent: Hi, please note that the free version is not ad-free (only the pro version is completely ad-free). However, we are currently working on the possibility to skip ads and try to set all ads from all providers on silent as standard. We hope to integrate it soon.

content: Disconnect other calendar options please ðŸ™ I downloaded this calendar just to keep work tasks/meetings/events separate in this calendar but it keeps showing other calendar tasks/events. content: It started strong then the ads were a bit much but it's free and I was thinking about buying it. Thenâ€¦ Events that are clearly on my Google calendar stopped showing. Suddenly. content: This app worked well for a year. Had ads, but I was fine with that. The latest update made the ads much bigger, appearing in the task sidebar instead of banners at the top and bottom. This kind of advertisement is a standard right now in the free apps. If you don't want to receive any ads, you can consider the pro version, which is completely ad-free.

I may have paid for the full version before they did this, but not now. If they're going to force uses to pay up $7 to remove such intrusive ads, I'll just move on to another app.

content: Best calendar out there, but.... Love this calendar. Of all the calendars I've tried, this has the fastest, easiest way to enter new appointments. Nice to look at and change views. BUT it hijacks every pdf I download and want to look at. This app is not listed for any defaults including PDFs but it still will not let me view a PDF in my preferred PDF viewer.
replyContent: It sounds like you set BC to be the default app for that particular action (hence the app reacts correctly). In that case you'd have to clear the defaults on your device, so that you can choose between the apps again or set another app as default. Please note that the action will apply to all of your apps.

content: Loved this app for years. The new full screen ads with no skip option is ridiculous and will likely drive me away. I understand the need for ads but this is too far and I have no need for any of the pro features so I will not pay for it when I can use a different app for free that doesn't block my productivity. I used to recommend this app to anyone who asked but now I won't.
replyContent: Hi, please note that the free version is not ad-free (only the pro version is completely ad-free). However, we are currently working on the possibility to skip ads and try to set all ads from all providers on silent as standard. We hope to integrate it soon.

content: I used to love this app. It worked flawlessly for me and it was my go-to calendar app. However, recently I am having trouble where it does not sync anything other than my single Outlook calendar, with my other calendars being visible from my phone, but not having the events also populate on my laptop. This is a huge problem for me and definitely a deal breaker. If this can't be resolved I'll have to start looking elsewhere for a calendar. It still is a nice calendar app, but if you want seemless integration between your phone and your laptop, look elsewhere.
replyContent:
Please remember that BC doesn't have its own sync abilities and uses only those provided by Android and cannot be therefore responsible for the sync issues on your device. It might be a general sync problem and it could help to remove and re-add the account for sync in your Android OS Settings - Accounts & Sync.
.

content: Tasks are no longer syncing with Google Calendar. Therefore they do not sync between devices. Lowered rating from 5 to 2 stars. I'm trying to respond to the Developer. Their comment doesn't show up in the edit pop up so I'm not sure where it will be when I submit this. I have been using Business Calendar since I got my original Droid about a decade ago. Once I decided that I liked the way that it worked, I paid for the pro upgrade. When Business Calendar 2 came out I installed it along side Business Calendar Pro to keep the pro features without an additional payment. I also installed both programs on an Android Tablet. Everything synced with Google Calendar and tasks showed up on both devices. The only issue was that if you entered a repeating task on one device and marked it complete on the other the repetitive task was not created. I realise that this is a Google problem, but you could probably pass this information in the description field if you wanted an enhancement. I recently got a new phone. That is when the tasks quit syncing. I think that a newer version of the apps were installed on the phone than I had been using. I also upgraded the apps on the tablet to see if that would fix the problem. I have just uninstalled the apps from both devices, deleted the tasks from Google Calendar in a web browser, and reinstalled the apps on both devices. I recreated several repeating tasks on the phone. They did not sync to Google Calendar.
replyContent: Hi, your problem is caused by the sync limitation of the Google Tasks. GT does not support the series and that is why they don't sync it. We are not able to influence Google. However you are provided with the task export function in BC, which backs the category up.

content: The last update completely wiped the calendar.. Great job boys.
replyContent: Hi, an update cannot delete your data. Take a look here to resolve: https://appgenix.uservoice.com/knowledgebase/articles/1912096-my-calendar-data-is-suddenly-gone-how-can-i-recov

content: Compared to Google this is cluttery and harder to read. The free version doesn't give access to the settings that would make it bearable and allow for thorough testing. Won't buy if I don't know what it can look like. Also I hear it's subscription based. Also dev is rude to reviewers. At least this app has a lot of settings but without at least a trial I'm not going to waste time.
replyContent: Please note that the developer is not the vendor the license. The stores do not allow the trial periods for the apps with IAP-system. However, you can request a refund with the time window given. This gives you the possibility of testing the pro functions.

content: New app icon harder to see, prefer the old icon. Please bring back!
replyContent: It is due to a problem of Google. We've contacted other calendar app developers and they are experiencing the same problems. It especially happens right after the sync of events created with no or low internet connection. That is why, we all suspect that there must be something wrong with the Google sync, which we unfortunately can't influence.

content: Can't stand for new icon.

Wish you could change the size of the calendar to make things easier to see, the title has to be one small word or gets cut off. Also when you make a schedule for one date to another(ex. The 9th to the 19th) the first day and last day are not highlighted in the color, the title is instead that color then it highlights the dates then goes back to the title being the color and I absolutely hate that. However the features they provide on the free version are the best I've seen compared to others.
replyContent:
Hi, you can change font sizes: https://appgenix.uservoice.com/knowledgebase/articles/436483-adjusting-the-font-sizes
If your multi-day event has the start and end time they are not fully all-day and it is graphically distinguished. Please contact our support, if you require more information.

content: Since the last update, May 29, I have been losing random events. Tonight, I've added the same event four times over the last three hours. Just waiting to see if it disappears again. Several updates ago, the photos I attached to each profile stopped appearing. I think the OS was blamed. It's been a great app for several years but I'm afraid of what else I might lose in the near future.
replyContent: It might be due to a problem of Google. We've contacted other calendar developers and they are experiencing the same problems. It especially happens right after the sync of events created with no or low internet connection. That is why, we all suspect that there must be something wrong with the Google sync, which we unfortunately can't influence.

content: Just lowered my rating. Used to work great but now does not properly sync everything in my task list with my Google Calendar on my computer. It will sync new events & new tasks. But if I edit a task (ex. change the date of the task), it does not sync properly w/ my Google Calendar. It used to be that all edits synced & appeared the same in both the app & my Google Calendar, but not now. I have been emailing with the support for this app, but have not yet found a solution.
replyContent: Hi, we've been investigation the problem on our end and the data is correctly synced. Please make sure the account is correctly set up and the sync has time to kick in.

content: Overall, it is an adequate calendar. However, it is very annoying that 50% ofl the time a reminder will sound without a window to dismiss it. The alarm will sound for the scheduled reminder. Sometimes a pop-up window appears with Dismiss and Snooze command buttons. Roughly about 50% of the time that pop-up does not appear. So the alarm sounds for the duration.
replyContent: Hi, this sounds very unusual. Are you sure your issue is triggered by our app? Have you tried reinstalling it already? FYI on the backup: https://appgenix.uservoice.com/knowledgebase/articles/904029-what-steps-should-i-take-when-switching-resetting

content: Not working on Galaxy Watch 5 Pro. Stuck on spinning "Loading events" message. Phone app and watch app installed. Tiles also don't install/work on watch. Uninstalled and reinstalled, as well as restarted both phone (Pixel 7 Pro) and watch to no avail. Phone app looks clean and is definitely a step up from Google Calendar app. UPDATE: looks like everything is working now. Not sure if it was an overnight thing or something else. UPDATE 2: Stopped working on watch. No longer syncing after 1/25.
replyContent: Hi, could you provide your detailed device information on which device you experience this problems? Is the watch correctly and continuously paired with your phone? Do you see all your events correctly synced in the main app?

content: This app is great as far as the calendar and task functions. However, it is nearly unbearable to use since it doesn't respect the phone setting to not notify during a call. When it notifies during a phone call using the regular carrier app (not Skype, Hangouts or other app), it buzzes and sends a loud notification that is painful and very disruptive. I sent in a support request 3.5 years ago and they said it shouldn't do that and they were going to "look into it." But they haven't fixed it in any updates and it's been the same on all of the different phones I've had since then, not just an isolated issue on one phone.
replyContent: Hi, the app does respect phone settings. Please note, that this applies only to actual phone calls. If you use other apps like Skype, Whatsapp etc. to call, the settings are not applied.

content: Good app, with lots of features, IF used as a standalone app. A bit annoying if you need to rely upon the feature which allows syncing with other systems (such as Google account). This has never worked reliably for me. Occasionally, it no longer syncs and I'm disconnected for a week before it starts working. I've asked for help, but the blame was put on my Samsung Android phone. I'm on the second phone with similar issues. Maybe this just doesn't work well with Android phones? :-(
replyContent: Hi, please consider that BC does NOT sync your calendar data. It can therefore not be responsible for the sync issues you may experience on your device. The sync is done by Android and you need to make sure your phone is correctly setup when it comes to account settings as well as OS background activities for the apps.

content: I have been happy for the most part with this app. However, there's a really terrible feature that has been causing me problems every time I try to set a new event. It seems that the app is trying to predict what time I want to go in the end time based on what I put in the begin time and vice versa. So, I get into this stupid loop of having to change both the start and end time several times each in order to get it where I want it. It seems like it is potentially tied to the AM/PM buttons.
replyContent: Hi, this depends on the duration standard setting for you new events. If you set it for example to be 2 hours the event length will always default to 2 hours.

content: Pretty useful and I bought it. Then I discovered the two very useful functions require multiple taps or, I simply cannot find in the app, nor the help. SEARCH (multiple taps rather than on the viewing window) or jump to TODAY. Creating a task or event several months ahead, then if you quit the app and return later, it remains in the future month. No problem, IF THERE'S A QUICK WAY TO RETURN TO TODAY! I'm looking for something better.
replyContent: Hi, both search and go to today options are accessible in every calendar view. If you have problems with finding the functions, please contact our support for further information.

content: I have been using this app for years, but I am thinking of trying a different app. The issue that I have, is that doing seemingly simple tasks is overly complicated. For example I just want to make a personal and a work task list that is local to my phone. Doing so has proven very complex and often I will create a task only to realize it has defaulted to my gmail account rather than the local list I intended. As a user it's frustrating, the reason I use this app is to streamline organization.
replyContent: Hi, do you choose a correct list, to which a task should be saved? What is your standard list set in the settings - standards... - tasks - list?

content: I just added an event on another calendar that has synced in the past. This event didn't sync. I've restarted my device and it's still not there. I have notifications set to go off 1 time for most things and it goes off 3-6 times. It makes no sense. This had been a really good app except for notifications. I'll have to see if I can add events in other calendars and they sync. This might be a one time thing, but I'm not sure just yet.
replyContent: If you get notifications randomly, please refer to this: https://appgenix.uservoice.com/knowledgebase/articles/1827433-why-are-my-reminders-not-working

content: I have used this app since 2018, and I find it very user-friendly and efficient to use. However, it has two serious shortcomings (which makes me consider migrating to Google Calendar): 1) It cannot attach and send out video conferencing links (e.g. Teams or Zoom) to event participants; 2) the desktop version is not compatible with Windows 10 and/or does not have a browser version that can be used on a desktop device.
replyContent: Hi, 1) BC will recognise the video conferencing and you can start it from within the app. However, it is not possible yet to actively add such link from the app. 2) Please note, that BC is an Android app. You can only use it on Windows 11 subsystem, because this is the Windows version, which supports Android apps.

content: It's effective. Yes it's better than a lot of other options out there. It's just dated, the interface is weak and difficult to navigate. They could really make some strong improvements by streamlining it. I bet most users, pro or not, aren't aware of all the settings. Response 8/8/19: Thanks for the offer but I think you're missing point. If I had time to help I would have long ago though. Response: I wouldn't have paid for an app that required me that much submit feedback in a forum.
replyContent:
Hi, we are always open for feature requests on our user forum :)
https://appgenix.uservoice.com/forums/280499-business-calendar-2 

Other users can vote and comment on the ideas there as well

content: Bumping up one star because it started to sync again. I will still double check my calendar in the Google app (though I'm not necessarily that find if that app), because I don't necessarily trust that BC2 will have synced recently. Funny that. For months i failed to get it to sync, then I wrote a review, and three hours later it starts to sync again...
replyContent: Hi, note that the app does not have its own sync functions and it is therefore not responsible for the sync issues on your device. Make sure your OS is not blocking the background processes for the app as it may also influence the sync.

content: This was my ultimate favorite calendar. Better than apple, google, or Samsung's calendars. Now every time I add an event a video ad pops up and I have to wait to see my calendar. The ads wouldn't be so annoying if I could get rid of it sooner, but there isnt an X for several seconds. I may have to switch to google. I would buy the pro option but you dont have an apple version and I will probably switch to an iphone soon.
replyContent: The free version is still functional as the skippable ads appear only ONCE every 18 hours! Otherwise you can use the app without any further disturbance. Please note, that this free version needs to be developed and maintained on the daily basis. This requires a lot of time and work. The ads help us maintain the software.

content: App is easy to use, but there are 2 features I find annoying. When I add calendar items that I have entered multiple times before, I would like the event data to default to the same data usually used for this event - even when I'm adding an event for the 50th time, I have to overlay the time, duration & reminder. The other is that my reminders don't always remind me (take today for example) & I would like them to keep reminding me until I clear them, even if that takes all day.
replyContent:
How do you usually add events? Do you use templates? https://appgenix.uservoice.com/knowledgebase/articles/870639-templates
As for reminders, take a look here: https://appgenix.uservoice.com/knowledgebase/articles/1827433-why-are-my-reminders-not-working

content: The widget in one line mode could shorten the time spans so they don't take as much space. Also it doesn't seem to sync well between multiple phones with tasks.    *10/22/2018 edit* Not sure how else to respond to the dev but it's task syncing not calendar syncing that's the issue.   *10/23/2018 edit* both devices have task syncs active, and are just the main google account
replyContent: Hi, have you tried re-logging in with the account fro task sync? Please make sure to back the non-synced data up before you do it.

content: I gave it a lower rating because lately if I had any repeat scheduled appointments, I can't change one without changing them all. Very aggravating. Before, I was able to cancel one without affecting all the future repeat weekly or monthly entries. Before, I could use this calendar to keep track of my past activities. Now it looks like I attended a meeting when I didn't because I couldn't cancel it without affecting future meetings
replyContent: Hi, you must have a sync issue on your device. Take a look here: https://appgenix.uservoice.com/knowledgebase/articles/359224-i-would-like-to-edit-or-delete-a-single-event-of-a

content: Why can't I delete the recurring calendar appointments now that I no longer need them. If I deleted one date it will show up on the next interval whether it is daily, weekly, monthly etc. It doesn't give me the option to delete the series, just that particular date. I do not use the phone that I originally set this up with so I don't get offered to delete the series. I then try to delete the series through a search in the app for all instances of the wording of the title of the appointment. For example when I worked I would put "Paycheck" on the calendar representing the dates I would be paid. I haven't worked that job in 10 years! I search all instance yet THERE IS NO WAY TO DELETE IT EXCEPT ONE BY ONE FOREVER! Please tell me that there is a solution.
replyContent:
You should choose the "delete all events in the series" option. Note, that if an instance ist detached from the series, it is considered a single event and therefore the option will not appear.
Take a look also here: https://appgenix.uservoice.com/knowledgebase/articles/1984008-how-do-i-delete-calendar-entries-in-bc

content: Not an individual calendar, more like an addon or buying accessories for a calendar you already own. Requires you to sync with your existing calendar before use so it's just a pretty organizer from what I can tell of the description. I didn't get past "you must sync" since I needed a separate calendar to track a separate category of events. 3 stars because I'm sure this is what other people want but it's not what I thought I was getting. I thought syncing would be optional and it could work solo
replyContent: You don't seem to be aware of how Android works. BC(same as any other cal. app) uses the sync functions of your device. Android saves the synced events in the common cal. storage, to which all cal. apps access. It means they show the same data & it isn't possible to use 2 apps separately. This is why we have the Fav. Bar in BC to quickly toggle cal

content: It's been the best calendar for Android. Recently, the sync feature is gone, rendering it useless. The Google calendar _on the_same_device_syncs immediately. Business Calendar 2 does not. Beware!
replyContent: GC does not rely on the sync functions of your device as BC or your Xiaomi stock calendar do. Neither of the two apps id responsible for any sync issues on the device. It helps to remove and re-add the account for sync in your OS Settings -> Accounts. Please try this solution as advised already before.

content: Habe nach einer Alternative zum Google Kalender gesucht, an dessen Design und Handhabung ich mich die letzten 8 Jahre gewÃ¶hnt habe. Ich fÃ¼hle mich mit diesem Kalender perfekt abgeholt! Man braucht die pro Version nicht mal unbedingt aber ich war so begeistert, dass ich sie mir direkt geholt habe. Starke Arbeit, weiter so! Edit: Synchronisiert nicht mehr.

Denk bitte daran, dass BC keine eigene Sync-Funktionen hat und benutzt nur die von deinem Android GerÃ¤t. Dementsprechend ist die App fÃ¼r die Sync-Probleme auch nicht verantwortlich.

Es vermutlich ein allgemeiner Fehler. Es kÃ¶nnte helfen, den betroffenen Account in den Systemeinstellungen einmal zu entfernen und danach erneut hinzuzufÃ¼gen.

content: Great calendar marred by an overly zealous tracker. Firms will always excuse it by saying they want to improve the product... I always opt-out of sending data. Nevertheless the tracker tried to dial home over 500 times in less than 8 hours. Info gathered from DuckDuckGo.
replyContent: Hi, indeed it sounds like you're being notified about the sync process or the moments when the location (used for example for weather function) is determined. This is clearly not tracking (!), so the information you're receiveing sounds rather ridiculous put in this context.

content: I really do not like the Rainbow colorful app icon. It looks very unprofessional and childlike. Please help me to change it to a standard black background and white lettering, or something of the sort. IF BY CHANCE, this is some sort of Pride related icon change, then I definitely want it changed. I have no issue with Pride, but I do not want it forced on me, like religion, politics, or race, etc, on an app I use for business. Please keep it neutral.
replyContent: Hi, it is just some colors - nothing less, nothing more. You are reading into it a political statement, which is simply not there :) If you want to use a different color on the desktop, you can work around by using the "icon" widget, where you can choose any color imaginable for the background.

content: This app has been keeping my business afloat for the past few years, and I still love it! Using the paid version and have never regretted it. Edit: This has been screwing with my tasks pretty badly. It's still working well enough for now, but there seems to be something wrong and I'm having a hard time contacting the dev team.
replyContent: The only support request that we could find under the mane you use here was sent in December 2023 and the message was replied to a couple of days after. Please check you mailbox.

content: The calendar layout suits me, but the free app's ads are seriously intrusive.
replyContent: The free version is functional as the skippable ads appear only once every 18 hours. Otherwise you can use the app without any disturbance. Please note, that this free version needs to be developed and maintained on the daily basis. This requires a lot of time and work. The ads help us maintain the software. The pro version is fully ad-free.

content: It's not bad but they make it really difficult to migrate data from old mobile to new one. It's a real pain to have to manually re-enter everything.

content: Please add the weather to the agenda widget
replyContent: Hi, please feel free to vote for the idea on our user forum and we may consider it in the future: https://appgenix.uservoice.com/forums/280499-business-calendar-2-open/suggestions/9458169-agenda-pro-widget-with-weather

content: Haven't use it yet
replyContent:
If you have any questions about BC 2, you can find the help section built in the app under "Help& Feedback".
The articles are also available here:
https://appgenix.uservoice.com/knowledgebase

content: I use this app on a daily basis for years now without any problems. Everything is working fluently and just as you would expect it to do. EDIT: After many years loving the app I'm trying to use tasks via calDAV VTODO standard. Unfortunately business calendar doesn't support this. I'm therefore changing to 1 star until this is implemented and might consider changing the app. Update2: thanks for the quick response. Looking forward to having tasks of other sources (VTODO) via DAVxâµ.
replyContent:
At the moment it is only possible to synchronize tasks with Google. In the future, we hope to be able to develop an own function for BC 2*, so that other task sources can also be synchronized.
* Outlook would have the priority here and we also already started woking on it.

content: When creating a new event, enter the Title and press "ENTER" it doesn't create a new line but acts as "NEXT" and stops editing and closes the onscreen keyboad. I need to be able to enter data on seperate lines so can you add this option to create a new line/page break when pressing â€œENTERâ€? - it is much easier and faster to put the data under the title only! At least give the option in a setting to choose the line break option!
replyContent: Hi, the title lines will break automatically when there isn't enough space left. The titles are not thought to be a multi-line text. It is supposed to be a mostly few words header for your event. The description is a dedicated field for longer texts, where you can also do the HTML editing.

content: App has potential. Tutorials are weak & not intuitive. Focus is on emoji & fluff rather than being effective. What kind of text keyboard DOES NOT have UNDO? I make too many mistakes. Lol. Please add undo to app
replyContent: What is the article that you were looking for? Our help articles cover every aspect of the app, so I'm pretty sure the information you look for is already there :) As the keyboard, we do not program it, so if you have issues with the keyboard product you use, please contact its developer.

content: Good app. Have been subscribing it over 10yrs. Hi, can it be installed and sync more than one phone? Itineraries were not updated on the 2nd phone. Do you have more/ comphrensive info about functions this app provides? cheers
replyContent: Hi, take a look here: https://appgenix.uservoice.com/knowledgebase/articles/891003-sync-across-devices

content: Why is Data Not encrypted? Great calendar app bit needs to encrypt data like many other popular calendars.
replyContent: Hi, your statement is not fully true. The vast majority of calendar apps (including our app, Google Cal. app, Samsung & Xioami calendars and many, many more) uses the calendar database on your device and does NOT encrypt. The both concepts stay basically in opposition.

content: I am using since last 2 years, It will be great if it can pull event/meeting from Webex. I have webex account but I can not see meeting invites from Webex calender to here in this app
replyContent: Please note that BC does not have its own calendar sync functions and uses only those provided by your device. Therefore you can sync with any partner supported by Android. If Android can sync calendars belonging to your Webex account, they will also be visible in BC.

content: I Uninstalled until I find out how to do what I wanted . Like in the picture. I opened it and all my emails are shown at bottom. I DONT want that. I want labels like "personal"in a color, work1 in a color, work 2 in a color , studio 1 in a color etc. If u can tell me how to do that I will reinstall and give 5 stars .:) I had a free no ad cal3nder years ago. Can't find it anymore. Looking for similar thing.
replyContent: Hi, take a look here to find out all about our favourite bar function: https://appgenix.uservoice.com/knowledgebase/articles/428382-favorite-bar

content: Too many ads otherwise very good
