The pro version is fully ad-free.

content: Purchased in error and refund requested through Google Play Store. I may have kept it if the app would have integrated better with my tasks in Microsft To Do. The main visual I liked was the heat map look of the yearly calendar.
replyContent: Hi, actually we are currently working on such integration :)

content: Removed 2 stars because notifications are often missed in Android 14 due to changes in API. How is it possible that the devs did not add the changes despite the availability of Android 14 plateform ? Now we don't even have an eta. I missed a lot of appointment reminders that let me anticipate my meetings which is really bad. Please fix and let the users know when it is done. Meanwhile the only fix is to enable stock calendar reminders instead
replyContent: Unfortunately we noticed it as well. Android changed the permission category for reminders with the update, which results in the function's  malfunction. Our developers are currently working on the solution.

content: this rating is tentative pending use of the app
replyContent:
Hi, if you have any questions about BC 2, you can find the help section built in the app under "Help& Feedback" :)

We also post various tips and usage suggestions on our Facebook: www.facebook.com/BusinessCalendar2

content: After the last update I had to clear the cache & data, clear the cache partition, then lose all my events to stop the double notifications/reminders. This has been a great app for many years and this is the first time I've had trouble with it. It was a pain to go through all that to fix it but that's how much I like this app. I have a Galaxy S9+ with latest IO update. UPDATE: No matter how I set my reminders, the maximum # I could get it to alert was two. I gave up & went back to BC Pro. Ugh!
replyContent:
Hi, please contact our support directly so that we could better communicate.

You need to  set the reminder sound in the settings - reminders - general - reminder sound. 

As for the double reminders, you simply need to deactivate the reminder function in the settings of one of those apps.

content: Seems like a stellar calendar app, but the entire reason I downloaded it was that I was hoping to have something fully disconnected from Google Calendar so I could have a clean separate app for work. Instead it forced me to link them and automatically imported all the personal events that I don't want to deal with in this one. This is fine for people looking to switch, but I really wish there was an option not to sync them.

I love the app. Will give 5 stars if it can sync automatically directly with office 365. Right now, my company is so secure with so many securities, Microsoft exchange is not syncing automatically. I need to select the sync button. I think if it gave me the option to sync with Microsoft 365 instead of exchange, it would work.

I really like how tasks are handled. You can be very descriptive, see them all in one view, and move them to the next day easily. Though l, I did pay the pro price to get recurring tasks. The day view is good too. It's like an agenda, but without the details, it gives a good view of the time you'll be using. The pop-up on the monthly view to see the day and add to it is also convenient. If you sync it to Google Cal, it is a full sync. What you do on one shows on the other.

The app has a lot of features that I like and use in a calendar, e.g., search, go to, repeating appointments, and the list goes on. I knocked off a star because I would really like to zoom in on the calendar. Otherwise, it works for me. I purchased the ad free option. 9/4/2023 UPDATE - After using the app for 2 years, my review remains unchanged. I would still like to be able to zoom in on the calendar instead of the small window that opens to see the events of the day.

Love the app and use it as my main calendar and to-do list. However, it would be nice to be able to view the tasks sidebar while on week view, particularly on wider displays such as tablets or laptops. Also, the Windows interface is poor (relies on Windows Subsystem for Android). Another minor suggestion: allow custom week numbers. Useful for students who operate on an academic calendar, with week 1 usually being somewhere in September.

great app! love how easy it is to move an appointment if it gets rescheduled. one thing I would love or perhaps I just don't know how to work it, but tasks that I forget to do, I wish would remind me that I still need to do it. I have a recurring task to replace a filter but I forgot one month and it was never completed so the next three months I never did it because the task wasn't there!

Follow up. What happened to the colors? Part of it, is your program does do some degree of muting colors. I disabled Material You, I have better things to do, than worry if my icon matches my theme. The display settings were in natural. Vivid is a bit intense for my likes, but colors come in much closer on vivid. Improved color match now, only part is the program.
replyContent: Hi, what do you mean precisely by that? Can you provide some screenshots of the issue you experience?

content: Very pleased with the app overall. However we are experiencing syncing issues from unit to unit where there is a huge delay, if it syncs at all. And if the other units receive the appointment, it is altered, and comes through as an "all day" appointment when it was entered with specific times for notifications and meeting times.

I like that it will let me switch my calendar of origin, and the pro homescreen widget looks like a planner page! A couple things aren't intuituve for me, like having to remember to tap ðŸ“ before I edit an event or task and remember to save before I back out or my changes will be lost. That's the #1 reason this is only a secondary calendar app. And I need to scroll (not swipe) for next month. If I swipe it gives me that number of days on my view. That's a cool feature, just not used to it! ðŸ˜£
replyContent:
Hi, please note to swipe vertically in the month view to display previous/next months. 

The command icons (edit, save) are necessary and the behavior will not be changed. In the settings - create & edit - save with back button, you can choose the "yes" option and your events will be saved when leaving the edit mode.

content: Tasks auto-sync is mostly problematic, even tapping sync button in widget does not solve it. Tasks sync works only if I manually open the calendar, go to sync menu, and tap the sync menu (with minimum 3 tappings in total). Features other than tasks sync work very well.

content: this app had been good to me for years, but this latest update messed up all of my appointments. the view is botched - making it difficult to see what's actually on there. once this weird view glitch is fixed, it's back to 5 stars for this app.
replyContent: Hi, which view do you refer to? Can you maybe send some screenshots?

content: Update: This is just an update to say I continue to use and love BC2. I have tried other apps but either they lack the features or have expensive subscriptions. Kudos to the developers here! I have been using this app for at least a few years now. I love that I can see my calendar appointments and tasks in a single, integrated view. They also continue to add new features and are quick to respond to questions... All for a very low cost, especially compared to the subscription services.

I've been using this app for years and it is the best one out there. You can view your busy schedule in different ways, and it's easy to take a quick glance at it to see where you still have openings. I am a hair stylist and I need to spot an available opening quickly. You can search for your customers name to find their past or future appointments, and you can design it to the color schemes of your choice and make quick edits, repeat appointments, add reminders and addresses that link to maps.

I've been really happy with this calendar app. The ability to group calendars and turn the groups off and on is super useful to me. Update- I'm editing this review 3 years later because today I've realized that this app has been rock solid and completely dependable, and usefully innovative since I installed it. It's always been a 5 star app to me. And I don't ever rate with 5 stars.

I haved used this Calender for my business for over 10 years. It has been a very important part of running my business. The customer service has been very attentive in the past. Although I only reached out to them once about 6 years ago. They immediately reached back out to me to solve my issue. Which I appreciated since I ran my business off of this app. I have it installed in all my work vans. Any job added or edited in the office show up immediately for my techs in the field.

I use this planner as a replacement for a standard Google calendar. I like it so far; it works just fine and I find interface is slightly better than at original app. Icon is cute but sometimes looks like number "30" not letters "BC" but this is my personal issue. No glitches and noticeable bugs so I gave it 5 stars.

Love this calander, ADD/ADHD persons best friend. Got it specifically for the drag/drop and drag/copy options. It also has great template and color coding functions which make it super easy for st a glance scheduling. I still make hand written lists but it also has list and task functions as well if you're a list person.

Great tool! Though only way I was able to get support was to complain here since I don't use email on my phone. I was able to remove the tasks from cluttering the month view by disabling them in the app settings completely but then enabling them in the widget where I wanted to see them in my agenda. It's a little convoluted but works.
replyContent: Hi, you can choose the lists to be individually activated for your widget. Check the general widget settings -> calendars & task lists -> activated lists

content: So detailed. Organize anything by color, days of the week, events, and tasks. Monthly, weekly, daily, agenda and task view! Perfect for the ADD. Import and push sync with Google calendar. Location in events even links to Google maps. Customize everything! There is an add when you add an event, but no need to purchase for useful features. I'm probably gonna purchase out of sheer gratitude.

The best, most thorough calendar app for mobile. I cannot for the life of me figure out why they leave $ on the table by not porting to iPhone. I have not found a better app for multiple calendars on either mobile platform. Data entry is smooth. Calendar & time pickers make sense. Multiple views. The # of days slider makes navigation easier than other apps I've tried. Would give this 11 if I could. Kept me on Android through multiple device upgrade cycles.

Works nicely. I use this to merge 2 outlook calendars and one Google calendar. I do have an issue with one of my outlook calendars arbitrarily stopping to update, and while I don't think it's this apps problem, it would be VERY helpful if this app warned me of the situation. Because, when this occurs, you simply think you're free at certain times, when in fact those times are only showing free because a calendar has stopped updating.
I really like this app easy to use very reliable

Best calendar app available. So much customization and ease of use features. Update: 2024 and its still the best calendar. I have never ever even considered replacing it as they just keep improving on it over time.
ðŸ‘ Apps are easy to use
Very good app. Friendly user. Recommended

I have been using the paid version of this app for almost 5 years, and it is still the best calendar app I've ever come across. Easy to add tasks and events, and also easy to customize them to notify and display how you want. Also easily connects to Google calendars which is nice because Google's apps are terrible. You can stop looking for another solution, this is the one
I've used and enjoyed this app since I had Blackberry phones. I have the paid version and have found it to be worth it.

content: Use it on all my devices!
Great tool. I use this exclusively for my calendar and appointments. Edit: still using it! Edit # 2: still my go-to calendar app!

I have a lifetime license for this app. I'm not fond of the new view at all ... particularly tasks. Since the tasks utilize a system very close to the Franklin planner system, I was drawn to this app and paid for the license. Latest version is huge let down; user can't tailor. When it comes to my planner, I want to be able to customize!

content: I have used this app for years. I have always paid for the premium version. At first, it was my favorite app, but it has gotten steadily worse. Now it is very glitchy. It closes randomly and typically takes up to three minutes to open which is very embarrassing when I'm trying to set an appointment with a customer. It also randomly unchecks completed tasks and reverts to older versions of my schedule. The developers are uncaring and blame my phone (Note 8). I'm looking for a new app.

I thought upgrading and paying the $8 fee would allow me to use all of the functions of this app. It does not. I Haven't been able to sync any of my devices . Absolutely will not let me add an event. This was a waste of time and money. If I can't add my schedule on my lap top version then there's no point to this app. Plus there's no support or anyone to contact to help trouble shoot or credit me back .

I have had this app for 2 years and absolutely loved it, after an update it would cut on automatically and freeze my phone. I would have to hit the open apps and close it before I could do anything with my phone. I have emailed and explained what it was doing, and I get am email wanting more explanation, so I did. several days later I get an email that wants a video showing. I don't think this will get fixed i paid for the pro version and i will not renew

the app opens it self up whenever it wants to display an ad but the screen remains the same but i cant press anything. so it just opens up in the background all day long to display ads and make money when im not even using the app. this feature is ridiculous and it started happening every 5 minutes as opposed to every now and then so i just deleted the app.

This app used to be great. Now it is garbage. A few months ago it started doubling a few tasks - no problem, I just delete the extras. Now I get 5 to 10 copies of every task I delete. It is worthless.   I can't forget the wait times to open the app, up to 8 minutes of staring at a black screen.   Oh, and the fact that in the past week or two it started giving me ads even though I have been using the paid version for years already.   I let them know a couple weeks ago and got no response.

Extremely Disappointed. I had been a faithful user of this app and loved it. Then all of sudden everything changed. There is no cloud support. The tabs option is gone. There is no interface with established tasks list. I have tried and tried to use. I contacted support and they replied that due to streamlining the app it has a completely new appearance. I had uninstalled this app, however I felt I needed to write thos review. After I finish this, uninstalling this app. Useless to me.

Only had access to daily planner without paying. No weekly. No monthly. No events. No notes. An ad for the premium package popped every single time I clicked anything, including in the limited free daily planner section. If I could have given this 0/5 stars, I would have due to the advertisements for the paid features making the free features unusable.

I liked this app, even paid for it, but uninstalled it today due to weird behavior. I see two other reviews here with a similar problem. The app will periodically launch itself, but it's just a black screen, and it creates a copy of my home screen - looks the same but frozen until I hit the close button, then the copy scrolls away and I can again use my phone. Just odd.

The interface is great and I love it overall; however, I'm giving it two Stars because it won't synchronize between my Samsung phone and Ipad, despite being the same account information for each. I emailed their support like about this, and they asked for my login info, but I never heard anything back. This is a huge inconvenience because I put a LOT into the version on my iPad, and I dont, and wont, do it twice for the same application. Once this is fixed I'll happily increase the rating.

I loved this planner for several years with no issues. All of a sudden I can't launch the app or create/edit an event without getting a noisy, intrusive pop-up ads. I will be looking for a new option, possibly even just my stock calendar.

content: This is hands down the best personal planning app I've ever come across. That being said, it's basically unusable on Android. The view jumps to the top of the day's task list at random, making it easy to accidentally check off the wrong task. It takes minutes to load anything when you try to access the rest of the app through the back arrow at the top left. And, on occasion, tasks will duplicate themselves multiple times with different parameters. I use it on my iPad with no trouble at all.

Nice app! The only thing I wish was improved is the month view! As it is, it only shows dots. The day view is very nicely designed. It needs to let you see what is going on for the month for when you're planning, scheduling, or anything else. Potentially a great app. Little expensive, you can purchase a lifetime app, it's a bit expensive!

content: The app design looks nice, and has good features. This is a functional planner app. I can access the week view in the free version (though a prompt to upgrade to premium pops up), but tasks cannot be set as recurring in the free version. This is a main feature I'm looking for in a planner app. Also, the look of the app cannot be customized- stuck forever with that purple at the top of the screen. There are other free apps that include these things.

The app has been good for showing my calendar and daily notes/journal on the same screen. I would like it much better if there was a backup/restore option, and if it was available across devices and platforms. I had to reset my phone recently and lost most of my daily notes. I have the pro version but will be canceling my subscription.

Works with my Google calendars and has nice planner features. I gave it only three stars because I cannot change my calendar colors. I can change the colors in settings but the first time planner updates, the calendars change back to the default colors. I also paid for the original incarnation of this calendar that they abandon and went to this subscription based one. The version I had eventually stopped functioning as Android updated. I do not trust paying for this after that experience.

I would give this app 5 stars but I am beyond frustrated with how slow it is to open. I pay the subscription for premium, and I love all the options in the app. But it literally takes 5 to 10 minutes for the app to open, unless there is a notification in my notification bar that I can open the app with. This would be annoying even with a free app, but to pay for a slow app that takes ages to open is ridiculous. In the 2 or 3 years that I've used it this has never been fixed with any upgrade.

I have only used the free version. I wanted to try this app so I can have a weekly and daily planner. Apparently, users can only get a weekly view of their planners with a subscription. This irks me because most planners give you a weekly view for free. The layout does looks nice and functions the app runs smoothly. I don't plan on paying for premium just to have basic feature, so I may not use this app in the future.

Love this app BUT, It doesn't snyc in with phone unfortunately! I use this app as my schedule for my business, I downloaded it in hopes to have my schedule on my tablet & on my phone. I 1st downloaded this app on my tablet, I got it set up, paid $20 to subscribe all year, I downloaded the app to my mobile phone logged in with the same credentials but none of my information from my planner app on my tablet shows up on my phone? So therefore wen I add something to my schedule I have to do it twice
replyContent: Hi there, Planner Pro is actively supported and weâ€™d be happy to resolve any problems youâ€™re experiencing! Please reach our support team at planner.a@appxy.com. Thanks.

content: I like how it allows me to set any number of reminders, minutes/hours/days/weeks in advance either by push notification or email. But many little bugs pepper this app. The calendar view will bug out and not map to the selected month from time to time. The location field tries to be smart by giving you a 'maps like' autocomplete, but this is annoying when you just want 'gym'. For some reason the first letter of an event name isn't registered by autocorrect, so 'Event' turns to 'venting'.

Overall this is a good app. The widgets are good as well. Sonetimes they don't turn over as the days do and you manually need to flip them. Not a big deal though. What would take it to 5 stars for me is the ability to choose which days are shrunk on the Week widget. Friday and Saturday are often my busiest days but they are the smallest windows on the widget. I haven't seen a way to resize them. I'd love to adjust the days so it can read perfectly at a glance. Otherwise it is very good for free.

Also just like any planner a contacts section should be an option. That way the user is not switching between apps. It can be annoying and time consuming.

Not bad for a free app. Really comes in handy. Once I return back to work I'll look into the subscription version. Thanks guys!

I gave 3 stars for 2 reasons: 1- THERE IS NO SYNCHRONISATION BETWEEN DEVICES 2-I find it quite expensive to pay monthly or annual payments instead of one time payment, other apps such as Opus domini is similar and you pay 14â‚¬ once for life time, but unfortunately it is for mac only

I really like this app for the most part. Only thing I don't like is if you check the box on a subtask under a re-occuring task, while the re-occuring task shows up the next time it supposed to, the subtasks don't unless you manually go uncheck the boxes saying they are complete.
replyContent: Hi, thank you for your feedback. Could you please contact us at planner.a@appxy.com so we could drive deeper into the matter?

content: I downloaded this app recently, and after checking it out some, decided to purchase the Premium version. I really like it--the monthly view, difference between tasks/events, the ability to set priority levels. My one problem with this app (and it's a major one, cause it seems so simple) is that the dark mode pretty much doesn't work? At first it did, but then I closed the app and came back, and I was in light mode. I turned it on again--didn't work, despite saying it was on. Massive bummer.

I've been looking for something like this for a long time - I used Franklin Planners for years, but got tired of having to deal with all the waste of paper pages each year. One thing that I have noticed is that the 'dark mode' doesn't consistently persist in the settings (I use this on a Samsung Tab S7+, and have the app locked to stay in memory). I usually have to close it completely and reopen it to get dark mode to stick around. Other than that, though, this is a fantastic app.

I tried about 15 task manager apps and this is the only one that has a useful functioning prioritization of tasks. Prioritizing A1-A99 through C1-C99, along with dates and times. I used a Franklin planner software on my Palm pilot 20+ years ago, and this is the closest I've seen to it in all the years I've been searching. All the others (including Microsoft and Google's products) are garbage. The only point against it is the widget doesn't show very many rows.

I have to say after being a staunch Franklin system Nazi for more than 25 years, this app is the closest to the Franklin day planning system that I've seen. It's really a pleasure to work with so far. It still has some very important items missing and could use a few simple alterations to make it even better. [1] add user defined, color adjustable tabs on the "Day's view" of the calendar just below where your upgrade banner currently shows up. [2] Add month indexing of stuff and Project tabs. &

Overall good design - pleasing to the eye and navigable. Greatly appreciate the color coding and ease of selecting a date on the calendar. Adding repeating events also a plus. Would prefer a function where events are illustrated with a bar going down the screen showing how long it is instead of a simple bulleted list. Thanks for providing this!

I prefer an andoid phone (that may change at some point, lol) and I have this on my phone and am in the process of installing it onto my laptop. I have used it for over a year and LOVE it. I have tried several different apps before finding this one and hope it is always available to me. Have had ZERO issues with it so far. THANK YOU developers for a tremendous product that does exactly what its supposed to do!

This app is great. I discovered it sometime ago but it wasn't as user friendly as today. Like the views and the ability to see all relevant events, tasks, and notes in the days view. Also appreciate tasks follow into the next days schedule if not checked off. If "Projects" had goal with "steps" to goal and "tasks" specific to steps, that would make it easily 5+stars. Also a way to organize notes. I know I'm asking alot but I'd have to say ..great job! I already recommended it today.

Needs a little work but it is probably the best implementation of a Franklin Covey paper system I have found. Needs options for how you want items displayed on different calendars, copy task easier (or fix the recurring function) and the auto correct feature doesn't understand English very well.

If you're familiar with Stephen Covey's product suite, you'll find this tool to be an essential time management companion. The interface is similar to the paper based system. The application provides fields for tasks, events, etc. There are supporting priority and notification features aiding in the arrangement and alerting of tasks. The application would benefit from improvements with the synchronization of tasks across multiple devices.
It would be a Five Stars app if it could sync with Google Tasks. Please add the option. Thanks

I really like this app for the most part. Only thing I don't like is if you check the box on a subtask under a re-occuring task, while the re-occuring task shows up the next time it supposed to, the subtasks don't unless you manually go uncheck the boxes saying they are complete.

content: Very nice app

I like this planner. It has almost everything that I would like in a planner. I've been trying to get onto a digital planner for a long time and this is the first one that fits the bill. In addition to all the normal planning stuff I can insert pictures, sketches, and take notes and have appts. Entering the pictures and sketches are things that I couldn't enter before and kept me on a paper planner. It works efficiently with the camera and it's easy to add the pictures and stuff as a result.

Used to keep a paper planner. Been looking for a digital planner for a long time. Discovered THIS! It has notes, schedule and a to-do list in one app. Integrates with Google. Every thing I need. And does it well. The only thing that would be icing on the cake. Would be the ability to change the colors of various things in the app

Have had this app for years and it's great. Syncs up easily with my other calendars. I use it daily. I've liked all the enhancements except the recent Notes enhancement. The delete button is on the top right now (used to be on bottom of page), and the save is on the top left. In other apps I use, the save button is always on the top right, so there have been a couple times I've almost deleted my notes accidently. Minor inconvenience. Overall the app is really intuitive and a great planner.

So far a great app! I love that my google calendar and daily tasks show up on the same daily view! It's so close to being perfect for me... However, I wish they had a web version. You can install it on a PC through Bluestacks but it's not ideal. Also would love a weekly task view and monthly task view. (I know what tasks I want to get done this month, but I don't always know when I'll be able to do it.)

only discovered this app a few days ago, but I wish I had found it ages ago! it is exactly what I need to keep myself organized. I have some neurological stuff that makes it easy to forget everything. I love that I can quickly tap on the task widget and get my thoughts down before they disappear. THE WIDGETS ARE AMAZING! I was happy to see that you can purchase this outright and not just the subscription options, which turned me off some similar apps. Ads are well-placed and not distracting.

You win, take my money. I have been using this app for many years and never bought the upgrade. I recently upgraded to the S10, and between Bixby, Google, and many planning apps, I just couldn't separate myself from this one. I simply have not found an app that's easier to add and complete tasks. Also the task widget is just hands down better than every other one out there. So fine, if you want to add fullscreen ads (and have the audacity to include sound) then take my money you can have it.

If you are bipolar and seeking something to help you keep track of events, tasks, projects, even the day... I've been using this thing for years and wouldn't recommend anything more. Take the leap on this one. The ads aren't awful even in unpaid version but the full is only $5 and well worth it. The ability to organize things by priority complete with alarms in unparalleled to everything else I've ever tried. Hope this helps, and thanks Planner Pro team, for creating something so dependable

This has been my go-to planner for a few years. I use it for everything, and it has never failed me. I love that you can set multiple reminders with notifications or emails at particular timepoints before an event. You can add a location to each event or task, invite people to events, and set priorities for tasks. The app also has a "notes" feature...I can't say enough good things about this app. It keeps me put together. Thank you to the developers!!! ðŸ’¯ðŸ’¯ðŸ’¯

I use the free version and it is absolutely amazing. it syncs to my google calendar so I don't have to bother entering events to both apps. I love the notes feature, I use it to plan out my entire schedule for the day, and what I especially love is that I can see my events and my notes in one page. super easy to use and is the perfect visual schedule that I need.

I started using it two weeks ago and so far it's working great. I needed something integrated that I could just take notes with for the day. *update* beware if you sync across multi devices that when you add an event, make sure you are consistent with the calenders. I have multiple emails and then for some reason, I have 2 "family" calendars. If you add an event, make sure you're aware what calendar you are using! I'm still happy but it caused me some issues before I realized what was happening.
I have used this application since 3 years.it never disappointed me. Thanks making this app great.
Love it, wish the notes were better and supported s pen
I love this app. It syncs on my phone and tablet!!
Liked it a whole lot.
Great feature-filled planner with customizable project and to-do lists. Upgrading to pro was well worth the price.
Easy to use
Exactly what I was looking for in a digital planner!
clean, easy-to-use, dark mode.. not bad
Great so far, combines all my callenders into one place.
